9.2.56 MDT Location Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents requested location information as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = GNSS Second Bit = E-CID information. Other bits are reserved for future use and are ignored if received. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate". The eNB shall ignore the first bit unless the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit or the sixth bit set to "1". 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message then the target eNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6]. In particular, the target eNB shall, if supported: - if the Trace Activation IE does not include the MDT Configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT and Trace" initiate the requested trace session and MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT Only" initiate the requested MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6] and the target eNB shall ignore Interfaces To Trace IE, and Trace Depth IE; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Location Information IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, store this information and take it into account in the requested MDT session; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Signalling based MDT PLMN List IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, the eNB may use it to propagate the MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the UE Application layer measurement configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session and QoE Measurement Collection function as described in TS 36.300 [15]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Bluetooth Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the WLAN Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31].

9.2.64 MDT PLMN List - Section Description: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message then the target eNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6]. In particular, the target eNB shall, if supported: - if the Trace Activation IE does not include the MDT Configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT and Trace" initiate the requested trace session and MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT Only" initiate the requested MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6] and the target eNB shall ignore Interfaces To Trace IE, and Trace Depth IE; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Location Information IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, store this information and take it into account in the requested MDT session; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Signalling based MDT PLMN List IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, the eNB may use it to propagate the MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the UE Application layer measurement configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session and QoE Measurement Collection function as described in TS 36.300 [15]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Bluetooth Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the WLAN Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31].

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 - M6 Configuration IE - ifM6: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the seventh bit set to "1". 9.2.87 M6 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)
9.2.87 - M6 Delay Threshold IE - ifUL: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

9.2.56 - M7 Configuration IE - ifM7: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the eighth bit set to "1". 9.2.88 M7 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
9.2.88 M7 Collection Period IE Semantics: Unit: minutes

9.2.134 Bluetooth Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for Bluetooth measurement collection. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message then the target eNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6]. In particular, the target eNB shall, if supported: - if the Trace Activation IE does not include the MDT Configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT and Trace" initiate the requested trace session and MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT Only" initiate the requested MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6] and the target eNB shall ignore Interfaces To Trace IE, and Trace Depth IE; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Location Information IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, store this information and take it into account in the requested MDT session; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Signalling based MDT PLMN List IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, the eNB may use it to propagate the MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the UE Application layer measurement configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session and QoE Measurement Collection function as described in TS 36.300 [15]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Bluetooth Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the WLAN Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31].

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message then the target eNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6]. In particular, the target eNB shall, if supported: - if the Trace Activation IE does not include the MDT Configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT and Trace" initiate the requested trace session and MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT Only" initiate the requested MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6] and the target eNB shall ignore Interfaces To Trace IE, and Trace Depth IE; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Location Information IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, store this information and take it into account in the requested MDT session; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Signalling based MDT PLMN List IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, the eNB may use it to propagate the MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the UE Application layer measurement configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session and QoE Measurement Collection function as described in TS 36.300 [15]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Bluetooth Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the WLAN Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31].
9.2.134 BT RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].

9.2.135 WLAN Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message then the target eNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6]. In particular, the target eNB shall, if supported: - if the Trace Activation IE does not include the MDT Configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT and Trace" initiate the requested trace session and MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT Only" initiate the requested MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6] and the target eNB shall ignore Interfaces To Trace IE, and Trace Depth IE; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Location Information IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, store this information and take it into account in the requested MDT session; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Signalling based MDT PLMN List IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, the eNB may use it to propagate the MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the UE Application layer measurement configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session and QoE Measurement Collection function as described in TS 36.300 [15]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Bluetooth Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the WLAN Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31].

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message then the target eNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6]. In particular, the target eNB shall, if supported: - if the Trace Activation IE does not include the MDT Configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT and Trace" initiate the requested trace session and MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT Only" initiate the requested MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6] and the target eNB shall ignore Interfaces To Trace IE, and Trace Depth IE; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Location Information IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, store this information and take it into account in the requested MDT session; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Signalling based MDT PLMN List IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, the eNB may use it to propagate the MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the UE Application layer measurement configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session and QoE Measurement Collection function as described in TS 36.300 [15]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Bluetooth Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the WLAN Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RTT IE Semantics: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].

9.2.121 UE Application layer measurement configuration - Section Description: The IE defines configuration information for the QoE Measurement Collection (QMC) function. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Trace Activation IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message then the target eNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6]. In particular, the target eNB shall, if supported: - if the Trace Activation IE does not include the MDT Configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT and Trace" initiate the requested trace session and MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Activation IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, set to "Immediate MDT Only" initiate the requested MDT session as described in TS 32.422 [6] and the target eNB shall ignore Interfaces To Trace IE, and Trace Depth IE; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the MDT Location Information IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, store this information and take it into account in the requested MDT session; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Signalling based MDT PLMN List IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, the eNB may use it to propagate the MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]; - if the Trace Activation IE includes the UE Application layer measurement configuration IE, initiate the requested trace session and QoE Measurement Collection function as described in TS 36.300 [15]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the Bluetooth Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31]. - if the Trace Activation IE includes the WLAN Measurement Configuration IE, within the MDT Configuration IE, take it into account for MDT Configuration as described in TS 37.320 [31].
9.2.121 Container for application layer measurement configuration IE Semantics: Indicates application layer measurement configuration, see Annex L in [36].
9.2.121 TAC IE Semantics: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
ENUMERATED (QMC for streaming service, QMC for MTSI service, ...)
9.2.121 Service Type IE Semantics: This IE indicates the service type of UE application layer measurements.

9.2.33 SRVCC Operation Possible - Section Description: The IE indicates that both the UE and the MME are SRVCC-capable. E-UTRAN behaviour on reception of this is specified in TS 23.216 [20]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the SRVCC Operation Possible IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB shall store the content of such IE in the UE context and use it as defined in TS 23.216 [20].

9.2.52 CSG Membership Status - Section Description: This element indicates the membership status of the UE to a particular CSG. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.4 Abnormal Conditions If the target eNB receives a HANDOVER REQUEST message which does not contain the CSG Membership Status IE, and the target cell is a hybrid cell, the target eNB shall reject the procedure using the HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE message.

9.1.1.1 Mobility Information IE Semantics: Information related to the handover; the source eNB provides it in order to enable later analysis of the conditions that led to a wrong HO. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Mobility Information IE is provided in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB shall, if supported, store this information and use it as defined in TS 36.300 [15]. The target eNB shall, if supported, store the C-RNTI of the source cell received in the HANDOVER REQUEST message.

9.2.69 Masked IMEISV - Section Description: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment. 9.2.69 Masked IMEISV IE Semantics: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [29] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Masked IMEISV IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target eNB shall, if supported, use it to determine the characteristics of the UE for subsequent handling.

9.1.1.1 UE History Information from the UE IE Semantics: VisitedCellInfoList contained in the UEInformationResponse message (TS 36.331 [9]) 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the UE History Information from the UE IE in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB shall, if supported, store the collected information to be used for future handover preparations.

9.2.70 Expected UE Behaviour - Section Description: This IE defines the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the eNB/en-gNB in determining the optimum RRC connection time. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Expected UE Behaviour IE is provided in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB shall, if supported, store this information and may use it to determine the RRC connection time.
9.2.71 Expected UE Activity Behaviour - Section Description: Indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.401 [12].
9.2.71 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.71 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.71 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.
ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, …)

9.2.70 Expected HO Interval IE Semantics: Indicates the expected time interval between inter-eNB handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter-eNB handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.

9.2.78 ProSe Authorized - Section Description: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE for ProSe service(s). 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the ProSe Authorized IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message and it contains one or more IEs set to "authorized", the eNB shall, if supported, consider that the UE is authorized for the relevant ProSe service(s).
9.2.78 ProSe Direct Discovery IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Discovery
9.2.78 ProSe Direct Communication IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Communication
9.2.78 ProSe UE-to-Network Relaying IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized to act as ProSe UE-to-Network Relay

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Reference at the SeNB IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, which shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the UE Context Reference at the WT IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the WT UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message; the source eNB shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15].
9.2.22 Global eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.22 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB
9.2.22 Home eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying the cell controlled by the eNB

9.2.22 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

9.2.22 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

9.1.1.1 SeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.1.1.1 SeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB
9.1.1.1 Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the source eNB

9.2.93 V2X Services Authorized - Section Description: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE to use the sidelink for V2X services. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the V2X Services Authorized IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message and it contains one or more IEs set to "authorized", the eNB shall, if supported, consider that the UE is authorized for the relevant service(s).
9.2.93 Vehicle UE IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Vehicle UE
9.2.93 Pedestrian UE IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Pedestrian UE

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Reference at the SeNB IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, which shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the UE Context Reference at the WT IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the WT UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message; the source eNB shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15].
9.2.95 WT ID - Section Description: This IE is used to identify a WT.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.96 WT UE XwAP ID - Section Description: The WT UE XwAP ID is allocated by the WT and uniquely identifies a UE over the Xw interface.

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Reference at the SgNB IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 37.340 [32]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, which shall use this information as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.112 Global en-gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.112 en-gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the en-gNB.

9.1.1.1 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the SgNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.2.107 NR UE Security Capabilities - Section Description: This IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in NR as defined in TS 33.401 [18]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the NR UE Security Capabilities IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB shall, if supported, store this information in the UE context and send it to the respective peer node during subsequent handover preparations and/or EN-DC operations for the UE as defined in TS 33.401 [15].

9.2.107 NR Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, "first bit" – 128-NEA1, "second bit" – 128-NEA2, "third bit" – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.107 NR Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, "first bit" – 128-NIA1, "second bit" – 128-NIA2, "third bit" – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.129 Aerial UE subscription information - Section Description: This information element is used by the eNB to know if the UE is allowed to use aerial UE function, refer to TS 23.401[12]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Aerial UE subscription information IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB shall, if supported, store this information in the UE context and use it as defined in TS 36.300 [15].

9.2.136 Subscription Based UE Differentiation Information - Section Description: This IE is generated by the MME based on the UE subscription information, it provides the Subscription Based UE differentiation Information. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the Subscription Based UE Differentiation Information IE is included in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the eNB shall, if supported, store this information in the UE context for further use according to TS 23.401 [12].
9.2.136 Periodic Communication Indicator IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the UE communicates periodically or not, e.g. only on demand.
9.2.136 Periodic Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the interval time of periodic communication, the unit is: second
9.2.136 Scheduled Communication Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time zone and day of the week when the UE is available for communication.

9.2.136 Day of Week IE Semantics: If Day-Of-Week is not provided this shall be interpreted as every day of the week. Each position in the bitmap represents a day of the week: first bit = Mon, second bit =Tue, third bit =Wed, and so on. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘scheduled. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘not scheduled’.

9.2.136 Time of Day Start IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. If Time-Of-Day-Start is not provided, starting time shall be set to start of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.

9.2.136 Time of Day End IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. The value of this IE should be bigger than the value of Time of Day Start IE. If Time-Of-Day-End is not provided, ending time is end of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.
ENUMERATED (single packet, dual packets, multiple packets, …)

9.2.136 Traffic Profile IE Semantics: "single packet" indicates single packet transmission (UL or DL), "dual packets" indicates dual packet transmission (UL with subsequent DL, or DL with subsequent UL), "multiple packets" indicates multiple packets transmission.
ENUMERATED (battery powered, battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable, not battery powered, …)

9.2.136 Battery Indication IE Semantics: "battery powered" indicates that the UE is battery powered and the battery is rechargeable/replaceable, "battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable" indicates that the UE is battery powered but the battery is not rechargeable/replaceable, "not battery powered" indicates that the UE is not battery powered.

section_list.name: HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by the target eNB to inform the source eNB about the prepared resources at the target.
Direction: target eNB ? source eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.1.2 Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the source eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.1.2 New eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the target eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If at least one of the requested non-GBR E-RABs is admitted to the cell indicated by the Target Cell ID IE, the target eNB shall reserve necessary resources, and send the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message back to the source eNB. The target eNB shall include the E-RABs for which resources have been prepared at the target cell in the E-RABs Admitted List IE. The target eNB shall include the E-RABs that have not been admitted in the E-RABs Not Admitted List IE with an appropriate cause value.

8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the source eNB proposes to do forwarding of downlink data, the source eNB shall include the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Setup Item IE of the HANDOVER REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the target eNB may include the DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted Item IE of the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e. the information contained in the Transport Layer address IE and GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Switched in Downlink List IE of the PATH SWITCH REQUEST message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.1.2 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of UL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.

9.1.1.2 Target eNB To Source eNB Transparent Container IE Semantics: Includes the RRC E-UTRA Handover Command message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 in TS 36.331 [9]

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.2.85 UE Context Kept Indicator - Section Description: This IE indicates that the UE Context at the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS 36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Reference at the SeNB IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, which shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the UE Context Reference at the WT IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the WT UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message; the source eNB shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the UE Context Reference at the SgNB IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 37.340 [32]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, which shall use this information as specified in TS 37.340 [32]. If the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" and the E-RABs transferred to MeNB IE are included in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, then the source eNB shall, if supported, include the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status received from the SgNB in the SN Status Transfer procedure towards the target eNB, as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.1.1.2 Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the source eNB
9.1.1.2 New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the target eNB

9.1.1.2 WT UE Context Kept Indicator IE Semantics: Indicates that the WT has acknowledged to keep the UE context 9.2.85 UE Context Kept Indicator - Section Description: This IE indicates that the UE Context at the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS 36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32]. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Reference at the SeNB IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, which shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the UE Context Reference at the WT IE is contained in the HANDOVER REQUEST message, the target eNB may use it as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. In this case, the source eNB may expect the target eNB to include the WT UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message; the source eNB shall use this information as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

9.1.1.2 E-RABs transferred to MeNB IE Semantics: In case of EN-DC, indicates that SN Status is needed for the listed E-RABs from the SgNB.. 9.2.28 E-RAB List - Section Description: The IE contains a list of E-RAB identities with a cause value. It is used for example to indicate not admitted bearers. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" and the E-RABs transferred to MeNB IE are included in the HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, then the source eNB shall, if supported, include the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status received from the SgNB in the SN Status Transfer procedure towards the target eNB, as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

section_list.name: HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the target eNB to inform the source eNB that the Handover Preparation has failed.
Direction: target eNB ? source eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.1.3 Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the source eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol. 8.2.1 Handover Preparation 8.2.1.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the target eNB does not admit at least one non-GBR E-RAB, or a failure occurs during the Handover Preparation, the target eNB shall send the HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE message to the source eNB. The message shall contain the Cause IE with an appropriate value. If there is no response from the target eNB to the HANDOVER REQUEST message before timer TRELOCprep expires in the source eNB, the source eNB should cancel the Handover Preparation procedure towards the target eNB by initiating the Handover Cancel procedure with the appropriate value for the Cause IE. The source eNB shall ignore any HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE or HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE message received after the initiation of the Handover Cancel procedure and remove any reference and release any resources related to the concerned X2 UE-associated signalling.

section_list.name: SN STATUS TRANSFER
aoa:
This message is sent by the source eNB to the target eNB to transfer the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status during a handover or for EN-DC.
Direction: source eNB ? target eNB (handover), eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred ? eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred (RRC connection re-establishment or dual connectivity), MeNB/en-gNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred ? en-gNB/MeNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred (EN-DC).
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.1.4 Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB sends the message to the MeNB, then the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE shall be included in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, while the Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE is ignored. The SgNB UE X2AP ID IE is used as the old UE ID.

9.1.1.4 New eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation If the MeNB sends the message to the en-gNB, then the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE shall be included in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, while the New eNB UE X2AP ID IE is ignored. The SgNB UE X2AP ID IE is used as the new UE ID.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation The E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer List IE included in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message contains the E-RAB ID(s) corresponding to the E-RAB(s) for which PDCP SN and HFN status preservation shall be applied.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE. For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.1.4 Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs IE Semantics: PDCP Sequence Number = (First Missing SDU Number + bit position) modulo 4096 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation If the source eNB includes in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the information on the missing and received uplink SDUs in the Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs IE or Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs Extended IE or Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs for PDCP SN Length 18 IE for each E-RAB for which the source eNB has accepted the request from the target eNB for uplink forwarding, then the target eNB may use it in a Status Report message sent to the UE over the radio.

9.1.1.4 UL COUNT Value IE Semantics: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN 9.2.15 COUNT Value - Section Description: This information element indicates the 12 bit PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bit Hyper frame number. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE. For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.

9.1.1.4 DL COUNT Value IE Semantics: PDCP-SN and Hyper frame number that the target eNB/en-gNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 12 bit long PDCP-SN 9.2.15 COUNT Value - Section Description: This information element indicates the 12 bit PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bit Hyper frame number. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE. For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.
│     ├─Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs Extended

9.1.1.4 Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs Extended IE Semantics: The IE is used in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN in this release. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation If the source eNB includes in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the information on the missing and received uplink SDUs in the Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs IE or Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs Extended IE or Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs for PDCP SN Length 18 IE for each E-RAB for which the source eNB has accepted the request from the target eNB for uplink forwarding, then the target eNB may use it in a Status Report message sent to the UE over the radio.

9.1.1.4 UL COUNT Value Extended IE Semantics: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN 9.2.66 COUNT Value Extended - Section Description: This information element indicates the 15 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 17 bit long Hyper Frame Number. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE. For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.

9.1.1.4 DL COUNT Value Extended IE Semantics: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target eNB/en-gNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 15 bit long PDCP-SN 9.2.66 COUNT Value Extended - Section Description: This information element indicates the 15 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 17 bit long Hyper Frame Number. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE. For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.
│     ├─Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs for PDCP SN Length 18

9.1.1.4 Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs for PDCP SN Length 18 IE Semantics: The IE is used in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation If the source eNB includes in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the information on the missing and received uplink SDUs in the Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs IE or Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs Extended IE or Receive Status Of UL PDCP SDUs for PDCP SN Length 18 IE for each E-RAB for which the source eNB has accepted the request from the target eNB for uplink forwarding, then the target eNB may use it in a Status Report message sent to the UE over the radio.
│     ├─UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18

9.1.1.4 UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE Semantics: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN 9.2.82 COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 - Section Description: This information element indicates the 18 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 14 bit long Hyper Frame Number. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE. For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.
│     └─DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18

9.1.1.4 DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE Semantics: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target eNB/en-gNB should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 18 bit long PDCP-SN 9.2.82 COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 - Section Description: This information element indicates the 18 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 14 bit long Hyper Frame Number. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE.

8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the DL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall use it to mark with the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE the first downlink packet for which there is no PDCP SN yet assigned. If the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the DL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the DL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the DL COUNT Value IE. For each E-RAB for which the UL COUNT Value IE is received in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, the target eNB shall not deliver any uplink packet which has a PDCP SN lower than the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of this IE. If the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE is included in the E-RABs Subject To Status Transfer Item IE, the target eNB shall, if supported, use the value contained in the PDCP-SN Extended IE of the UL COUNT Value Extended IE or PDCP-SN Length 18 IE of the UL COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 IE instead of the value contained in the PDCP-SN IE of the UL COUNT Value IE.
9.1.1.4 Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB from which the E-RAB context is transferred.
9.1.1.4 New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the eNB to which the E-RAB context is transferred.

9.1.1.4 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated for EN-DC at the SgNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.2.2 SN Status Transfer 8.2.2.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB sends the message to the MeNB, then the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE shall be included in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, while the Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE is ignored. The SgNB UE X2AP ID IE is used as the old UE ID. If the MeNB sends the message to the en-gNB, then the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE shall be included in the SN STATUS TRANSFER message, while the New eNB UE X2AP ID IE is ignored. The SgNB UE X2AP ID IE is used as the new UE ID.

section_list.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE
aoa:
This message is sent by the target eNB to the source eNB to indicate that resources can be released.
Direction: target eNB ? source eNB (handover), MeNB ? SeNB (dual connectivity), MeNB ? en-gNB (EN-DC).
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.1.5 Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity at the SeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.2.3 UE Context Release 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation In the course of signalling for EN-DC, the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE shall be included in the UE CONTEXT RELEASE message, while the Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE is ignored. The SgNB UE X2AP ID IE is used as the new UE ID.

9.1.1.5 New eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the target eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.1.1.5 Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity at the SeNB.
9.1.1.5 New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated for handover at the source eNB and for dual connectivity/EN-DC at the MeNB.

9.1.1.5 SIPTO Bearer Deactivation Indication IE Semantics: Indicates that SIPTO@LN PDN connection deactivation is needed. 8.2.3 UE Context Release 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the UE CONTEXT RELEASE message, the SeNB may release radio and control plane related resources associated to the UE context. For E-RABs for which data forwarding has been performed, the SeNB should continue forwarding of U-plane data as long as packets are received at the SeNB from the EPC or the SeNB buffer has not been emptied (an implementation dependent mechanism decides that data forwarding can be stopped). The SeNB supporting L-GW function for LIPA operation shall also request using intra-node signalling the collocated L-GW to release the LIPA PDN connection as defined in TS 23.401 [12]. If the SIPTO Bearer Deactivation Indication IE is received in the UE CONTEXT RELEASE message, the SeNB supporting L-GW function for SIPTO@LN operation shall also request using intra-node signalling the collocated L-GW to release the SIPTO@LN PDN connection as defined in TS 23.401 [12].

9.1.1.5 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated for EN-DC at the SgNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.2.3 UE Context Release 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation In the course of signalling for EN-DC, the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE shall be included in the UE CONTEXT RELEASE message, while the Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE is ignored. The SgNB UE X2AP ID IE is used as the new UE ID.

section_list.name: HANDOVER CANCEL
aoa:
This message is sent by the source eNB to the target eNB to cancel an ongoing handover.
Direction: source eNB ? target eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.1.6 Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the source eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.1.6 New eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the target eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)
9.1.1.6 Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the source eNB
9.1.1.6 New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the target eNB

section_list.name: LOAD INFORMATION
aoa:
This message is sent by an eNB to neighbouring eNBs to transfer load and interference co-ordination information.
Direction: eNB1 ? eNB2.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.1 Cell ID IE Semantics: Id of the source cell 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.3.1 Load Indication 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the UL High Interference Indication IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, it indicates, per PRB, the occurrence of high interference sensitivity, as seen from the sending eNB. The receiving eNB should try to avoid scheduling cell edge UEs in its cells for the concerned PRBs. The Target Cell ID IE received within the UL High Interference Information IE group in the LOAD INFORMATION message indicates the cell for which the corresponding UL High Interference Indication is meant. The receiving eNB shall consider the value of the UL High Interference Information IE group valid until reception of a new LOAD INFORMATION message carrying an update.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.17 UL Interference Overload Indication - Section Description: This IE provides, per PRB, a report on interference overload. The interaction between the indication of UL Interference Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific. 8.3.1 Load Indication 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the UL Interference Overload Indication IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, it indicates the interference level experienced by the indicated cell on all resource blocks, per PRB. If the Extended UL Interference Overload Info IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, the UL Interference Overload Indication IE indicates the interference level experienced by the indicated cell ignoring the UL subframe(s) represented as value "1" in the Associated Subframes IE. The receiving eNB may take such information into account when setting its scheduling policy and shall consider the received UL Interference Overload Indication IE value valid until reception of a new LOAD INFORMATION message carrying an update of the same IE. If the Extended UL Interference Overload Info IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, the Extended UL Interference Overload Indication IE indicates the interference level experienced by the indicated cell on all resource blocks, per PRB, in the UL subframe(s) which is represented as value "1" in the Associated Subframes IE. The receiving eNB may take such information into account when setting its scheduling policy and shall consider the received Extended UL Interference Overload Info IE value valid until reception of a new LOAD INFORMATION message carrying an update of the same IE.
ENUMERATED (high interference, medium interference, low interference, …)

9.2.17 UL Interference Overload Indication IE Semantics: Each PRB is identified by its position in the list: the first element in the list corresponds to PRB 0, the second to PRB 1, etc. 8.3.1 Load Indication 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the UL Interference Overload Indication IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, it indicates the interference level experienced by the indicated cell on all resource blocks, per PRB. If the Extended UL Interference Overload Info IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, the UL Interference Overload Indication IE indicates the interference level experienced by the indicated cell ignoring the UL subframe(s) represented as value "1" in the Associated Subframes IE. The receiving eNB may take such information into account when setting its scheduling policy and shall consider the received UL Interference Overload Indication IE value valid until reception of a new LOAD INFORMATION message carrying an update of the same IE. If the Extended UL Interference Overload Info IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, the Extended UL Interference Overload Indication IE indicates the interference level experienced by the indicated cell on all resource blocks, per PRB, in the UL subframe(s) which is represented as value "1" in the Associated Subframes IE. The receiving eNB may take such information into account when setting its scheduling policy and shall consider the received Extended UL Interference Overload Info IE value valid until reception of a new LOAD INFORMATION message carrying an update of the same IE.

8.3.1 Load Indication 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the UL High Interference Indication IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, it indicates, per PRB, the occurrence of high interference sensitivity, as seen from the sending eNB. The receiving eNB should try to avoid scheduling cell edge UEs in its cells for the concerned PRBs. The Target Cell ID IE received within the UL High Interference Information IE group in the LOAD INFORMATION message indicates the cell for which the corresponding UL High Interference Indication is meant. The receiving eNB shall consider the value of the UL High Interference Information IE group valid until reception of a new LOAD INFORMATION message carrying an update.

9.1.2.1 Target Cell ID IE Semantics: Id of the cell for which the HII is meant 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.3.1 Load Indication 8.3.1.2 Successful Operation If the UL High Interference Indication IE is received in the LOAD INFORMATION message, it indicates, per PRB, the occurrence of high interference sensitivity, as seen from the sending eNB.
