section_list.name: RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE
aoa:
This message is sent by eNB2 to neighbouring eNB1 to report the results of the requested measurements.
Direction: eNB2 ? eNB1.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.1.2.14 eNB1 Measurement ID IE Semantics: Allocated by eNB1
9.1.2.14 eNB2 Measurement ID IE Semantics: Allocated by eNB2

8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.2 Successful Operation If the eNB1 receives the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message, which includes the Cell Reporting Indicator IE set to "stop request" in one or more items of the Cell Measurement Result IE, the eNB1 should initialise the Resource Status Reporting Initiation procedure to remove all or some of the corresponding cells from the measurement.
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.34 Hardware Load Indicator - Section Description: The Hardware Load Indicator IE indicates the status of the Hardware Load experienced by the cell. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If the Reporting Periodicity IE is included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message, eNB2 shall use its value as the time interval between two subsequent RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE messages that include the Radio Resource Status IE, S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, Hardware Load Indicator IE, Composite Available Capacity Group IE, or ABS Status IE.
9.2.36 Load Indicator - Section Description: The Load Indicator IE indicates the status of Load.
9.2.36 Load Indicator - Section Description: The Load Indicator IE indicates the status of Load.

9.2.35 S1 TNL Load Indicator - Section Description: The S1 TNL Load Indicator IE indicates the status of the S1 Transport Network Load experienced by the cell. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If the Reporting Periodicity IE is included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message, eNB2 shall use its value as the time interval between two subsequent RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE messages that include the Radio Resource Status IE, S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, Hardware Load Indicator IE, Composite Available Capacity Group IE, or ABS Status IE.
9.2.36 Load Indicator - Section Description: The Load Indicator IE indicates the status of Load.
9.2.36 Load Indicator - Section Description: The Load Indicator IE indicates the status of Load.

9.2.37 Radio Resource Status - Section Description: The Radio Resource Status IE indicates the usage of the PRBs for all traffic in Downlink and Uplink (TS 36.314 [22], TS 23.203 [13]) and the usage of PDCCH CCEs for Downlink and Uplink scheduling. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If the Reporting Periodicity IE is included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message, eNB2 shall use its value as the time interval between two subsequent RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE messages that include the Radio Resource Status IE, S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, Hardware Load Indicator IE, Composite Available Capacity Group IE, or ABS Status IE.

9.2.44 Composite Available Capacity Group - Section Description: The Composite Available Capacity Group IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in Downlink and Uplink. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If the Reporting Periodicity IE is included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message, eNB2 shall use its value as the time interval between two subsequent RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE messages that include the Radio Resource Status IE, S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, Hardware Load Indicator IE, Composite Available Capacity Group IE, or ABS Status IE.

9.2.44 Composite Available Capacity Downlink IE Semantics: For the Downlink 9.2.45 Composite Available Capacity - Section Description: The Composite Available Capacity IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink or Uplink.

9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value - Section Description: The Cell Capacity Class Value IE indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources that are configured for traffic purposes. 9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value IE Semantics: Value 1 shall indicate the minimum cell capacity, and 100 shall indicate the maximum cell capacity. There should be a linear relation between cell capacity and Cell Capacity Class Value. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1.

9.2.45 Capacity Value IE Semantics: ‘0’ indicates no resource is available, Measured on a linear scale. 9.2.47 Capacity Value - Section Description: The Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources that are available relative to the total E-UTRAN resources. The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum E-UTRAN resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available. 9.2.47 Capacity Value IE Semantics: Value 0 shall indicate no available capacity, and 100 shall indicate maximum available capacity . Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1.

9.2.44 Composite Available Capacity Uplink IE Semantics: For the Uplink 9.2.45 Composite Available Capacity - Section Description: The Composite Available Capacity IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink or Uplink.

9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value - Section Description: The Cell Capacity Class Value IE indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources that are configured for traffic purposes. 9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value IE Semantics: Value 1 shall indicate the minimum cell capacity, and 100 shall indicate the maximum cell capacity. There should be a linear relation between cell capacity and Cell Capacity Class Value. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1.

9.2.45 Capacity Value IE Semantics: ‘0’ indicates no resource is available, Measured on a linear scale. 9.2.47 Capacity Value - Section Description: The Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources that are available relative to the total E-UTRAN resources. The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum E-UTRAN resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available. 9.2.47 Capacity Value IE Semantics: Value 0 shall indicate no available capacity, and 100 shall indicate maximum available capacity . Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1.

9.2.58 ABS Status - Section Description: The ABS Status IE is used to aid the eNB designating ABS to evaluate the need for modification of the ABS pattern. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If the Reporting Periodicity IE is included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message, eNB2 shall use its value as the time interval between two subsequent RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE messages that include the Radio Resource Status IE, S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, Hardware Load Indicator IE, Composite Available Capacity Group IE, or ABS Status IE. 8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.4 Abnormal Conditions If the eNB1 receives a RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message which includes the ABS Status IE, and all bits in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE are set to '0', the eNB1 shall ignore the DL ABS Status IE.

9.2.58 DL ABS status IE Semantics: Percentage of used ABS resources. The numerator of the percentage calculation consists of resource blocks within the ABS indicated in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE allocated by the eNB2 for DL traffic needing protection by ABS from inter-cell interference for DL scheduling, or allocated by the eNB2 for other reasons (e.g. some control channels). The denominator of the percentage calculation is the total quantity of resource blocks within the ABS indicated in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE. 8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.4 Abnormal Conditions If the eNB1 receives a RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message which includes the ABS Status IE, and all bits in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE are set to '0', the eNB1 shall ignore the DL ABS status IE.
9.2.58 CHOICE Usable ABS Information IE Semantics: –

9.2.58 Usable ABS Pattern Info IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS that has been designated as protected from inter-cell interference by the eNB1, and available to serve this purpose for DL scheduling in the eNB2’ and value "0" is used for all other subframes. The pattern represented by the bitmap is a subset of, or the same as, the corresponding ABS Pattern Info IE conveyed in the LOAD INFORMATION message from the eNB1. 8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.4 Abnormal Conditions If the eNB1 receives a RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message which includes the ABS Status IE, and all bits in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE are set to '0', the eNB1 shall ignore the DL ABS Status IE.

9.2.58 Usable ABS Pattern Info IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS that has been designated as protected from inter-cell interference by the eNB1, and available to serve this purpose for DL scheduling in the eNB2’ and value "0" is used for all other subframes. The pattern represented by the bitmap is a subset of, or the same as, the corresponding ABS Pattern Info IE conveyed in the LOAD INFORMATION message from the eNB1. 8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.4 Abnormal Conditions If the eNB1 receives a RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message which includes the ABS Status IE, and all bits in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE are set to '0', the eNB1 shall ignore the DL ABS Status IE.

9.2.76 RSRP Measurement Report List - Section Description: This IE provides RSRP measurement reports of UEs served by the sending eNB. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If the Reporting Periodicity of RSRP Measurement Report IE is included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message, eNB2 shall use its value as the minimum time interval between two subsequent RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE messages that include the RSRP Measurement Report List IE. 8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.2 Successful Operation If the eNB1 receives the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message which includes the UE ID IE in the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, the eNB1 may use the UE ID IE to link the associated RSRP measurement report with other measurement results (e.g. CSI reports, RSRP measurement reports) of the same UE.

9.2.76 RSRP Cell ID IE Semantics: ID of the cell on which the RSRP is measured. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.76 RSRP Measured IE Semantics: Measured RSRP. Defined in TS 36.331 [9].

9.2.76 UE ID IE Semantics: ID assigned by eNB2 for the UE. 8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.2 Successful Operation If the eNB1 receives the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message which includes the UE ID IE in the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, the eNB1 may use the UE ID IE to link the associated RSRP measurement report with other measurement results (e.g. CSI reports, RSRP measurement reports) of the same UE.

9.2.79 CSI Report - Section Description: This IE provides CSI reports of UEs served by the cell for which the information is provided. 8.3.6 Resource Status Reporting Initiation 8.3.6.2 Successful Operation The Report Characteristics IE indicates the type of objects eNB2 shall perform measurements on. For each cell, the eNB2 shall include in the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message: - the Radio Resource Status IE, if the first bit, "PRB Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the S1 TNL Load Indicator IE, if the second bit, "TNL Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Hardware Load Indicator IE, if the third bit, "HW Load Ind Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, if the fourth bit, "Composite Available Capacity Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If Cell Capacity Class Value IE is included within the Composite Available Capacity Group IE, this IE is used to assign weights to the available capacity indicated in the Capacity Value IE; - the ABS Status IE, if the fifth bit, "ABS Status Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1 and eNB1 had indicated the ABS pattern to eNB2; - the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, if the sixth bit, "RSRP Measurement Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1; - the CSI Report IE, if the seventh bit, "CSI Report Periodic" of the Report Characteristics IE included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message is set to 1. If the Reporting Periodicity of CSI Report IE is included in the RESOURCE STATUS REQUEST message, eNB2 shall use its value as the minimum time interval between two subsequent RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE messages that include the CSI Report IE.

9.2.79 UE ID IE Semantics: ID assigned by eNB2 for the UE. 8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.2 Successful Operation If the eNB1 receives the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message which includes the UE ID IE in the RSRP Measurement Report List IE, the eNB1 may use the UE ID IE to link the associated RSRP measurement report with other measurement results (e.g. CSI reports, RSRP measurement reports) of the same UE.
9.2.79 CSI Process Configuration Index IE Semantics: Indicates one of the possible CSI Process configurations in the serving cell.
9.2.79 RI IE Semantics: The RI corresponding to the CQI being reported for this CSI process item. Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 Wideband CQI - Section Description: This IE indicates the Wideband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 Wideband CQI Codeword 0 IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 3-bit spatial differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.79 Subband Size IE Semantics: Corresponds to a value of subband size k defined in TS 36.213 [11] for the system bandwidth.
9.2.81 Subband CQI - Section Description: This IE indicates the Subband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit Subband differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 3-bit spatial differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit Subband differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

8.3.7 Resource Status Reporting 8.3.7.2 Successful Operation If the eNB1 receives the RESOURCE STATUS UPDATE message, which includes the Cell Reporting Indicator IE set to "stop request" in one or more items of the Cell Measurement Result IE, the eNB1 should initialise the Resource Status Reporting Initiation procedure to remove all or some of the corresponding cells from the measurement.

section_list.name: MOBILITY CHANGE REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by an eNB1 to neighbouring eNB2 to initiate adaptation of mobility parameters.
Direction: eNB1 ? eNB2.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.2.15 eNB1 Mobility Parameters IE Semantics: Configuration change in eNB1 cell 9.2.48 Mobility Parameters Information - Section Description: The Mobility Parameters Information IE contains the change of the Handover Trigger as compared to its current value. The Handover Trigger corresponds to the threshold at which a cell initialises the handover preparation procedure towards a specific neighbour cell. Positive value of the change means the handover is proposed to take place later. 9.2.48 Handover Trigger Change IE Semantics: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

9.1.2.15 eNB2 Proposed Mobility Parameters IE Semantics: Proposed configuration change in eNB2 cell 9.2.48 Mobility Parameters Information - Section Description: The Mobility Parameters Information IE contains the change of the Handover Trigger as compared to its current value. The Handover Trigger corresponds to the threshold at which a cell initialises the handover preparation procedure towards a specific neighbour cell. Positive value of the change means the handover is proposed to take place later. 9.2.48 Handover Trigger Change IE Semantics: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

section_list.name: MOBILITY CHANGE ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB2 to indicate that the eNB2 Proposed Mobility Parameter proposed by eNB1 was accepted.
Direction: eNB2 ? eNB1.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB2 to indicate that the eNB2 Proposed Mobility Parameter proposed by eNB1 was refused.
Direction: eNB2 ? eNB1.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol. 8.3.8 Mobility Settings Change 8.3.8.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the requested parameter modification is refused by the eNB2, or if the eNB2 is not able to complete the procedure, the eNB2 shall send a MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message with the Cause IE set to an appropriate value. The eNB2 may include eNB2 Mobility Parameters Modification Range IE in MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message, for example in cases when the proposed change is out of permitted range.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.49 Mobility Parameters Modification Range - Section Description: The Mobility Parameters Modification Range IE contains the range of Handover Trigger Change values permitted by the eNB2 at the moment the MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message is sent. 8.3.8 Mobility Settings Change 8.3.8.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the requested parameter modification is refused by the eNB2, or if the eNB2 is not able to complete the procedure, the eNB2 shall send a MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message with the Cause IE set to an appropriate value. The eNB2 may include eNB2 Mobility Parameters Modification Range IE in MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message, for example in cases when the proposed change is out of permitted range.
9.2.49 Handover Trigger Change Lower Limit IE Semantics: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.
9.2.49 Handover Trigger Change Upper Limit IE Semantics: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: RLF INDICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB2 to indicate an RRC re-establishment attempt or a reception of an RLF Report from a UE that suffered a connection failure at eNB1.
Direction: eNB2 ? eNB1.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.18 Failure cell PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell Identifier 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the RRC Conn Setup Indicator IE is present in the RLF INDICATION message, the eNB1 shall ignore the values in the Failure cell PCI IE, Re-establishment cell ECGI IE, C-RNTI IE and ShortMAC-I IE.

9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation eNB2 may include the UE RLF Report Container IE and optionally also the UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE in the RLF INDICATION message, which may be used by the eNB1 to determine the nature of the failure. If the UE RLF Report Container IE is included in the RLF INDICATION message sent after successful re-establishment, the eNB2 shall use the Re-establishment cell ECGI IE in the RLF INDICATION message to indicate the ECGI of the cell where the re-establishment was successful. If the RRC Conn Setup Indicator IE is present in the RLF INDICATION message, the eNB1 shall ignore the values in the Failure cell PCI IE, Re-establishment cell ECGI IE, C-RNTI IE and ShortMAC-I IE.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.2.18 C-RNTI IE Semantics: C-RNTI contained in the RRC Re-establishment Request message (TS 36.331 [9]) 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation If the RRC Conn Setup Indicator IE is present in the RLF INDICATION message, the eNB1 shall ignore the values in the Failure cell PCI IE, Re-establishment cell ECGI IE, C-RNTI IE and ShortMAC-I IE.

9.1.2.18 ShortMAC-I IE Semantics: ShortMAC-I contained in the RRC Re-establishment Request message (TS 36.331 [9]) 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation eNB2 may include the ShortMAC-I IE in the RLF INDICATION message, e.g., in order to aid the eNB1 to resolve a potential PCI confusion situation or to aid the eNB1 to identify the UE. If the RRC Conn Setup Indicator IE is present in the RLF INDICATION message, the eNB1 shall ignore the values in the Failure cell PCI IE, Re-establishment cell ECGI IE, C-RNTI IE and ShortMAC-I IE.

9.1.2.18 UE RLF Report Container IE Semantics: RLF -Report-r9 IE contained in the UEInformationResponse message (TS 36.331 [9]) 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation eNB2 may include the UE RLF Report Container IE and optionally also the UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE in the RLF INDICATION message, which may be used by the eNB1 to determine the nature of the failure. If the UE RLF Report Container IE is included in the RLF INDICATION message sent after successful re-establishment, the eNB2 shall use the Re-establishment Cell ECGI IE in the RLF INDICATION message to indicate the ECGI of the cell where the re-establishment was successful. 8.3.10 Handover Report 8.3.10.2 Successful Operation If the UE RLF Report received from the eNB sending the RLF INDICATION message, as described in TS 36.300 [15], is available, the eNB1 may also include it in the HANDOVER REPORT as UE RLF Report Container IE and optionally also UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE.

9.1.2.18 RRC Conn Setup Indicator IE Semantics: Included if the RLF Report within the UE RLF Report Container IE is retrieved after an RRC connection setup or an incoming successful handover 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation eNB2 may include the RRC Conn Setup Indicator IE in the RLF INDICATION message, which indicates that the RLF Report is retrieved after an RRC connection setup or an incoming successful handover. If the RRC Conn Setup Indicator IE is present in the RLF INDICATION message, the eNB1 shall ignore the values in the Failure cell PCI IE, Re-establishment cell ECGI IE, C-RNTI IE and ShortMAC-I IE.

9.1.2.18 RRC Conn Reestab Indicator IE Semantics: The Reestablishment Cause in RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message(TS 36.331 [9]) 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation eNB2 may include the RRC Conn Reestab Indicator IE in the RLF INDICATION message, which may be used by the eNB1 to determine where the failure occurred.
└─UE RLF Report Container for extended bands

9.1.2.18 UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE Semantics: RLF-Report-v9e0 IE contained in the UEInformationResponse message (TS 36.331 [9]) 8.3.9 Radio Link Failure Indication 8.3.9.2 Successful Operation eNB2 may include the UE RLF Report Container IE and optionally also the UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE in the RLF INDICATION message, which may be used by the eNB1 to determine the nature of the failure. If the UE RLF Report Container IE is included in the RLF INDICATION message sent after successful re-establishment, the eNB2 shall use the Re-establishment Cell ECGI IE in the RLF INDICATION message to indicate the ECGI of the cell where the re-establishment was successful. 8.3.10 Handover Report 8.3.10.2 Successful Operation If the UE RLF Report received from the eNB sending the RLF INDICATION message, as described in TS 36.300 [15], is available, the eNB1 may also include it in the HANDOVER REPORT as UE RLF Report Container IE and optionally also UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE.

section_list.name: HANDOVER REPORT
aoa:
This message is sent by the eNB1 to report a handover failure event or other critical mobility problem.
Direction: eNB1 ? eNB2.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
ENUMERATED (HO too early, HO to wrong cell, …, InterRAT ping-pong)

8.3.10 Handover Report 8.3.10.2 Successful Operation The report contains the source and target cells, and cause of the handover. If the Handover Report Type IE is set to "HO to wrong cell", then the Re-establishment cell ECGI IE shall be included in the HANDOVER REPORT message. If the Handover Report Type IE is set to "InterRAT ping-pong", then the Target cell in UTRAN IE shall be included in the HANDOVER REPORT message.

9.1.2.19 Handover Cause IE Semantics: Indicates handover cause employed for handover from eNB2 9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.1.2.19 Source cell ECGI IE Semantics: ECGI of source cell for handover procedure (in eNB2) 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.2.19 Failure cell ECGI IE Semantics: ECGI of target cell for handover procedure (in eNB1) 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.2.19 - Re-establishment cell ECGI IE - ifHandoverReportTypeHoToWrongCell: ifHandoverReportTypeHoToWrongCell 9.1.2.19 Re-establishment cell ECGI IE Semantics: ECGI of cell where UE attempted re-establishment 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.3.10 Handover Report 8.3.10.2 Successful Operation The report contains the source and target cells, and cause of the handover. If the Handover Report Type IE is set to "HO to wrong cell", then the Re-establishment cell ECGI IE shall be included in the HANDOVER REPORT message. If the Handover Report Type IE is set to "InterRAT ping-pong", then the Target cell in UTRAN IE shall be included in the HANDOVER REPORT message.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.2.19 - Target cell in UTRAN IE - ifHandoverReportTypeInterRATpingpong: ifHandoverReportTypeInterRATpingpong 9.1.2.19 Target cell in UTRAN IE Semantics: Encoded according to UTRAN Cell ID in the Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information IE, as defined in in TS 25.413 [24] 8.3.10 Handover Report 8.3.10.2 Successful Operation The report contains the source and target cells, and cause of the handover. If the Handover Report Type IE is set to "HO to wrong cell", then the Re-establishment cell ECGI IE shall be included in the HANDOVER REPORT message. If the Handover Report Type IE is set to "InterRAT ping-pong", then the Target cell in UTRAN IE shall be included in the HANDOVER REPORT message.

9.1.2.19 Source cell C-RNTI IE Semantics: C-RNTI allocated at the source eNB (in eNB2) contained in the AS-config (TS 36.331 [9]). 8.3.10 Handover Report 8.3.10.2 Successful Operation If the UE-related information is available in eNB1, the eNB1 should include in HANDOVER REPORT message: - the Mobility Information IE, if the Mobility Information IE was sent for this handover from eNB2; - the Source cell C-RNTI IE.

9.1.2.19 Mobility Information IE Semantics: Information provided in the HANDOVER REQUEST message from eNB2. 8.3.10 Handover Report 8.3.10.2 Successful Operation If the UE-related information is available in eNB1, the eNB1 should include in HANDOVER REPORT message: - the Mobility Information IE, if the Mobility Information IE was sent for this handover from eNB2; - the Source cell C-RNTI IE.
9.1.2.19 UE RLF Report Container IE Semantics: The UE RLF Report Container IE received in the RLF INDICATION message.
└─UE RLF Report Container for extended bands
9.1.2.19 UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE Semantics: The UE RLF Report Container for extended bands IE received in the RLF INDICATION message.

section_list.name: CELL ACTIVATION REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer eNB to request a previously switched-off cell(s) to be re-activated.
Direction: eNB1 ? eNB2.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

section_list.name: CELL ACTIVATION RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer eNB to indicate that one or more cell(s) previously switched-off has(have) been activated.
Direction: eNB2 ? eNB1.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: CELL ACTIVATION FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer eNB to indicate cell activation failure.
Direction: eNB2 ? eNB1.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
