section_list.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the new eNB to request the old eNB to transfer the UE Context to the new eNB.
Direction: new eNB ? old eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.28 New eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the new eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.1.2.28 New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the new eNB
9.2.91 Resume ID - Section Description: The Resume ID IE is used to address a suspended UE Context within an eNB.

9.2.91 Resume ID not truncated IE Semantics: 40 bit Resume Resume Identity contained in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message (TS 36.331 [9]). The 20 most significant bits refer to the eNB ID of the eNB that allocated the Resume ID, the 20 least significant bits identify the UE Context stored at the eNB that allocated the Resume ID.

9.2.91 Resume ID truncated IE Semantics: 24 bit Resume Identity contained in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message (TS 36.331 [9]). The 12 most significant bits refer to the 12 least significant bits of the eNB ID of the eNB that allocated the Resume ID. The 12 least significant bits refer to the 12 least significant bits that identify the UE Context stored at the eNB that allocated the Resume ID.

9.1.2.28 ShortMAC-I IE Semantics: RRC Resume: Corresponds to the ShortResumeMAC-I in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [9] RRC Reestablishment: Corresponds to the ShortMAC-I in the RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequestmessage as defined in TS 36.331 [9].

9.1.2.28 New E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: RRC Resume: Corresponds to the cellIdentity within the VarShortResumeMAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [9]. RRC Reestablishment: Corresponds to the cellIdentity within the VarShortMAC-Input as specified in TS 36.331 [9].
9.1.2.28 C-RNTI IE Semantics: C-RNTI contained in the RRC Re-establishment Request message (TS 36.331 [9]). If this IE is present, the Resume ID IE is ignored
9.1.2.28 Failure cell PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell Identifier

section_list.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the old eNB to transfer the UE context to the new eNB.
Direction: old eNB ? new eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.29 New eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the new eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.1.2.29 New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the new eNB

9.1.2.29 Old eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the old eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.1.2.29 Old eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the old eNB
9.2.16 GUMMEI - Section Description: This information element indicates the globally unique MME identity.
9.2.20 GU Group Id - Section Description: The GU Group Id IE is the globally unique group id corresponding to a pool area.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.1.2.29 MME UE S1AP ID IE Semantics: MME UE S1AP ID allocated at the MME
9.2.29 UE Security Capabilities - Section Description: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE.

9.2.29 Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0 "first bit" - 128-EEA1, "second bit" - 128-EEA2, "third bit" - 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.29 Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0 (TS 33.401 [18]) "first bit" - 128-EIA1, "second bit" - 128-EIA2, "third bit" - 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].
9.2.30 AS Security Information - Section Description: The AS Security Information IE is used to generate the key material to be used for AS security with the UE.

9.2.30 Key eNodeB Star IE Semantics: KeNB* defined in TS 33.401 [18]. If the target cell belongs to multiple frequency bands, the source eNB selects the DL-EARFCN for KeNB* calculation as specified in section 10.3 of TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.30 Next Hop Chaining Count IE Semantics: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.401 [18]

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: On Handover Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is transferred to the target eNB. In Dual Connectivity, UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and SeNB respectively as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and provided by the MME to the eNB.

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │  ├─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │  └─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.25 Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority - Section Description: The Subscriber Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in Active mode (TS 36.300 [15]).

8.3.13 Retrieve UE Context 8.3.13.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the old eNB proposes to do forwarding of downlink data, the old eNB shall include the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Setup Item IE of the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE message.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.2.29 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes necessary QoS parameters 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB. 8.3.13 Retrieve UE Context 8.3.13.2 Successful Operation If the old eNB is able to identify the UE context and to successfully verify the UE by means of the Resume ID, the ShortMAC-I, optionally the C-RNTI, the failure cell PCI and the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier of the new cell contained in the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT REQUEST message, it shall respond with the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE message. The allocation of resources according to the values of the Allocation and Retention Priority IE included in the E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE shall follow the principles described for the E-RAB Setup procedure in TS 36.413 [4].
9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13].

9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer. 8.3.13 Retrieve UE Context 8.3.13.2 Successful Operation If the old eNB is able to identify the UE context and to successfully verify the UE by means of the Resume ID, the ShortMAC-I, optionally the C-RNTI, the failure cell PCI and the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier of the new cell contained in the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT REQUEST message, it shall respond with the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE message. The allocation of resources according to the values of the Allocation and Retention Priority IE included in the E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE shall follow the principles described for the E-RAB Setup procedure in TS 36.413 [4].

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.9 Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for downlink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.9 Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for uplink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
9.2.92 Bearer Type - Section Description: This IE is used to support Non-IP data as specified in TS 23.401 [11].

9.1.2.29 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: SGW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.2.5 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates that the E-RAB is proposed for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.3.13 Retrieve UE Context 8.3.13.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which the old eNB proposes to do forwarding of downlink data, the old eNB shall include the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Setup Item IE of the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE message.

9.1.2.29 RRC Context IE Semantics: Includes either the RRC Handover Preparation Information message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [9], or the HandoverPreparationInformation-NB message as defined in subclause 10.6.2 of TS 36.331 [9].

9.2.3 Handover Restriction List - Section Description: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the eNB provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover and CCO, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3 Equivalent PLMNs IE Semantics: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of "equivalent PLMNs list" as defined in TS 24.301 [14]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Forbidden TAs IE Semantics: intra E-UTRAN roaming restrictions

9.2.3 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: The PLMN of forbidden TACs 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 TAC IE Semantics: The forbidden TAC
9.2.3 Forbidden LAs IE Semantics: inter-3GPP RAT roaming restrictions

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
ENUMERATED (ALL, GERAN, UTRAN, CDMA2000, …, GERAN and UTRAN, CDMA2000 and UTRAN)
9.2.3 Forbidden inter RATs IE Semantics: inter-3GPP and 3GPP2 RAT access restrictions. "ALL" means that all RATs mentioned in the enumeration of this IE are restricted.
│  │  ├─NR restriction in EPS as secondary RAT
9.2.3 NR restriction in EPS as secondary RAT IE Semantics: Restriction to use NR when the NR is used as secondary RAT in EN-DC.

9.2.3 Core Network Type Restrictions IE Semantics: Includes any of the Serving PLMN or any PLMN of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which core network type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [38].

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Core Network Type IE Semantics: The indication indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to 5GC or to EPC for this PLMN.
9.2.3 NR Restriction in 5GS IE Semantics: Restriction to use NR when the NR connects to 5GS.

9.2.3 Last NG-RAN PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Indicates the NG-RAN PLMN from where the UE formerly handed over to EPS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to 5GS. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Unlicensed Spectrum Restriction IE Semantics: Restriction to use unlicensed spectrum in the form of LAA or LWA/LWIP or NR-U as described in TS 23.401 [11].

9.1.2.29 Location Reporting Information IE Semantics: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting 9.2.21 Location Reporting Information - Section Description: This information element indicates how the location information should be reported.
9.2.59 Management Based MDT Allowed - Section Description: This information element is used by the eNB to allow selection of the UE for management based MDT as described in TS 32.422 [6].
9.2.64 MDT PLMN List - Section Description: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.1.2.29 UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only if the UE is authorized for V2X services. 9.2.97 UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the aggregate maximum bit rate for all radio bearers per UE in the sidelink for V2X services. 8.3.13 Retrieve UE Context 8.3.13.2 Successful Operation If the UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE is contained in the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE message, the new eNB shall, if supported, use it for the concerned UE's sidelink communication in network scheduled mode for V2X services.

9.2.97 UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Value 0 shall be considered as a logical error by the receiving eNB. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s 8.3.13 Retrieve UE Context 8.3.13.2 Successful Operation If the UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE is contained in the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE message, the new eNB shall, if supported, use it for the concerned UE's sidelink communication in network scheduled mode for V2X services.

9.2.25a Additional RRM Policy Index - Section Description: The Additional RRM Policy Index IE is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

9.2.153 EPC Handover Restriction List Container - Section Description: This IE contains the Handover Restriction List IE specified in TS 36.413 [4] as received by the E-UTRAN from the EPC. 9.2.153 EPC Handover Restriction List Container IE Semantics: The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the Handover Restriction List IE specified in TS 36.413 [4].
9.2.2 Trace Activation - Section Description: Defines parameters related to trace activation.

9.2.2 E-UTRAN Trace ID IE Semantics: The E-UTRAN Trace ID IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information coded as in 9.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (last 2 octets)

9.2.2 Interfaces To Trace IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a eNB interface: first bit =S1-MME, second bit =X2, third bit =Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1. Other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.
ENUMERATED ( minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, ...)
9.2.2 Trace Depth IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.421 [7]
9.2.2 Trace Collection Entity IP Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.56 MDT Configuration - Section Description: The IE defines the MDT configuration parameters.
ENUMERATED (Immediate MDT only, Immediate MDT and Trace, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code. The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 Measurements to Activate IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap indicates a MDT measurement, as defined in TS 37.320 [25]. First Bit = M1, Second Bit = M2, Third Bit = M3, Fourth Bit = M4, Fifth Bit = M5, Sixth Bit = logging of M1 from event triggered measurement reports according to existing RRM configuration. Seventh Bit = M6, Eighth Bit = M7. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate".
9.2.56 M1 Reporting Trigger IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "0".

9.2.56 - M1 Threshold Event A2 IE - ifM1A2trigger: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "1" and the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "A2event-triggered" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Threshold Event A2 IE Semantics: Included in case of event-triggered or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
9.2.56 Threshold RSRP IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Threshold RSRQ IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

9.2.56 - M1 Periodic reporting IE - ifperiodicMDT: This IE shall be present if the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "periodic" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Periodic reporting IE Semantics: Included in case of periodic or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
ENUMERATED ( ms120, ms240, ms480, ms640, ms1024, ms2048, ms5120, ms10240, min1, min6, min12, min30, min60)
9.2.56 Report interval IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Report amount IE Semantics: Number of reports

9.2.56 - M3 Configuration IE - ifM3: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the third bit set to "1". 9.2.61 M3 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M4 Configuration IE - ifM4: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fourth bit set to "1". 9.2.62 M4 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M4 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M5 Configuration IE - ifM5: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fifth bit set to "1". 9.2.63 M5 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M5 measurement collection.

9.2.56 MDT Location Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents requested location information as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = GNSS Second Bit = E-CID information. Other bits are reserved for future use and are ignored if received. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate". The eNB shall ignore the first bit unless the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit or the sixth bit set to "1".
9.2.64 MDT PLMN List - Section Description: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 - M6 Configuration IE - ifM6: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the seventh bit set to "1". 9.2.87 M6 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)
9.2.87 - M6 Delay Threshold IE - ifUL: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

9.2.56 - M7 Configuration IE - ifM7: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the eighth bit set to "1". 9.2.88 M7 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
9.2.88 M7 Collection Period IE Semantics: Unit: minutes
9.2.134 Bluetooth Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for Bluetooth measurement collection.
9.2.134 BT RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection.
9.2.135 WLAN RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RTT IE Semantics: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.121 UE Application layer measurement configuration - Section Description: The IE defines configuration information for the QoE Measurement Collection (QMC) function.
9.2.121 Container for application layer measurement configuration IE Semantics: Indicates application layer measurement configuration, see Annex L in [36].
9.2.121 TAC IE Semantics: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
ENUMERATED (QMC for streaming service, QMC for MTSI service, ...)
9.2.121 Service Type IE Semantics: This IE indicates the service type of UE application layer measurements.
9.2.33 SRVCC Operation Possible - Section Description: The IE indicates that both the UE and the MME are SRVCC-capable. E-UTRAN behaviour on reception of this is specified in TS 23.216 [20].

9.2.69 Masked IMEISV - Section Description: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment. 9.2.69 Masked IMEISV IE Semantics: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [29] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1.

9.2.70 Expected UE Behaviour - Section Description: This IE defines the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the eNB/en-gNB in determining the optimum RRC connection time.
9.2.71 Expected UE Activity Behaviour - Section Description: Indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.401 [12].
9.2.71 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.71 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.71 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.
ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, …)

9.2.70 Expected HO Interval IE Semantics: Indicates the expected time interval between inter-eNB handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter-eNB handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.
9.2.78 ProSe Authorized - Section Description: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE for ProSe service(s).
9.2.78 ProSe Direct Discovery IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Discovery
9.2.78 ProSe Direct Communication IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Communication
9.2.78 ProSe UE-to-Network Relaying IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized to act as ProSe UE-to-Network Relay

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE
9.2.93 V2X Services Authorized - Section Description: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE to use the sidelink for V2X services.
9.2.93 Vehicle UE IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Vehicle UE
9.2.93 Pedestrian UE IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Pedestrian UE

9.2.129 Aerial UE subscription information - Section Description: This information element is used by the eNB to know if the UE is allowed to use aerial UE function, refer to TS 23.401[12]. 8.3.13 Retrieve UE Context 8.3.13.2 Successful Operation If the Aerial UE subscription information IE is included in the RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE message, the target eNB shall, if supported, store this information in the UE context and use it as defined in TS 36.300 [15].

9.2.136 Subscription Based UE Differentiation Information - Section Description: This IE is generated by the MME based on the UE subscription information, it provides the Subscription Based UE differentiation Information.
9.2.136 Periodic Communication Indicator IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the UE communicates periodically or not, e.g. only on demand.
9.2.136 Periodic Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the interval time of periodic communication, the unit is: second
9.2.136 Scheduled Communication Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time zone and day of the week when the UE is available for communication.

9.2.136 Day of Week IE Semantics: If Day-Of-Week is not provided this shall be interpreted as every day of the week. Each position in the bitmap represents a day of the week: first bit = Mon, second bit =Tue, third bit =Wed, and so on. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘scheduled. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘not scheduled’.

9.2.136 Time of Day Start IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. If Time-Of-Day-Start is not provided, starting time shall be set to start of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.

9.2.136 Time of Day End IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. The value of this IE should be bigger than the value of Time of Day Start IE. If Time-Of-Day-End is not provided, ending time is end of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.
ENUMERATED (single packet, dual packets, multiple packets, …)

9.2.136 Traffic Profile IE Semantics: "single packet" indicates single packet transmission (UL or DL), "dual packets" indicates dual packet transmission (UL with subsequent DL, or DL with subsequent UL), "multiple packets" indicates multiple packets transmission.
ENUMERATED (battery powered, battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable, not battery powered, …)

9.2.136 Battery Indication IE Semantics: "battery powered" indicates that the UE is battery powered and the battery is rechargeable/replaceable, "battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable" indicates that the UE is battery powered but the battery is not rechargeable/replaceable, "not battery powered" indicates that the UE is not battery powered.

section_list.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the old eNB to inform the new eNB that the Retrieve UE Context procedure has failed.
Direction: old eNB ? new eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.30 New eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the new eNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.1.2.30 New eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the new eNB
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by an initiating node to a neighbouring node, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to transfer the initialization information for a TNL association.
Direction: eNB ? en-gNB, en-gNB ? eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.22 Global eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.22 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB
9.2.22 Home eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying the cell controlled by the eNB

9.2.22 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

9.2.22 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.
9.1.2.31 List of Served E-UTRA Cells IE Semantics: Complete list of cells served by the eNB
9.2.8 Served Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of a cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.8 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell ID
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.8 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code
9.2.8 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.8 UL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NUL in TS 36.104 [16] for E-UTRA operating bands for which it is defined; ignored for E-UTRA operating bands for which NUL is not defined 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.8 UL Transmission Bandwidth IE Semantics: Same as DL Transmission Bandwidth in this release; ignored in case UL EARFCN value is ignored 9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

9.2.8 UL EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the UL EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 DL EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the DL EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
│  │  │  │  │  │     ├─Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).
│  │  │  │  │  │     ├─Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to UL EARFCN

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to UL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MUL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).
9.2.8 NRS-NSSS-PowerOffset IE Semantics: NRS to NSSS power ratio, as defined in TS6.213 [11].
9.2.8 NSSS-NumOccasionDifferentPrecoder IE Semantics: The number of consecutive NSSS occasions that use different precoders for NSSS transmission, as defined in TS6.213 [11].

9.2.8 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL/NUL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.
ENUMERATED (sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6, …)
9.2.8 Subframe Assignment IE Semantics: Uplink-downlink subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. In NB-IOT, sa0 and sa6 are not applicable.
9.2.8 Special Subframe Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]
ENUMERATED (ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, …)
9.2.8 Additional Special Subframe Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. Only for newly defined configuration of special subframe from Release 11.
ENUMERATED (ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, ssp9, …)

9.2.8 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 Additional Special Subframe Extension Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. Only for newly defined configuration of special subframe from Release 14.
│  │  │  │  │        ├─Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).

9.2.8 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Corresponds to the TDD-UL-DL-AlignmentOffset-NB in TS 36.331 [9]. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset between the UL carrier frequency center with respect to DL carrier frequency center. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Unit: kHz

9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports - Section Description: The Number of Antenna Ports IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports. 9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports IE Semantics: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports
9.2.50 PRACH Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.
9.2.50 RootSequenceIndex IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 HighSpeedFlag IE Semantics: TRUE corresponds to Restricted set and FALSE to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-FrequencyOffset IE Semantics: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-ConfigurationIndex IE Semantics: Mandatory for TDD, shall not be present for FDD. See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.8 MBSFN Subframe Info IE Semantics: MBSFN subframe defined in TS 36.331 [9]
ENUMERATED (n1, n2, n4, n8, n16, n32, …)

9.2.51 Subframe Allocation - Section Description: The Subframe Allocation IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.53 CSG ID - Section Description: This element indicates the identifier of the Closed Subscriber Group.
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity List IE Semantics: Supported MBMS Service Area Identities in the cell
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity IE Semantics: MBMS Service Area Identities as defined in TS 23.003 [29]

9.2.60 MultibandInfoList - Section Description: The MultibandInfoList IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.60 FrequencyBandIndicator IE Semantics: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [42, table 5.5-1]
9.2.8 FreqBandIndicatorPriority IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the eNodeB supports FreqBandIndicationPriority, and whether FreqBandIndicatorPriority is broadcasted in SIB 1 (see TS 36.331 [9])
9.2.8 BandwidthReducedSI IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the SystemInformationBlockType1-BR is scheduled in the cell (see TS 36.331 [9])

9.2.8 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.125 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation If the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message contains the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE, the receiving en-gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the eNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same eNB.
9.2.125 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.125 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.125 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.125 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.125 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.125 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.125 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

9.2.8 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List E-UTRA IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the cellAccessRelatedInfo IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 36.331 [9]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE shall be provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.1.2.31 NR Neighbour Information IE Semantics: NR neighbours 9.2.98 NR Neighbour Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.98 NRPCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.98 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.98 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.98 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the neighbour cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

9.1.2.31 Interface Instance Indication IE Semantics: NOTE: In the current version of this specification this IE is not included in the Initiating Node Type IE. 9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message and the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance. In the current version of this specification an eNB shall not include the Interface Instance Indication IE in the Initiating NodeType IE in the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.3 Unsuccessful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message and the EN-DC X2 SETUP FAILURE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.

9.2.146 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information - Section Description: The Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR or E-UTRA cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.
9.2.147 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given list.

9.2.115 Cell Assistance Information - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR cells. 9.2.115 CHOICE Cell Assistance Type IE Semantics: This IE may be refined.
9.2.115 List of Requested NR Cells IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests a limited list of served NR cells.

9.2.115 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.115 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests the complete list of served NR cells.
9.2.112 Global en-gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.112 en-gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the en-gNB.
9.1.2.31 List of Served NR Cells IE Semantics: List of cells served by the en-gNB. If a partial list of cells is signalled, it contains at least one cell per carrier configured at the gNB.
9.2.110 Served NR Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.110 NR-PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.110 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.110 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.110 Served PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs. If more than maxnoofBPLMNs are needed for NR, they are provided by the Additional PLMNs IE.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.106 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

9.2.106 NRARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.106 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the en-gNB, the en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.106 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2.-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

9.2.123 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE provides information about the SUL carrier. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.
