9.2.110 Additional PLMNs IE Semantics: Additional PLMNs in addition to the Served PLMNs

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.110 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [31]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE shall be provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.1.2.31 NR Neighbour Information IE Semantics: NR neighbours. 9.2.98 NR Neighbour Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.98 NRPCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.98 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.98 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.98 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the neighbour cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

9.1.2.31 Partial List Indicator IE Semantics: Value “partial” indicates that a partial list of cells is included in the List of Served NR Cells IE 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured. An en-gNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate eNB. The candidate eNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating en-gNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE in the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to the candidate eNB. The candidate eNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells. If the Partial List Indicator IE is set to "partial" in the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message from the en-gNB, the eNB shall, if supported, assume that the en-gNB has included in the List of Served Cells NR IE a partial list of cells.

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message and the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance. In the current version of this specification an eNB shall not include the Interface Instance Indication IE in the Initiating NodeType IE in the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.3 Unsuccessful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message and the EN-DC X2 SETUP FAILURE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.

9.2.149 TNL Transport Layer Address Info - Section Description: This IE is used for signalling IP addresses of IP-Sec endpoints used for establishment of IP-Sec tunnels. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation If the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message contains the TNL Transport Layer Address info IE, the receiving en-gNB shall, if supported, take this into account for IPSEC tunnel establishment. If the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message contains the TNL Transport Layer Address info IE, the receiving eNB shall, if supported, take this into account for IPSEC tunnel establishment.

section_list.name: EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE
aoa:
This message is sent by a neighbouring node to an initiating node, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to transfer the initialization information for a TNL association.
Direction: eNB ? en-gNB, en-gNB ? eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.22 Global eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.22 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB
9.2.22 Home eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying the cell controlled by the eNB

9.2.22 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

9.2.22 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.
9.1.2.32 List of Served E-UTRA Cells IE Semantics: Complete list of cells served by the eNB
9.2.8 Served Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of a cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.8 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell ID
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.8 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code
9.2.8 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.8 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).

9.2.8 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Corresponds to the TDD-UL-DL-AlignmentOffset-NB in TS 36.331 [9]. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset between the UL carrier frequency center with respect to DL carrier frequency center. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Unit: kHz

9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports - Section Description: The Number of Antenna Ports IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports. 9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports IE Semantics: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports
9.2.50 PRACH Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.
9.2.50 RootSequenceIndex IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 HighSpeedFlag IE Semantics: TRUE corresponds to Restricted set and FALSE to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-FrequencyOffset IE Semantics: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-ConfigurationIndex IE Semantics: Mandatory for TDD, shall not be present for FDD. See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.8 MBSFN Subframe Info IE Semantics: MBSFN subframe defined in TS 36.331 [9]

9.2.51 Subframe Allocation - Section Description: The Subframe Allocation IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.53 CSG ID - Section Description: This element indicates the identifier of the Closed Subscriber Group.
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity List IE Semantics: Supported MBMS Service Area Identities in the cell
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity IE Semantics: MBMS Service Area Identities as defined in TS 23.003 [29]

9.2.60 MultibandInfoList - Section Description: The MultibandInfoList IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.60 FrequencyBandIndicator IE Semantics: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [42, table 5.5-1]
9.2.8 FreqBandIndicatorPriority IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the eNodeB supports FreqBandIndicationPriority, and whether FreqBandIndicatorPriority is broadcasted in SIB 1 (see TS 36.331 [9])
9.2.8 BandwidthReducedSI IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the SystemInformationBlockType1-BR is scheduled in the cell (see TS 36.331 [9])

9.2.8 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.125 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation If the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE, the receiving en-gNB should take this into account for cell-level resource coordination with the eNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE content valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same eNB.
9.2.125 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.125 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.125 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.125 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.125 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.125 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.125 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

9.2.8 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List E-UTRA IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the cellAccessRelatedInfo IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 36.331 [9]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE shall be provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.1.2.32 NR Neighbour Information IE Semantics: NR neighbours 9.2.98 NR Neighbour Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.98 NRPCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.98 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.98 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.98 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the neighbour cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

9.2.146 Cell and Capacity Assistance Information - Section Description: The Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR or E-UTRA cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured. If the Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE is present in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message from the eNB, the en-gNB shall, if supported, store the collected information to be used for future interface management.
9.2.147 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given list.

9.2.115 Cell Assistance Information - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR cells. 9.2.115 CHOICE Cell Assistance Type IE Semantics: This IE may be refined.
9.2.115 List of Requested NR Cells IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests a limited list of served NR cells.

9.2.115 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.115 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests the complete list of served NR cells.
9.2.112 Global en-gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.112 en-gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the en-gNB.
9.1.2.32 List of Served NR Cells IE Semantics: List of cells served by the en-gNB. If a partial list of cells is signalled, it contains at least one cell per carrier configured at the gNB.
9.2.110 Served NR Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.110 NR-PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

9.2.110 Served PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs. If more than maxnoofBPLMNs are needed for NR, they are provided by the Additional PLMNs IE.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.106 NRARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.106 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.106 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2.-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

9.2.123 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE provides information about the SUL carrier. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured.

9.2.123 SUL ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.114 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.114 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [37].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.114 NR NRB IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [37]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 11, 18, etc.
9.2.114 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.114 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [37].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.114 NR NRB IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [37]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 11, 18, etc.
9.2.110 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the served cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].
9.2.110 Additional PLMNs IE Semantics: Additional PLMNs in addition to the Served PLMNs

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.110 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [31]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE shall be provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.1.2.32 NR Neighbour Information IE Semantics: NR neighbours 9.2.98 NR Neighbour Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.98 NRPCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.98 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.98 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.98 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the neighbour cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

9.1.2.32 Partial List Indicator IE Semantics: Value “partial” indicates that a partial list of cells is included in the List of Served NR Cells IE 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating eNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells to the candidate en-gNB. The candidate en-gNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE, according to the received information in Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE in EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message. If Supplementary Uplink is configured at the candidate en-gNB, the candidate en-gNB shall include in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message the SUL Information IE and the Supported SUL band List IE for each served cell where supplementary uplink is configured. If the Partial List Indicator IE is set to "partial" in the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message from the en-gNB, the eNB shall, if supported, assume that the en-gNB has included in the List of Served Cells NR IE a partial list of cells. An en-gNB initiates the procedure by sending the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to a candidate eNB. The candidate eNB replies with the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message. The initiating en-gNB shall transfer the complete list of its served cells or if supported, a partial list of its served cells together with the Partial List Indicator IE in the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message to the candidate eNB. The candidate eNB shall reply with the complete list of its served cells.

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message and the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance. In the current version of this specification an eNB shall not include the Interface Instance Indication IE in the Initiating NodeType IE in the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message.

9.2.149 TNL Transport Layer Address Info - Section Description: This IE is used for signalling IP addresses of IP-Sec endpoints used for establishment of IP-Sec tunnels. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.2 Successful Operation If the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the TNL Transport Layer Address info IE, the receiving eNB shall, if supported, take this into account for IPSEC tunnel establishment. If the EN-DC X2 SETUP RESPONSE message contains the TNL Transport Layer Address info IE, the receiving en-gNB shall, if supported, take this into account for IPSEC tunnel establishment.
├─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add List
│  └─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add Item
9.2.149 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint.
│     └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
│        └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add Item
9.2.149 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.
└─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Remove List
└─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Remove Item
9.2.149 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint.
└─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove List
└─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove Item
9.2.149 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.

section_list.name: EN-DC X2 SETUP FAILURE
aoa:
This message is sent by the neighbouring node to indicate EN-DC X2 Setup failure.
Direction: eNB ? en-gNB, en-gNB ? eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.2.32 Time To Wait - Section Description: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting times. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.4 Abnormal Conditions If the EN-DC X2 SETUP FAILURE message includes the Time To Wait IE the initiating node shall wait at least for the indicated time before reinitiating the EN-DC X2 Setup procedure towards the same peer node.

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.1 EN-DC X2 Setup 8.7.1.3 Unsuccessful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC X2 SETUP REQUEST message and the EN-DC X2 SETUP FAILURE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.
9.2.148 Message Oversize Notification - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum number of cells that can be received in the List of Served Cells NR IE.
9.2.147 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given list.

section_list.name: EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE
aoa:
This message is sent by an initiating node to a peer neighbouring node, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to transfer updated information for a TNL association.
Direction: eNB ? en-gNB, en-gNB ? eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.2.115 Cell Assistance Information - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR cells. 9.2.115 CHOICE Cell Assistance Type IE Semantics: This IE may be refined.
9.2.115 List of Requested NR Cells IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests a limited list of served NR cells.

9.2.115 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.115 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests the complete list of served NR cells.
9.2.8 Served Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of a cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.8 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell ID
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.8 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code
9.2.8 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.8 UL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NUL in TS 36.104 [16] for E-UTRA operating bands for which it is defined; ignored for E-UTRA operating bands for which NUL is not defined 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.8 UL Transmission Bandwidth IE Semantics: Same as DL Transmission Bandwidth in this release; ignored in case UL EARFCN value is ignored 9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

9.2.8 UL EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the UL EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 DL EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the DL EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
│  │  │  │  │  │     ├─Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).
│  │  │  │  │  │     ├─Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to UL EARFCN

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to UL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MUL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).
9.2.8 NRS-NSSS-PowerOffset IE Semantics: NRS to NSSS power ratio, as defined in TS6.213 [11].
9.2.8 NSSS-NumOccasionDifferentPrecoder IE Semantics: The number of consecutive NSSS occasions that use different precoders for NSSS transmission, as defined in TS6.213 [11].

9.2.8 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL/NUL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.
ENUMERATED (sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6, …)
9.2.8 Subframe Assignment IE Semantics: Uplink-downlink subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. In NB-IOT, sa0 and sa6 are not applicable.
9.2.8 Special Subframe Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]
ENUMERATED (ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, …)
9.2.8 Additional Special Subframe Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. Only for newly defined configuration of special subframe from Release 11.
ENUMERATED (ssp0, ssp1, ssp2, ssp3, ssp4, ssp5, ssp6, ssp7, ssp8, ssp9, …)

9.2.8 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 Additional Special Subframe Extension Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. Only for newly defined configuration of special subframe from Release 14.
│  │  │  │  │        ├─Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).

9.2.8 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Corresponds to the TDD-UL-DL-AlignmentOffset-NB in TS 36.331 [9]. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset between the UL carrier frequency center with respect to DL carrier frequency center. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Unit: kHz

9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports - Section Description: The Number of Antenna Ports IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports. 9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports IE Semantics: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports
9.2.50 PRACH Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.
9.2.50 RootSequenceIndex IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 HighSpeedFlag IE Semantics: TRUE corresponds to Restricted set and FALSE to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-FrequencyOffset IE Semantics: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-ConfigurationIndex IE Semantics: Mandatory for TDD, shall not be present for FDD. See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.8 MBSFN Subframe Info IE Semantics: MBSFN subframe defined in TS 36.331 [9]
ENUMERATED (n1, n2, n4, n8, n16, n32, …)

9.2.51 Subframe Allocation - Section Description: The Subframe Allocation IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.53 CSG ID - Section Description: This element indicates the identifier of the Closed Subscriber Group.
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity List IE Semantics: Supported MBMS Service Area Identities in the cell
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity IE Semantics: MBMS Service Area Identities as defined in TS 23.003 [29]

9.2.60 MultibandInfoList - Section Description: The MultibandInfoList IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.60 FrequencyBandIndicator IE Semantics: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [42, table 5.5-1]
9.2.8 FreqBandIndicatorPriority IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the eNodeB supports FreqBandIndicationPriority, and whether FreqBandIndicatorPriority is broadcasted in SIB 1 (see TS 36.331 [9])
9.2.8 BandwidthReducedSI IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the SystemInformationBlockType1-BR is scheduled in the cell (see TS 36.331 [9])

9.2.8 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.125 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.125 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.125 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.125 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.125 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.125 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.125 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.125 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

9.2.8 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.125 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.125 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.125 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.125 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.125 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.125 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.125 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.125 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served NR Cell Information: - If Served NR Cells To Add IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall add cell information according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Modify IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Delete IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE.

9.2.110 Served NR Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served NR Cell Information: - If Served NR Cells To Add IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall add cell information according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Modify IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Delete IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE.

9.2.106 NRARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.106 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

9.2.106 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2.-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.

9.2.123 SUL ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served NR Cell Information: - If Served NR Cells To Add IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall add cell information according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Modify IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Delete IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE.

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served NR Cell Information: - If Served NR Cells To Add IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall add cell information according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Modify IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Delete IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE.

9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]). 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation Update of Served NR Cell Information: - If Served NR Cells To Add IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall add cell information according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Modify IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall modify information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE according to the information in the Served NR Cell Information IE. - If Served NR Cells To Delete IE is contained in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message, eNB shall delete information of cell indicated by Old NR-CGI IE.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message and the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.3 Unsuccessful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message and the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.

9.2.149 TNL Transport Layer Address Info - Section Description: This IE is used for signalling IP addresses of IP-Sec endpoints used for establishment of IP-Sec tunnels. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation If the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the TNL Transport Layer Address info IE, the receiving en-gNB shall, if supported, take this into account for IPSEC tunnel establishment. If the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message contains the TNL Transport Layer Address info IE, the receiving eNB shall, if supported, take this into account for IPSEC tunnel establishment.
│  ├─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add List
│  │  └─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add Item

│  │     └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
│  │        └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add Item

9.2.151 TNL Association Usage - Section Description: This IE indicates the usage of the TNL association. 9.2.151 TNL Association Usage IE Semantics: Indicates whether the TNL association is only used for UE-associated signalling, or non-UE-associated signalling, or both.

9.1.2.34 TNLA Transport Layer Information IE Semantics: CP Transport Layer Information of the en-gNB 9.2.150 CP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with EN-DC X2 control plane transport.

9.2.151 TNL Association Usage - Section Description: This IE indicates the usage of the TNL association. 9.2.151 TNL Association Usage IE Semantics: Indicates whether the TNL association is only used for UE-associated signalling, or non-UE-associated signalling, or both.

9.1.2.34 TNLA Transport Layer Information IE Semantics: CP Transport Layer Information of the en-gNB 9.2.150 CP Transport Layer Information - Section Description: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with EN-DC X2 control plane transport.

section_list.name: EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by a neighbouring node to a peer node, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to acknowledge update of information for a TNL association.
Direction: en-gNB ? eNB, eNB ? en-gNB.

9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation After successful update of requested information, eNB shall reply with the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message to inform the initiating en-gNB that the requested update of application data was performed successfully. In case the eNB receives an EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE without any IE except for Message Type IE it shall reply with EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message without performing any updates to the existing configuration.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.2.35 List of Served NR Cells IE Semantics: Complete or limited list of cells served by the en-gNB, if requested by the eNB. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.2 Successful Operation If the Cell Assistance Information IE is present, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use it to generate the List of Served NR Cells IE and include the list in the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE ACKNOWLEDGE message.
9.2.110 Served NR Cell Information - Section Description: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.110 NR-PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.110 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.110 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.110 Served PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs. If more than maxnoofBPLMNs are needed for NR, they are provided by the Additional PLMNs IE.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.106 NR Frequency Info - Section Description: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

9.2.106 NRARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.106 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

9.2.106 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2.-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.
9.2.123 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE provides information about the SUL carrier.

9.2.123 SUL ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.114 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.114 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [37].

9.2.110 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List NR IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the PLMN-IdentityInfoList IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 38.331 [31]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE shall be provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

9.2.32 Time To Wait - Section Description: This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting times. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE message includes the Time To Wait IE the initiating node shall wait at least for the indicated time before reinitiating the EN-DC Configuration Update procedure towards the same peer node. Both nodes shall continue to operate the X2 with their existing configuration data.

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.2 EN-DC Configuration Update 8.7.2.3 Unsuccessful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE message and the EN-DC CONFIGURATION UPDATE FAILURE message shall include the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.

section_list.name: EN-DC CELL ACTIVATION REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by an eNB to a peer en-gNB to request a previously switched-off cell(s) to be re-activated.
Direction: eNB ? en-gNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.1.2.37 Activation ID IE Semantics: Allocated by the eNB
