ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE
9.1.3.3 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB
9.1.3.3 SeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB

section_list.name: SENB RECONFIGURATION COMPLETE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to the SeNB to indicate whether the configuration requested by the SeNB was applied by the UE.
Direction: MeNB ? SeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.3.4 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.3.4 SeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.3.4 MeNB to SeNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the SCG-ConfigInfo message as defined in TS 36.331 [9] 8.6.2 SeNB Reconfiguration Completion 8.6.2.2 Successful Operation The SENB RECONFIGURATION COMPLETE message may contain information that - either the UE has successfully applied the configuration requested by the SeNB. The MeNB may also provide configuration information in the MeNB to SeNB Container IE. - or the MeNB has not triggered configuration requested by the SeNB. The MeNB shall provide information with sufficient precision in the included Cause IE to enable the SeNB to know the reason for an unsuccessful reconfiguration. The MeNB may also provide configuration information in the MeNB to SeNB Container IE.

9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol. 8.6.2 SeNB Reconfiguration Completion 8.6.2.2 Successful Operation The SENB RECONFIGURATION COMPLETE message may contain information that - either the UE has successfully applied the configuration requested by the SeNB. The MeNB may also provide configuration information in the MeNB to SeNB Container IE. - or the MeNB has not triggered configuration requested by the SeNB. The MeNB shall provide information with sufficient precision in the included Cause IE to enable the SeNB to know the reason for an unsuccessful reconfiguration. The MeNB may also provide configuration information in the MeNB to SeNB Container IE.

The MeNB may also provide configuration information in the MeNB to SeNB Container IE.

9.1.3.5 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. 9.2.73 SCG Change Indication - Section Description: The SCG Change Indication IE is either used to request the SeNB to prepare the SCG Change in the SeNB or to request the MeNB to initiate the SCG Change towards the UE (see TS 36.300 [15]). 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE. For each E-RAB configured with the split bearer option to be modified, if the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message includes the SCG Change Indication IE and the MeNB GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE in the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE, the SeNB shall act as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the SCG Change Indication IE is included in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the SeNB shall act as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation If the SeNB has initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure with the SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message including the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE, it may receive the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the SCG Change Indication IE, upon which the SeNB shall provide respective information in the SeNB to MeNB Container IE within the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGMENT message, as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB, after having initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, receives the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including other IEs than an applicable SeNB Security Key IE and/or applicable forwarding addresses and/or the SCG Change Indication IE the SeNB shall - regard the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification Procedure as being failed, - stop the TDCoverall, which was started to supervise the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, - be prepared to receive the SENB MODIFICATION REFUSE message from the MeNB and - continue with the MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation procedure as specified in section 8.6.3.

9.1.3.5 Serving PLMN IE Semantics: The serving PLMN of the SCG in the SeNB. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC). 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation If the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Serving PLMN IE, the SeNB may use it for RRM purposes.

8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE. 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation If applicable, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the SeNB may receive, after having initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the SeNB Security Key IE within the UE Context Information IE.

9.2.29 UE Security Capabilities - Section Description: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option - the SeNB shall, if included, choose the ciphering algorithm based on the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and locally configured priority list of AS encryption algorithms and apply the key indicated in the SeNB Security Key IE as specified in the TS 33.401 [18]. - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the SeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the SeNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - If the Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for LIPA operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the SIPTO Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for SIPTO@LN operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB and is set to "non IP", the SeNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.2.29 Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0 "first bit" - 128-EEA1, "second bit" - 128-EEA2, "third bit" - 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.29 Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0 (TS 33.401 [18]) "first bit" - 128-EIA1, "second bit" - 128-EIA2, "third bit" - 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.72 SeNB Security Key - Section Description: The SeNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the SeNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18]. 9.2.72 SeNB Security Key IE Semantics: The S-KeNB which is provided by the MeNB, see TS 33.401 [18]. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option - the SeNB shall, if included, choose the ciphering algorithm based on the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and locally configured priority list of AS encryption algorithms and apply the key indicated in the SeNB Security Key IE as specified in the TS 33.401 [18]. - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the SeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the SeNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - If the Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for LIPA operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the SIPTO Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for SIPTO@LN operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB and is set to "non IP", the SeNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB. 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation If applicable, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the SeNB may receive, after having initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the SeNB Security Key IE within the UE Context Information IE. 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB, after having initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, receives the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including other IEs than an applicable SeNB Security Key IE and/or applicable forwarding addresses and/or the SCG Change Indication IE the SeNB shall - regard the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification Procedure as being failed, - stop the TDCoverall, which was started to supervise the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, - be prepared to receive the SENB MODIFICATION REFUSE message from the MeNB and - continue with the MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation procedure as specified in section 8.6.3.

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: On Handover Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is transferred to the target eNB. In Dual Connectivity, UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and SeNB respectively as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and provided by the MME to the eNB. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE. If the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE is included in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the SeNB shall: - replace the previously provided SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate by the received SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in the UE context; - use the received SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate for non-GBR Bearers for the concerned UE as defined in TS 36.300 [15].

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │  ├─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  │  └─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE and/or the E-RABs To Be Modified List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall not admit the action requested for the corresponding E-RABs.

8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE. For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option - the SeNB shall, if included, choose the ciphering algorithm based on the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and locally configured priority list of AS encryption algorithms and apply the key indicated in the SeNB Security Key IE as specified in the TS 33.401 [18]. - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the SeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the SeNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - If the Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for LIPA operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the SIPTO Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for SIPTO@LN operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB and is set to "non IP", the SeNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE and/or the E-RABs To Be Modified List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall not admit the action requested for the corresponding E-RABs. If the SeNB receives an SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RAB To Be Released List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall initiate the release of one corresponding E-RAB and ignore the duplication of the instances of the selected corresponding E-RABs.

9.1.3.5 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes necessary QoS parameters 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the SeNB shall not admit the corresponding E-RAB.

9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13]. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the SeNB shall not admit the corresponding E-RAB.
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]). 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the SeNB shall not admit the corresponding E-RAB.

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. 9.2.9 Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for downlink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.9 Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for uplink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.5 DL Forwarding - Section Description: This element indicates that the E-RAB is proposed for forwarding of downlink packets. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option - the SeNB shall, if included, choose the ciphering algorithm based on the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and locally configured priority list of AS encryption algorithms and apply the key indicated in the SeNB Security Key IE as specified in the TS 33.401 [18]. - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the SeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the SeNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - If the Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for LIPA operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the SIPTO Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for SIPTO@LN operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB and is set to "non IP", the SeNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.1.3.5 S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: SGW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation If the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be modified which is configured with the SCG bearer option the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE the SeNB shall use it as the new UL S1-U address.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.2.84 Correlation ID - Section Description: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier or GRE key to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the L-GW described in TS 23.401 [12]. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option - the SeNB shall, if included, choose the ciphering algorithm based on the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and locally configured priority list of AS encryption algorithms and apply the key indicated in the SeNB Security Key IE as specified in the TS 33.401 [18]. - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the SeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the SeNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - If the Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for LIPA operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the SIPTO Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for SIPTO@LN operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB and is set to "non IP", the SeNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing both the Correlation ID and the SIPTO Correlation ID IEs for the same E-RAB, the SeNB shall consider the establishment of the corresponding E-RAB as failed.

9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE and/or the E-RABs To Be Modified List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall not admit the action requested for the corresponding E-RABs. If the SeNB receives an SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RAB To Be Released List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall initiate the release of one corresponding E-RAB and ignore the duplication of the instances of the selected corresponding E-RABs.

9.1.3.5 MeNB GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: MeNB endpoint of the X2 transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB configured with the split bearer option to be modified, if the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message includes the SCG Change Indication IE and the MeNB GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE in the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE, the SeNB shall act as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be modified which is configured with the split bearer option the MeNB GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE the SeNB shall use it as the new UL X2-U address.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE and/or the E-RABs To Be Modified List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall not admit the action requested for the corresponding E-RABs.

8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE. For each E-RAB configured with the split bearer option to be modified, if the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message includes the SCG Change Indication IE and the MeNB GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE in the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE, the SeNB shall act as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE and/or the E-RABs To Be Modified List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall not admit the action requested for the corresponding E-RABs. If the SeNB receives an SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RAB To Be Released List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall initiate the release of one corresponding E-RAB and ignore the duplication of the instances of the selected corresponding E-RABs.

9.1.3.5 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes QoS parameters to be modified 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the SeNB shall not admit the corresponding E-RAB.

9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13]. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the SeNB shall not admit the corresponding E-RAB.
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]). 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the SeNB shall not admit the corresponding E-RAB.

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation If applicable, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the SeNB may receive, after having initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released List IE.

8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE. For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option - the SeNB shall, if included, choose the ciphering algorithm based on the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and locally configured priority list of AS encryption algorithms and apply the key indicated in the SeNB Security Key IE as specified in the TS 33.401 [18]. - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the SeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the SeNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - If the Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for LIPA operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the SIPTO Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for SIPTO@LN operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB and is set to "non IP", the SeNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB. For each E-RAB configured with the split bearer option to be modified (released) - if applicable, the MeNB may provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation If the SeNB has initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure with the SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message including the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE, it may receive the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the SCG Change Indication IE, upon which the SeNB shall provide respective information in the SeNB to MeNB Container IE within the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGMENT message, as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.4 Abnormal Conditions If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE and/or the E-RABs To Be Modified List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall not admit the action requested for the corresponding E-RABs. If the SeNB receives an SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RAB To Be Released List IE) set to the same value, the SeNB shall initiate the release of one corresponding E-RAB and ignore the duplication of the instances of the selected corresponding E-RABs.

9.1.3.5 DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of DL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option - the SeNB shall, if included, choose the ciphering algorithm based on the information in the UE Security Capabilities IE and locally configured priority list of AS encryption algorithms and apply the key indicated in the SeNB Security Key IE as specified in the TS 33.401 [18]. - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the SeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the SeNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - If the Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for LIPA operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the SIPTO Correlation ID IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB, the SeNB shall use this information for SIPTO@LN operation for the concerned E-RAB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the SeNB and is set to "non IP", the SeNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB. For each E-RAB configured with the split bearer option to be modified (released) - if applicable, the MeNB may provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation If applicable, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the SeNB may receive, after having initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure, the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released List IE.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.3.5 MeNB to SeNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the SCG-ConfigInfo message as defined in TS 36.331 [9] 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the SeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing the MeNB to SeNB Container IE that does not include required information as specified in TS 36.331 [9], the SeNB shall send the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST REJECT message to the MeNB.

9.2.52 CSG Membership Status - Section Description: This element indicates the membership status of the UE to a particular CSG. 8.6.3 MeNB initiated SeNB Modification Preparation 8.6.3.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain - within the UE Context Information IE; - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SeNB Container IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE; - the CSG Membership Status IE.
9.1.3.5 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB
9.1.3.5 SeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB

section_list.name: SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by the SeNB to confirm the MeNB's request to modify the SeNB resources for a specific UE.
Direction: SeNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.3.6 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.3.6 SeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

The message shall contain the Cause IE with an appropriate value.

9.2.73 SCG Change Indication - Section Description: The SCG Change Indication IE is either used to request the SeNB to prepare the SCG Change in the SeNB or to request the MeNB to initiate the SCG Change towards the UE (see TS 36.300 [15]). 8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the SeNB to MeNB Container IE. - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE. If the MeNB receives a SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message containing the SCG Change Indication IE, the MeNB shall act as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. If the SeNB has initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure with the SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message including the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE, it may receive the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the SCG Change Indication IE, upon which the SeNB shall provide respective information in the SeNB to MeNB Container IE within the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGMENT message, as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

8.6.4 SeNB initiated SeNB Modification 8.6.4.2 Successful Operation The SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the SeNB to MeNB Container IE. - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SCG Change Indication IE. If the SeNB has initiated the SeNB initiated SeNB Modification procedure with the SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message including the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE, it may receive the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the SCG Change Indication IE, upon which the SeNB shall provide respective information in the SeNB to MeNB Container IE within the SENB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGMENT message, as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

If the MeNB has a Prepared SeNB Modification and receives the SENB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the MeNB shall respond with the SENB MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the SeNB with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

8.6.5 MeNB initiated SeNB Release 8.6.5.2 Successful Operation If the bearer context in the SeNB was configured with the SCG bearer option, for each SCG bearer for which the MeNB requests forwarding of uplink/downlink data, the MeNB includes the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint/ DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message to indicate that the SeNB should perform data forwarding of uplink/downlink packets for that SCG bearer. If the bearer context in the SeNB was configured with the split bearer option, for each Split bearer for which the MeNB requests forwarding of downlink data, the MeNB includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message to indicate that the SeNB should perform data forwarding of downlink packets for that split bearer.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.3.11 UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of UL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.3.11 DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer. used for forwarding of DL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. 9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.3.11 DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer. used for forwarding of DL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). If the bearer context in the SeNB was configured with the split bearer option, for each Split bearer for which the MeNB requests forwarding of downlink data, the MeNB includes the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message to indicate that the SeNB should perform data forwarding of downlink packets for that split bearer.

9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.2.85 UE Context Kept Indicator - Section Description: This IE indicates that the UE Context at the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS 36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32]. 8.2.3 UE Context Release 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation The SeNB may receive the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message including the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True", upon which the SeNB shall, if supported, only release the resources related to the UE-associated signalling connection between the MeNB and the SeNB, as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. 8.6.5 MeNB initiated SeNB Release 8.6.5.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message containing UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True", the SeNB shall, if supported, only initiate the release of the resources related to the UE-associated signalling connection between the MeNB and the SeNB.
9.1.3.11 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB

9.1.3.11 SeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB 8.6.5 MeNB initiated SeNB Release 8.6.5.2 Successful Operation The MeNB initiates the procedure by sending the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message. Upon reception of the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message the SeNB shall stop providing user data to the UE. The SeNB UE X2AP ID IE and, if available, the SeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE shall be included if it has been obtained from the SeNB. The MeNB may provide appropriate information within the Cause IE.

8.6.5 MeNB initiated SeNB Release 8.6.5.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the SENB RELEASE REQUEST message containing MakeBeforeBreak Indicator IE set to "True", the SeNB shall, if supported, perform Make-Before-Break SeNB change as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

section_list.name: SENB RELEASE REQUIRED
aoa:
This message is sent by the SeNB to request the release of all resources for a specific UE at the SeNB.
Direction: SeNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.3.12 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.3.12 SeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. 9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

8.6.6 SeNB initiated SeNB Release 8.6.6.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the SENB RELEASE REQUIRED message, the MeNB replies with the SENB RELEASE CONFIRM message. For each E-RAB configured with the SCG bearer option, the MeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink and downlink packets to be performed for that bearer. For each E-RAB configured with the split bearer option, the MeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of downlink packets to be performed for that bearer.

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE
9.1.3.13 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB
9.1.3.13 SeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB

aoa:
This message is sent by the SeNB to request the verification of the value of the PDCP COUNTs associated with SCG bearers established in the SeNB.
Direction: SeNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.3.14 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.3.14 SeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the SeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

section_list.name: Messages for E-UTRAN-NR Dual Connectivity Procedures
SGNB ADDITION REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB to request the preparation of resources for EN-DC operation for a specific UE
Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.1 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.2.107 NR UE Security Capabilities - Section Description: This IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in NR as defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.107 NR Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, "first bit" – 128-NEA1, "second bit" – 128-NEA2, "third bit" – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.107 NR Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, "first bit" – 128-NIA1, "second bit" – 128-NIA2, "third bit" – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.1.4.1 SgNB Security Key IE Semantics: The S-KgNB which is provided by the MeNB, see TS 33.401 [18]. 9.2.101 SgNB Security Key - Section Description: The SgNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the en-gNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18]. 9.2.101 SgNB Security Key IE Semantics: The S-KgNB which is provided by the MeNB, see TS 33.401 [18].

9.1.4.1 SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and en-gNB respectively. 9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate - Section Description: On Handover Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is transferred to the target eNB. In Dual Connectivity, UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and SeNB respectively as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and provided by the MME to the eNB.

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  ├─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
│  └─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.1.4.1 Selected PLMN IE Semantics: The selected PLMN of the SCG in the en-gNB. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3 Handover Restriction List - Section Description: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the eNB provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover and CCO, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Handover Restriction List IE, the en-gNB node, if supported, shall store this information and use it to select an appropriate NR cell.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC). 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Serving PLMN IE, the en-gNB may use it for RRM purposes.

9.2.3 Equivalent PLMNs IE Semantics: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of "equivalent PLMNs list" as defined in TS 24.301 [14]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Forbidden TAs IE Semantics: intra E-UTRAN roaming restrictions

9.2.3 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: The PLMN of forbidden TACs 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 TAC IE Semantics: The forbidden TAC
9.2.3 Forbidden LAs IE Semantics: inter-3GPP RAT roaming restrictions

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
ENUMERATED (ALL, GERAN, UTRAN, CDMA2000, …, GERAN and UTRAN, CDMA2000 and UTRAN)
9.2.3 Forbidden inter RATs IE Semantics: inter-3GPP and 3GPP2 RAT access restrictions. "ALL" means that all RATs mentioned in the enumeration of this IE are restricted.
