9.2.3 NR restriction in EPS as secondary RAT IE Semantics: Restriction to use NR when the NR is used as secondary RAT in EN-DC.

9.2.3 Core Network Type Restrictions IE Semantics: Includes any of the Serving PLMN or any PLMN of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which core network type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [38].

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Core Network Type IE Semantics: The indication indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to 5GC or to EPC for this PLMN.
9.2.3 NR Restriction in 5GS IE Semantics: Restriction to use NR when the NR connects to 5GS.

9.2.3 Last NG-RAN PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Indicates the NG-RAN PLMN from where the UE formerly handed over to EPS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to 5GS. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Unlicensed Spectrum Restriction IE Semantics: Restriction to use unlicensed spectrum in the form of LAA or LWA/LWIP or NR-U as described in TS 23.401 [11].

8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation NOTE: The MeNB may trigger the SgNB Addition Preparation procedure in the course of the Inter-MeNB handover without SgNB change procedure as described in TS 37.340 [32]. The deleted E-RABs are not included in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, from MeNB point of view. If the en-gNB reports a certain E-RAB to be successfully established, respective SCG resources, from an en-gNB point of view, may be actually successfully established or modified or kept; if a certain E-RAB is reported to be failed to be established, respective SCG resources, from an en-gNB point of view, may be actually failed to be established or modified or kept. For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB receives a SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE) set to the same value, the en-gNB shall consider the establishment of the corresponding E-RAB as failed.

8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB receives a SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing multiple E-RAB ID IEs (in the E-RABs To Be Added List IE) set to the same value, the en-gNB shall consider the establishment of the corresponding E-RAB as failed.
9.2.122 DRB ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies a DRB over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

9.1.4.1 EN-DC Resource Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP and Lower Layer MCG/SCG configuration. 9.2.108 EN-DC Resource Configuration - Section Description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB successfully established in the en-gNB, the en-gNB shall report to the MeNB, in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the same value in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE as received in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message.
9.1.4.1 PDCP present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present".

9.1.4.1 Full E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes the E-RAB level QoS parameters as received on S1-MME. 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.

9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13]. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB receives a SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the en-gNB shall consider the establishment of the corresponding E-RAB as failed.
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]). 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB receives a SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the en-gNB shall consider the establishment of the corresponding E-RAB as failed.

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.1.4.1 - MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE - ifMCGpresent: This IE shall be present if, for the E-RAB requested to be added, the MCG resources IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present". 9.1.4.1 MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE Semantics: MeNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at MCG. For delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.1.4.1 PDCP not present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "not present".

9.1.4.1 Requested SCG E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes E-RAB level QoS parameters requested to be provided by the SCG. 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.

9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13]. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB receives a SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the en-gNB shall consider the establishment of the corresponding E-RAB as failed.
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]). 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB receives a SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing a E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE which contains a QCI IE indicating a GBR bearer (as defined in TS 23.203 [13]), and which does not contain the GBR QoS Information IE, the en-gNB shall consider the establishment of the corresponding E-RAB as failed.

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.9 Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for downlink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.9 Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for uplink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.
│           ├─MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP

9.1.4.1 MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE Semantics: MeNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer. For delivery of UL PDCP PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication Activation IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it may provide the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message if PDCP duplication is configured at the en-gNB. If the en-gNB provides for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE to the MeNB in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message and the MeNB has not provided the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, the MeNB shall trigger the MeNB initiated SgNB Modification procedure to provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the SgNB. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the MeNB has provided the en-gNB for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication Activation IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, and the en-gNB does not provide the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the MeNB shall assume that PDCP duplication was not configured at the en-gNB and releases duplication resources. If the en-gNB provides for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message and the MeNB has not provided the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication Activation IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, and the MeNB does not trigger the MeNB initiated SgNB Modification procedure to provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication Activation IE to the SgNB the en-gNB before the SgNB Reconfigurationi Completion procedure was triggered, the en-gNB shall trigger the release of the concerned E-RAB.

9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19] 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26] 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.1.4.1 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode to be used in the assisting node. 9.2.119 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for an E-RAB. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.1.4.1 - UL Configuration IE - ifMCGandSCGpresent: This IE shall be present if, for the E-RAB requested to be added, the MCG resources and SCG resources IEs in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE are set to the value "present". 9.1.4.1 UL Configuration IE Semantics: Information about UL usage in the en-gNB. 9.2.118 UL Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the assisting node. 9.2.118 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the assisting node.

9.1.4.1 UL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP SN length of the bearer for the UL. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the UL PDCP SN Length IE and the DL PDCP SN Length IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, store this information and use it for lower layer configuration of the concerned MN terminated bearer.

9.1.4.1 DL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP SN length of the bearer for the DL. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the UL PDCP SN Length IE and the DL PDCP SN Length IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, store this information and use it for lower layer configuration of the concerned MN terminated bearer.

9.1.4.1 Duplication activation IE Semantics: Indicated the initial staus of PDCP duplication. 9.2.137 Duplication activation - Section Description: The Duplication Activation IE indicates whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication activation IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it may provide the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message if PDCP duplication is configured at the en-gNB. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the MeNB has provided the en-gNB for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication activation IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, and the en-gNB does not provide the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the MeNB shall assume that PDCP duplication was not configured at the en-gNB and releases duplication resources. If the en-gNB provides for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message and the MeNB has not provided the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication activation IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, and the MeNB does not trigger the MeNB initiated SgNB Modification procedure to provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication activation IE to the SgNB the en-gNB before the SgNB Reconfigurationi Completion procedure was triggered, the en-gNB shall trigger the release of the concerned E-RAB.
9.1.4.1 MeNB to SgNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

9.1.4.1 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE is contained in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, the en-gNB shall, if supported, store this information and use it as defined in TS 37.340 [32]. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB receives a SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing a SgNB UE X2AP ID IE that does not match any existing UE Context that has such ID, the en-gNB shall reject the procedure using the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST REJECT message.

9.2.70 Expected UE Behaviour - Section Description: This IE defines the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the eNB/en-gNB in determining the optimum RRC connection time. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Expected UE Behaviour IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, store this information and may use it to optimize resource allocation.
9.2.71 Expected UE Activity Behaviour - Section Description: Indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.401 [12].
9.2.71 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.71 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.71 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.
ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, …)

9.2.70 Expected HO Interval IE Semantics: Indicates the expected time interval between inter-eNB handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter-eNB handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.
9.1.4.1 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB.
9.1.4.1 Requested split SRBs IE Semantics: Indicates that resources for Split SRB are requested.

9.1.4.1 MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resources utilisation between MeNB and en-gNB. 9.2.116 MeNB Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE is LTE resource allocation at MeNB and used at the en-gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the MeNB and the en-gNB. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
9.2.116 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PCell. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.116 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.2.116 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.2.116 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed PSCell. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

9.2.139 MeNB Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the MeNB and used by the SgNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. 9.2.139 MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE Semantics: The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
ENUMERATED (SN change, inter-eNB HO, intra-eNB HO, ...)
9.1.4.1 SGNB Addition Trigger Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates the trigger for SGNB Addition procedure.

9.2.25 Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority - Section Description: The Subscriber Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in Active mode (TS 36.300 [15]). 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority IE, the en-gNB may use it for RRM purposes.

9.1.4.1 MeNB Cell ID IE Semantics: Indicates the cell ID for PCell in MeNB. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.141 Desired Activity Notification Level - Section Description: This IE contains information on which level activity notification shall be performed. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation Upon receiving an SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message containing the Desired Activity Notification Level IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use this information to decide whether to trigger subsequent SgNB Activitity Notification procedures according to the requested notification level.

9.2.2 Trace Activation - Section Description: Defines parameters related to trace activation. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If Trace Activation IE has previously been received for this UE, it shall be included in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. If the Trace Activation IE is included in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, the en-gNB shall, if supported, initiate the requested trace function as described in TS 32.422 [6].

9.2.2 E-UTRAN Trace ID IE Semantics: The E-UTRAN Trace ID IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information coded as in 9.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (last 2 octets)

9.2.2 Interfaces To Trace IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a eNB interface: first bit =S1-MME, second bit =X2, third bit =Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1. Other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.
ENUMERATED ( minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, ...)
9.2.2 Trace Depth IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.421 [7]
9.2.2 Trace Collection Entity IP Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.56 MDT Configuration - Section Description: The IE defines the MDT configuration parameters.
ENUMERATED (Immediate MDT only, Immediate MDT and Trace, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code. The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 Measurements to Activate IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap indicates a MDT measurement, as defined in TS 37.320 [25]. First Bit = M1, Second Bit = M2, Third Bit = M3, Fourth Bit = M4, Fifth Bit = M5, Sixth Bit = logging of M1 from event triggered measurement reports according to existing RRM configuration. Seventh Bit = M6, Eighth Bit = M7. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate".
9.2.56 M1 Reporting Trigger IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "0".

9.2.56 - M1 Threshold Event A2 IE - ifM1A2trigger: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "1" and the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "A2event-triggered" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Threshold Event A2 IE Semantics: Included in case of event-triggered or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
9.2.56 Threshold RSRP IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Threshold RSRQ IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

9.2.56 - M1 Periodic reporting IE - ifperiodicMDT: This IE shall be present if the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "periodic" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Periodic reporting IE Semantics: Included in case of periodic or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
ENUMERATED ( ms120, ms240, ms480, ms640, ms1024, ms2048, ms5120, ms10240, min1, min6, min12, min30, min60)
9.2.56 Report interval IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Report amount IE Semantics: Number of reports

9.2.56 - M3 Configuration IE - ifM3: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the third bit set to "1". 9.2.61 M3 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M4 Configuration IE - ifM4: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fourth bit set to "1". 9.2.62 M4 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M4 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M5 Configuration IE - ifM5: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fifth bit set to "1". 9.2.63 M5 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M5 measurement collection.

9.2.56 MDT Location Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents requested location information as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = GNSS Second Bit = E-CID information. Other bits are reserved for future use and are ignored if received. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate". The eNB shall ignore the first bit unless the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit or the sixth bit set to "1".
9.2.64 MDT PLMN List - Section Description: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 - M6 Configuration IE - ifM6: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the seventh bit set to "1". 9.2.87 M6 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)
9.2.87 - M6 Delay Threshold IE - ifUL: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

9.2.56 - M7 Configuration IE - ifM7: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the eighth bit set to "1". 9.2.88 M7 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
9.2.88 M7 Collection Period IE Semantics: Unit: minutes
9.2.134 Bluetooth Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for Bluetooth measurement collection.
9.2.134 BT RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection.
9.2.135 WLAN RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RTT IE Semantics: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.121 UE Application layer measurement configuration - Section Description: The IE defines configuration information for the QoE Measurement Collection (QMC) function.
9.2.121 Container for application layer measurement configuration IE Semantics: Indicates application layer measurement configuration, see Annex L in [36].
9.2.121 TAC IE Semantics: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
ENUMERATED (QMC for streaming service, QMC for MTSI service, ...)
9.2.121 Service Type IE Semantics: This IE indicates the service type of UE application layer measurements.
9.1.4.1 Location Information at SgNB reporting IE Semantics: Indicates that the user’s location information is to be provided.

9.2.69 Masked IMEISV - Section Description: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment. 9.2.69 Masked IMEISV IE Semantics: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [29] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the Masked IMEISV IE is contained in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message the en-gNB shall, if supported, use it to determine the characteristics of the UE for subsequent handling.

9.2.25a Additional RRM Policy Index - Section Description: The Additional RRM Policy Index IE is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains the Additional RRM Policy Index IE, the en-gNB may use it for RRM purposes.

9.1.4.1 Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE Semantics: Indicates that the resources for fast MCG recovery via SRB3 are requested. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation The MeNB may request the en-gNB to configure the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. The en-gNB may include the Available fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that the SRB3 is enabled.

9.2.152 RAN UE NGAP ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies the UE association over the NG interface within the NG-RAN node. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Reference at Source NG-RAN IE is contained in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, the en-gNB shall, if supported, store this information and use it for UE context retrieval and allocate data forwarding resources as specified in TS 37.340 [32].

section_list.name: SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to confirm the MeNB about the SgNB addition preparation.
Direction: en-gNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.2 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.2 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation The en-gNB shall report to the MeNB, in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the result for all the requested E-RABs in the following way: - a list of E-RABs which are successfully established shall be included in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE; - a list of E-RABs which failed to be established shall be included in the E-RABs Not Admitted List IE. For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.4.2 EN-DC Resource Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP and Lower Layer MCG/SCG configuration. 9.2.108 EN-DC Resource Configuration - Section Description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB successfully established in the en-gNB, the en-gNB shall report to the MeNB, in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the same value in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE as received in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message.
9.1.4.2 PDCP present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present".
│        │  ├─S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB

9.1.4.2 S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE Semantics: en-gNB endpoint of the S1 transport bearer. For delivery of DL PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.4 SgNB Addition Preparation 8.7.4.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.1.4.2 - SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE - ifMCGpresent: This IE shall be present if, for the E-RAB admitted to be added, the MCG resources IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present". 9.1.4.2 SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE Semantics: en-gNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at PDCP. This GTP tunnel endpoint may be different from the corresponding GTP tunnel endpoint, i.e the information contained in the Transport Layer Address IE and the DL GTP TEID IE in the E-RAB To Be Modified List IE of the E-RAB MODIFICATION INDICATION message (see TS 36.413 [4]) depending on implementation choice; - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - the en-gNB shall use the S1 UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message as the UL S1-U address. - the MeNB shall use the SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE of the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message as the UL X2-U address. - if the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message contains for an E-RAB to be added which is requested to be configured with MCG resources the MeNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at MCG IE the en-gNB shall use it as the DL X2-U address for delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE. - the en-gNB shall include in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the RLC Mode IE. - the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE the PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To be Added List IE in the SGNB ADDITION REQUEST message, it indicates the mode that the MeNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the MeNB. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to "non IP", the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.
