9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]
9.1.4.5 PDCP not present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "not present".

9.2.25 Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority - Section Description: The Subscriber Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in Active mode (TS 36.300 [15]). 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority IE, the en-gNB may use it for RRM purposes.

9.2.25a Additional RRM Policy Index - Section Description: The Additional RRM Policy Index IE is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Additional RRM Policy Index IE, the en-gNB may use it for RRM purposes.

9.1.4.5 MeNB to SgNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in TS 38.331 [31]. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain: - within the UE Context Information IE (if the modification of the UE context at the en-gNB is requested); - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SgNB Container IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the en-gNB receives a SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing the MeNB to SgNB Container IE that does not include required information as specified in TS 38.331 [31], the en-gNB shall send the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST REJECT message to the MeNB. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If applicable, as specified in TS 37.340 [32], the en-gNB may receive, after having initiated the SgNB initiated SgNB Modification procedure, the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message including the measGapConfig IE as defined in TS 38.331 [31] within the MeNB to SgNB Container IE.
9.1.4.5 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB

9.1.4.5 MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resources utilisation between MeNB and en-gNB. 9.2.116 MeNB Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE is LTE resource allocation at MeNB and used at the en-gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the MeNB and the en-gNB. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain: - within the UE Context Information IE (if the modification of the UE context at the en-gNB is requested); - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SgNB Container IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE. If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
9.2.116 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PCell. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.116 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.2.116 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.2.116 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed PSCell. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

9.2.139 MeNB Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the MeNB and used by the SgNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. 9.2.139 MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE Semantics: The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.1.4.5 Requested split SRBs IE Semantics: Indicates that resources for Split SRB are requested. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain: - within the UE Context Information IE (if the modification of the UE context at the en-gNB is requested); - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SgNB Container IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE. If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested split SRBs IE, the en-gNB may use it to add split SRBs. If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested split SRBs release IE, the en-gNB may use it to release split SRBs.

9.1.4.5 Requested split SRBs release IE Semantics: Indicates that resources for Split SRB are requested to be released. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain: - within the UE Context Information IE (if the modification of the UE context at the en-gNB is requested); - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SgNB Container IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE. If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested split SRBs IE, the en-gNB may use it to add split SRBs. If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the Requested split SRBs release IE, the en-gNB may use it to release split SRBs.

9.2.141 Desired Activity Notification Level - Section Description: This IE contains information on which level activity notification shall be performed. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation Upon receiving an SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message containing the Desired Activity Notification Level IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use this information to decide whether to trigger subsequent SgNB Activity Notification procedures, or stop or modify ongoing triggering of these procedures due to a previous request.
9.1.4.5 Location Information at SgNB reporting IE Semantics: Indicates that the user’s location information is to be provided.

9.1.4.5 MeNB Cell ID IE Semantics: Indicates the cell ID for PCell in MeNB. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]). 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MeNB Cell ID IE, the en-gNB may search for the target NR cell among the NR neighbour cells of the E-UTRAN cell indicated in MeNB Cell ID IE, as specified in the TS 37.340 [32].

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.4.5 Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE Semantics: Indicates that the resources for fast MCG recovery via SRB3 are requested. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain: - within the UE Context Information IE (if the modification of the UE context at the en-gNB is requested); - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SgNB Container IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE. The MeNB may request the en-gNB to configure the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The MeNB may request the en-gNB to release the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The en-gNB may include the Available fast MCG recovery via SRB3 or the Release fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that the SRB3 is enabled or released.
└─Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release

9.1.4.5 Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE Semantics: Indicates that the resources for fast MCG recovery via SRB3 are requested to be released. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message may contain: - within the UE Context Information IE (if the modification of the UE context at the en-gNB is requested); - E-RABs to be added within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE; - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE; - the MeNB to SgNB Container IE; - the SCG Configuration Query IE; - the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE; - the Requested split SRBs IE; - the Requested split SRBs release IE; - the Requested fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE; - the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE. The MeNB may request the en-gNB to configure the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The MeNB may request the en-gNB to release the SRB3 by including the Requested Fast MCG recovery via SRB3 Release IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. The en-gNB may include the Available fast MCG recovery via SRB3 or the Release fast MCG recovery via SRB3 IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that the SRB3 is enabled or released.

section_list.name: SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
aoa:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to confirm the MeNB's request to modify the en-gNB resources for a specific UE.
Direction: en-gNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.6 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.6 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Modified List IE which is configured with the SN terminated split bearer option in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Configuration IE to indicate that the MCG UL configuration of the UE has changed. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL PDCP SN Length IE and the DL PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to"non IP", then the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Modified List IE which is configured with the SN terminated split bearer option in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Configuration IE to indicate that the MCG UL configuration of the UE has changed. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL PDCP SN Length IE and the DL PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to"non IP", then the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.4.6 EN-DC Resource Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP and Lower Layer MCG/SCG configuration. 9.2.108 EN-DC Resource Configuration - Section Description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB successfully established or modified or released in the en-gNB, the en-gNB shall report to the MeNB, in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the same value in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE as received in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message.
9.1.4.6 PDCP present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present".
│        │  ├─S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB

9.1.4.6 S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE Semantics: SgNB endpoint of the S1 transport bearer. For delivery of DL PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For an E-RAB to be modified which is configured with the PDCP entity in the en-gNB the en-gNB may include in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]
│        │  ├─SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP

9.1.4.6 - SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE - ifMCGpresent: This IE shall be present if, for the E-RAB admitted to be added, the MCG resources IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present". 9.1.4.6 SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE Semantics: SgNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at PDCP. For delivery of UL PDCP PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.4.6 - RLC Mode IE - ifMCGpresent: This IE shall be present if, for the E-RAB admitted to be added, the MCG resources IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present". 9.1.4.6 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode to be used at the assisting node. 9.2.119 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for an E-RAB.

9.1.4.6 DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of DL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Modified List IE which is configured with the SN terminated split bearer option in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Configuration IE to indicate that the MCG UL configuration of the UE has changed. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL PDCP SN Length IE and the DL PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to"non IP", then the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.4.6 UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of UL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Modified List IE which is configured with the SN terminated split bearer option in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Configuration IE to indicate that the MCG UL configuration of the UE has changed. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL PDCP SN Length IE and the DL PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to"non IP", then the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.4.6 - Requested MCG E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE - ifMCGandSCGpresent_GBRpresent: This IE shall be present if, for the E-RAB admitted to be added, the MCG resources and SCG resources IEs in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE are set to the value "present", and the GBR QoS Information IE is present in the Requested MCG E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE. 9.1.4.6 Requested MCG E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes E-RAB level QoS parameters requested to be provided by the MCG. 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.
9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13].
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.9 Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for downlink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.9 Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for uplink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.1.4.6 - UL Configuration IE - ifMCGandSCGpresent: This IE shall be present if, for the E-RAB admitted to be added, the MCG resources and SCG resources IEs in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE are set to the value "present". 9.1.4.6 UL Configuration IE Semantics: Information about UL usage in the MeNB. 9.2.118 UL Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the assisting node. 9.2.118 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the assisting node. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB for which allocation of the PDCP entity is requested at the en-gNB: - if applicable, the MeNB may propose to apply forwarding of downlink data by including the DL Forwarding IE within the E-RABs To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. For each E-RAB that it has decided to admit, the en-gNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message to indicate that it accepts the proposed forwarding of downlink data for this bearer. The MeNB may also provide for an applicable E-RAB to be released the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink packets to be performed for that bearer. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Modified List IE which is configured with the SN terminated split bearer option in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL Configuration IE to indicate that the MCG UL configuration of the UE has changed. - if applicable, the en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs Admitted To Be Added List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the UL PDCP SN Length IE and the DL PDCP SN Length IE to indicate the PDCP SN length for that bearer. - If the Bearer Type IE for the concerned E-RAB is received by the en-gNB and is set to"non IP", then the en-gNB shall, if supported, not perform header compression for the concerned E-RAB.

9.1.4.6 PDCP not present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "not present".
│           ├─SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG

9.1.4.6 SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE Semantics: Endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at the SCG. For delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB configured with SCG resources and the PDCP entity is hosted by the MeNB and - requested to be modified, - if the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message includes the MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE in the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE, the en-gNB shall act as specified in TS 37.340 [32]. - if the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message contains the MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE the en-gNB shall use it as the new UL X2-U address. - the en-gNB may include in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message the SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE. If the en-gNB receives for an E-RAB to be setup for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication Activation IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message, it may provide the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message if PDCP duplication is configured at the en-gNB. If the en-gNB provides for an E-RAB to be setup for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE and the LCID IE to the MeNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message and the MeNB has not provided the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication Activation IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message, the MeNB shall trigger the MeNB initiated SgNB Modification procedure to provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE and the Duplication Activation IE to the SgNB. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.4 Abnormal Conditions If the MeNB has provided the en-gNB for an E-RAB to be setupr which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message, and the en-gNB does not provide the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE to the MeNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the MeNB shall assume that PDCP duplication was not configured at the en-gNB and releases duplication resources. If the en-gNB provides for an E-RAB to be setup for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE to the MeNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message and the MeNB has not provided the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message, and the MeNB does not trigger the MeNB initiated SgNB Modification procedure to provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the SgNB the en-gNB before the SgNB Reconfigurationi Completion procedure was triggered, the en-gNB shall trigger the release of the concerned E-RAB.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.4.6 EN-DC Resource Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP and Lower Layer MCG/SCG configuration. 9.2.108 EN-DC Resource Configuration - Section Description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB successfully established or modified or released in the en-gNB, the en-gNB shall report to the MeNB, in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message, the same value in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE as received in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUEST message.

9.1.4.6 Requested MCG E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes E-RAB level QoS parameters requested to be provided by the MCG. 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.
9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13].
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period.
