ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.1.4.8 RLC Mode IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC mode at the en-gNB for PDCP transfer to MeNB. 9.2.119 RLC Mode - Section Description: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for an E-RAB. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the RLC Mode IE is included for an E-RAB within the E-RABs To Be Released List IE (for E-RABs hosted at the en-gNB) in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it indicates the mode that the en-gNB used for the E-RAB when it was hosted at the en-gNB.

9.1.4.8 SgNB to MeNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the NR CG-Config message as defined in TS 38.331 [31]. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SgNB to MeNB Container IE. - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE.
9.1.4.8 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB

8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation The en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs To Be Modified List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message the New DRB ID Request IE to request the MeNB to assign a new DRB ID for that bearer.

8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SgNB to MeNB Container IE. - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.4.8 EN-DC Resource Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP and Lower Layer MCG/SCG configuration. 9.2.108 EN-DC Resource Configuration - Section Description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB successfully modified or released as requested by the en-gNB, the MeNB shall inform the en-gNB, in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message, the same value in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE as received in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message.
9.1.4.8 PDCP present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present".

9.1.4.8 Requested MCG E-RAB Level QoS Parameters IE Semantics: Includes E-RAB level QoS parameters requested to be provided by the MCG. 9.2.9 E-RAB Level QoS Parameters - Section Description: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.
9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13].
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.9 Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for downlink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.9 Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for uplink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.1.4.8 UL Configuration IE Semantics: Information about UL usage in the MeNB. 9.2.118 UL Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the assisting node. 9.2.118 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the assisting node. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation For the SN terminated split bearers, the en-gNB may include in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message the UL Configuration IE to indicate that the MCG UL configuration of the UE has changed.

9.1.4.8 UL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Shall be ignored by the MeNB if received. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size.

9.1.4.8 DL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Shall be ignored by the MeNB if received. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size.
│        │  ├─SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP

9.1.4.8 SgNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE Semantics: SgNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at PDCP. For delivery of UL PDCP PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]
│        │  ├─S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB

9.1.4.8 S1 DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at the SgNB IE Semantics: en-gNB endpoint of the S1 transport bearer. For delivery of DL PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation The en-gNB may include for each bearer in the E-RABs to Be Modified List IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message the New DRB ID Request IE to request the MeNB to assign a new DRB ID for that bearer.
9.1.4.8 PDCP not present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "not present".
│           ├─SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG

9.1.4.8 SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE Semantics: SgNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at the SCG. For delivery of DL PDCP PDUs. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the MeNB receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it shall provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the en-gNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message. If the LCID IE is included in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the MeNB should take it into account. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB does not receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the en-gNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message although the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE was provided to the MeNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it shall assume the setup of the secondary X2-U bearer as being failed.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]
│           ├─Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG

9.1.4.8 Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE Semantics: SgNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at the SCG. For delivery of DL PDCP PDUs for PDCP duplication. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the MeNB receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it shall provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the en-gNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message. If the LCID IE is included in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the MeNB should take it into account. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB does not receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the en-gNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message although the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE was provided to the MeNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it shall assume the setup of the secondary X2-U bearer as being failed.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.4.8 RLC Status IE Semantics: Indicates the RLC has been re-established.. 9.2.131 RLC Status - Section Description: This IE indicates about the RLC configuration change included in the container towards the UE. 9.2.131 Reestablishment Indication IE Semantics: Indicates that following the change of the radio status, the RLC has been re-established. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the RLC Status IE, the MeNB shall assume that RLC has been reestablished at the en-gNB and may trigger PDCP data recovery.

9.1.4.8 LCID IE Semantics: Indicate the LCID of the primary path in case of PDCP duplication 9.2.138 LCID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies a LCID for the associated DRB. 9.2.138 LCID IE Semantics: Corresponds to the LogicalChannelIdentity defined in TS 38.331 [8]. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the MeNB receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it shall provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the en-gNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message. If the LCID IE is included in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the MeNB should take it into account.

9.1.4.8 SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resources utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. 9.2.117 SgNB Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the PCell which are not available for use by the MeNB and is used at the MeNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation The SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message may contain - the PDCP Change Indication IE; - the SgNB to MeNB Container IE. - E-RABs to be modified within the E-RABs To Be Modified Item IE; - E-RABs to be released within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE; - the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE. If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the en-gNB. The MeNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The MeNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
9.2.117 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PSCell. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

9.2.117 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the en-gNB. The MeNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The MeNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.2.117 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the en-gNB. The MeNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The MeNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.2.117 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.140 SgNB Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the SgNB and used by the MeNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. 9.2.140 SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE Semantics: The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message contains the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the en-gNB. The MeNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The MeNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the MeNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

9.1.4.8 RRC config indication IE Semantics: Indicates the type of RRC configuration used at the en-gNB. 9.2.132 RRC config indication - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the type of RRC configuration used at the en-gNB. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB applied a full configuration or delta configuration, e.g. as part of a mobility procedure involving a change of DU, the en-gNB shall inform the MeNB by including the RRC config indication IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message.

9.1.4.8 Location Information at SgNB IE Semantics: Contains information to support localisation of the UE 9.2.142 Location Information at SgNB - Section Description: The Location Information at SgNB IE enables the SgNB to provide the MeNB with information that supports localisation of the UE.
9.2.142 PSCell ID IE Semantics: PSCell of the UE 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

section_list.name: SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the en-gNB about the successful modification.
Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.9 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.9 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.4.9 EN-DC Resource Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP and Lower Layer MCG/SCG configuration. 9.2.108 EN-DC Resource Configuration - Section Description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation For each E-RAB successfully modified or released as requested by the en-gNB, the MeNB shall inform the en-gNB, in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message, the same value in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE as received in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message.
9.1.4.9 PDCP not present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "not present".
│           ├─Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP

9.1.4.9 Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE Semantics: MeNB endpoint of the X2-U transport bearer at the PDCP. For delivery of UL PDCP PDUs for PDCP duplication. 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the MeNB receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it shall provide the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the en-gNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message. If the LCID IE is included in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the MeNB should take it into account. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.4 Abnormal Conditions If the en-gNB does not receives for an E-RAB for which the PDCP entiy is allocated at the MeNB the Secondary MeNB UL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at PDCP IE to the en-gNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message although the Secondary SgNB DL GTP Tunnel Endpoint at SCG IE was provided to the MeNB in the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, it shall assume the setup of the secondary X2-U bearer as being failed.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.4.9 UL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Shall be ignored by the en-gNB if received. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size.

9.1.4.9 DL PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: Shall be ignored by the en-gNB if received. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length - Section Description: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size.

9.1.4.9 MeNB to SgNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the NR RRCReconfigurationComplete message as defined in TS 38.331 [31]. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the MeNB is able to perform the change requested by the en-gNB, the MeNB shall send the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message to the en-gNB. The SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message may contain the MeNB to SgNB Container IE.

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE
9.1.4.9 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB.

9.1.4.9 MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE Semantics: Information used to coordinate resources utilisation between the MeNB and the en-gNB. 9.2.116 MeNB Resource Coordination Information - Section Description: The MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE is LTE resource allocation at MeNB and used at the en-gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the MeNB and the en-gNB. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
9.2.116 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PCell. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.116 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. The en-gNB shall consider the received DL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. If the MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is contained in the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, use the information to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.

The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.2 Successful Operation If the SGNB MODIFICATION CONFIRM message contains the MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE, the en-gNB should forward it to lower layers and it may use it for the purpose of resource coordination with the MeNB. The en-gNB shall consider the received UL Coordination Information IE value valid until reception of a new update of the IE for the same UE. 9.2.116 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed PSCell. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: SGNB MODIFICATION REFUSE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to inform the en-gNB that the SgNB initiated SgNB Modification has failed.
Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.10 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.10 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol. 8.7.6 MeNB initiated SgNB Modification Preparation 8.7.6.4 Abnormal Conditions If the MeNB has a Prepared SgNB Modification and receives the SGNB MODIFICATION REQUIRED message, the MeNB shall respond with the SGNB MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the en-gNB with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE. 8.7.7 SgNB initiated SgNB Modification 8.7.7.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case the requested modification cannot be performed successfully the MeNB shall respond with the SGNB MODIFICATION REFUSE message to the en-gNB with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)
9.1.4.10 MeNB to SgNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE
9.1.4.10 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB.

section_list.name: SGNB RELEASE REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB to request the release of resources.
Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.11 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.11 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.7.9 MeNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.9.2 Successful Operation The MeNB initiates the procedure by sending the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message. Upon reception of the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message the en-gNB shall stop providing user data to the UE. The SgNB UE X2AP ID IE shall be included if it has been obtained from the en-gNB. If the MeNB did not include the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE in the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message, the MeNB shall ignore the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE in the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE message. 8.7.9 MeNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.9.3 Unsuccessful Operation If the MeNB did not include the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE in the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message, the MeNB shall ignore the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE in the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST REJECT message.
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

8.7.9 MeNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.9.2 Successful Operation If the bearer context in the en-gNB was configured with the PDCP entity in the en-gNB, for E-RAB for which the MeNB requests forwarding of uplink/downlink data, the MeNB includes the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint/ DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message to indicate that the en-gNB should perform data forwarding of uplink/downlink packets for that E-RAB.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.1.4.11 EN-DC Resource Configuration IE Semantics: Indicates the PDCP and Lower Layer MCG/SCG configuration. 9.2.108 EN-DC Resource Configuration - Section Description: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG.
9.1.4.11 PDCP present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "present".

9.1.4.11 UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of UL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.4.11 DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer. used for forwarding of DL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.9 MeNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.9.2 Successful Operation If the bearer context in the en-gNB was configured with the PDCP entity in the en-gNB, for E-RAB for which the MeNB requests forwarding of uplink/downlink data, the MeNB includes the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint/ DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE of the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message to indicate that the en-gNB should perform data forwarding of uplink/downlink packets for that E-RAB.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]
9.1.4.11 PDCP not present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "not present".

9.2.85 UE Context Kept Indicator - Section Description: This IE indicates that the UE Context at the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS 36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32]. 8.2.3 UE Context Release 8.2.3.2 Successful Operation The en-gNB may receive the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message including the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True", upon which the en-gNB shall, if supported, only release the resources related to the UE-associated signalling connection between the MeNB and the en-gNB, as specified in TS 37.340 [32]. 8.7.9 MeNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.9.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message containing UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True", the en-gNB shall, if supported, only initiate the release of the resources related to the UE-associated signalling connection between the MeNB and the en-gNB. If the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" and the E-RABs transferred to MeNB IE are included in the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message, then the en-gNB shall, if supported, include the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status for the listed E-RABs, as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.1.4.11 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB
9.1.4.11 MeNB to SgNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

9.1.4.11 E-RABs transferred to MeNB IE Semantics: Indicates the target MeNB reconfigured the listed E-RABs as MN-terminated bearers. 9.2.28 E-RAB List - Section Description: The IE contains a list of E-RAB identities with a cause value. It is used for example to indicate not admitted bearers. 8.7.9 MeNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.9.2 Successful Operation If the UE Context Kept Indicator IE set to "True" and the E-RABs transferred to MeNB IE are included in the SGNB RELEASE REQUEST message, then the en-gNB shall, if supported, include the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status for the listed E-RABs, as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

9.1.4.14 SgNB to MeNB Container IE Semantics: Includes the NR CG-Config message as defined in TS 38.331 [31]. 8.7.10 SgNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.10.2 Successful Operation If the SgNB to MeNB Container IE is included in the SGNB RELEASE REQUIRED message, the MeNB may use the contained information to apply delta configuration.

It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.10 SgNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.10.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the SGNB RELEASE REQUIRED message, the MeNB replies with the SGNB RELEASE CONFIRM message. For each E-RAB configured with the PDCP entity in the en-gNB, the MeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink and downlink packets to be performed for that bearer.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]

9.1.4.15 DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE Semantics: Identifies the X2 transport bearer used for forwarding of DL PDUs 9.2.1 GTP Tunnel Endpoint - Section Description: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport. 8.7.10 SgNB initiated SgNB Release 8.7.10.2 Successful Operation Upon reception of the SGNB RELEASE REQUIRED message, the MeNB replies with the SGNB RELEASE CONFIRM message. For each E-RAB configured with the PDCP entity in the en-gNB, the MeNB may include the DL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE and the UL Forwarding GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE within the E-RABs To Be Released Item IE to indicate that it requests data forwarding of uplink and downlink packets to be performed for that bearer.
9.2.1 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.1 GTP TEID IE Semantics: For details and range, see TS 29.281 [26]
9.1.4.15 PDCP not present in SN IE Semantics: This choice tag is used if the PDCP at SgNB IE in the EN-DC Resource Configuration IE is set to the value "not present".

9.2.7 Criticality Diagnostics - Section Description: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE
9.1.4.15 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB

section_list.name: SGNB COUNTER CHECK REQUEST
aoa:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to request the verification of the value of the PDCP COUNTs associated with the bearers established in the en-gNB.
Direction: en-gNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.16 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.16 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.
9.1.4.16 UL COUNT IE Semantics: Indicates the value of uplink COUNT associated to this E-RAB.
9.1.4.16 DL COUNT IE Semantics: Indicates the value of downlink COUNT associated to this E-RAB.
9.1.4.16 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB

section_list.name: SGNB CHANGE REQUIRED
aoa:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to the MeNB to request the change of en-gNB for a specific UE.
Direction: en-gNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.17 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. 9.2.102 Target SgNB ID Information - Section Description: This IE contains the target SgNB ID used by MeNB to find the target en-gNB. 8.7.8 SgNB Change 8.7.8.2 Successful Operation The en-gNB initiates the procedure by sending the SGNB CHANGE REQUIRED message to the MeNB including the Target SgNB ID Information IE. When the en-gNB sends the SGNB CHANGE REQUIRED message, it shall start the timer TDCoverall.
9.2.112 Global en-gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.112 en-gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the en-gNB.

9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol. 8.7.8 SgNB Change 8.7.8.4 Abnormal Conditions If the MeNB, after having initiated the handover procedure, receives the SGNB CHANGE REQUIRED message, the MeNB shall refuse the SgNB change procedure with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

9.1.4.17 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB.

aoa:

Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB.

CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol. 8.7.8 SgNB Change 8.7.8.3 Unsuccessful Operation In case the request change cannot be performed successfully the MeNB shall respond with the SGNB CHANGE REFUSE message to the en-gNB with an appropriate cause value in the Cause IE.

This message is sent by the en-gNB to report data volumes for secondary RAT.
Direction: en-gNB ? MeNB

CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.20 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.2.120 Secondary RAT Usage Report List - Section Description: This IE provides information on the NR resources used with EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.2.120 Start timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [35]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

9.2.120 End timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [35]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.
9.2.120 Usage count UL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.120 Usage count DL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.1.4.20 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB.

section_list.name: RRC TRANSFER
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to the en-gNB or by the en-gNB to the MeNB to transfer an RRC message.
Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB or en-gNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.21 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.21 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

8.7.12 RRC Transfer 8.7.12.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC container IE in NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery from MeNB to SgNB IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, deliver the contained RRC Container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

9.1.4.21 RRC Container IE Semantics: Contains a PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 36.331 [9] and ciphered with the key of the MeNB 8.7.12 RRC Transfer 8.7.12.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery from MeNB to SgNB IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, deliver the contained RRC Container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.
9.1.4.21 SRB Type IE Semantics: The SRB type

9.1.4.21 Delivery Status IE Semantics: DL RRC delivery status of split SRB 9.2.104 Delivery Status - Section Description: This IE defines the Delivery Status IE of RRC Transfer message. 9.2.104 Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP Sequence Number IE Semantics: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in 38.323 [33]. 8.7.12 RRC Transfer 8.7.12.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC container IE in NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery from MeNB to SgNB IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, deliver the contained RRC Container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

8.7.12 RRC Transfer 8.7.12.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC container IE in NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message with the Delivery Status IE, it shall ignore the message. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, it shall deliver the contained PDCP-C PDU encapsulating an RRC message to the UE. If the en-gNB receives the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery from MeNB to SgNB IE, the en-gNB shall, if supported, deliver the contained RRC Container encapsulating an RRC message to the UE.

9.1.4.21 RRC Container IE Semantics: Includes the UL-DCCH-Message as defined in subclause 6.2.1 of TS 38.331 [31] containing the MeasurementReport message or FailureInformation message. 8.7.12 RRC Transfer 8.7.12.2 Successful Operation If the en-gNB receives an RRC TRANSFER message which does not include the RRC Container IE in the Split SRB IE, or the RRC Container IE in NR UE Report IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from MN to SN IE, or the the RRC Container IE in the Fast MCG Recovery via SRB3 from SN to MN IE, it shall ignore the message. section_list.name: PARTIAL RESET REQUIRED
aoa:
This message is sent by an initiating node to a neighbouring node, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to release all the resources for selected UEs.
Direction: en-gNB ? MeNB, MeNB ? en-gNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.22 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.22 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. 8.7.14 Partial reset of EN-DC 8.7.14.2 Successful Operation The node initiating the procedure shall include the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE in the PARTIAL RESET REQUIRED message if it has already been allocated for the UE. The node receiving the request shall use the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE (if included) and/or the MeNB UE S1AP ID IE (and the MeNB UE S1AP ID Extension IE, if included) to identify the UE association(s) to be released. If the SgNB UE X2AP ID IE was included in the PARTIAL RESET REQUIRED message, the receiving node shall include it also in the PARTIAL RESET CONFIRM message.
9.1.4.22 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB.
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.14 Partial reset of EN-DC 8.7.14.2 Successful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the PARTIAL RESET REQUIRED message and the PARTIAL RESET CONFIRM message shall contain the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.
