section_list.name: E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST
aoa: E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST

Direction: eNB ? en-gNB, en-gNB ? eNB.
This message is sent by a neighbouring eNB to a peer en-gNB or by a neighbouring en-gNB to a peer eNB, both nodes able to interact for EN-DC, to express the desired resource allocation for data traffic, for the sake of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.24 Data Traffic Resource Indication IE Semantics: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic. 9.2.126 Data Traffic Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.7.15 E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination 8.7.15.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an en-gNB over the X2 interface. The en-gNB extracts the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and it replies by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The en-gNB shall calculate the full eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the eNB. An en-gNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an eNB. The eNB replies with the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The en-gNB shall calculate the full eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the eNB.
9.2.126 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.126 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold. 9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern - Section Description: The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.
9.2.128 Subframe Type IE Semantics: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates "regular subframe". Value '1' indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node's subframe 0 in a receiving node's radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the eNB.
9.2.128 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.1.4.24 Spectrum Sharing Group ID IE Semantics: Indicates the E-UTRA cells involved in resource coordination with the NR cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.
│  │  └─List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Request
9.1.4.24 List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Request IE Semantics: List of applicable E-UTRA cells.
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.4.24 Data Traffic Resource Indication IE Semantics: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic. 9.2.126 Data Traffic Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.7.15 E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination 8.7.15.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an en-gNB over the X2 interface. The en-gNB shall calculate the full eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the eNB. An en-gNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an eNB. The eNB replies with the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The en-gNB shall calculate the full eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the eNB.

9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates "regular subframe". Value '1' indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node's subframe 0 in a receiving node's radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the eNB.
9.2.128 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.1.4.25 Spectrum Sharing Group ID IE Semantics: Indicates the E-UTRA cells involved in resource coordination with the NR cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.
│  │  └─List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Response
9.1.4.25 List of E-UTRA Cells in E-UTRA Coordination Response IE Semantics: List of applicable E-UTRA cells
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.1.4.25 Data Traffic Resource Indication IE Semantics: Indicates resource allocations for data traffic. 9.2.126 Data Traffic Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 8.7.15 E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination 8.7.15.2 Successful Operation An eNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an en-gNB over the X2 interface. The en-gNB extracts the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and it replies by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The en-gNB shall calculate the full eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the eNB. An en-gNB initiates the procedure by sending the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION REQUEST message to an eNB. The eNB replies with the E-UTRA - NR CELL RESOURCE COORDINATION RESPONSE message. The en-gNB shall calculate the full eNB resource allocation by combining the Data Traffic Resource Indication IE and the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE that were most recently received from the eNB.
9.2.126 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.126 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold. 9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern - Section Description: The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.
9.2.128 Subframe Type IE Semantics: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates "regular subframe". Value '1' indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node's subframe 0 in a receiving node's radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the eNB.
9.2.128 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.1.4.25 Spectrum Sharing Group ID IE Semantics: Indicates the NR cells involved in resource coordination with the E-UTRA cells affiliated with the same Spectrum Sharing Group ID.
│     └─List of NR Cells in NR Coordination Response
9.1.4.25 List of NR Cells in NR Coordination Response IE Semantics: List of applicable NR cells

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance.

section_list.name: SGNB ACTIVITY NOTIFICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to inform the MeNB that resources for E-RABs controlled by the en-gNB have not been used or are in use again.
Direction: en-gNB ? MeNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

9.1.4.26 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.26 SgNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the en-gNB. 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
├─UE Context level user plane activity report

9.2.130 User plane traffic activity report - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity. 9.2.130 User plane traffic activity report IE Semantics: "re-activated" shall be only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object 8.7.16 SgNB Activity Notification 8.7.16.2 Successful Operation The SGNB ACTIVITY NOTIFICATION message may contain notification for UE context level user plane activity in the UE Context level user plane activity report IE.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.2.130 User plane traffic activity report - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity. 9.2.130 User plane traffic activity report IE Semantics: "re-activated" shall be only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object
9.1.4.26 MeNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB.

section_list.name: GNB STATUS INDICATION
aoa:
This message is sent by the en-gNB to indicate to the eNB its status of overload.
Direction: en-gNB ? eNB.
9.2.13 Message Type - Section Description: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

8.7.17 gNB Status Indication 8.7.17.2 Successful Operation If the gNB Overload Information IE in the GNB STATUS INDICATION message is set to "overloaded", the eNB shall apply overload reduction actions until it receives a subsequent GNB STATUS INDICATION message with gNB Overload Information IE set to "not-overloaded".

9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication - Section Description: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance. 8.7.17 gNB Status Indication 8.7.17.2 Successful Operation If case of network sharing with multiple cell ID broadcast with shared X2-C signalling transport, as specified in TS 36.300 [15], the GNB STATUS INDICATION message shall contain the Interface Instance Indication IE to identify the corresponding interface instance.

section_list.name: TRACE START
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to initiate a trace session for a UE.
Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB

9.1.4.28 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.
9.2.2 Trace Activation - Section Description: Defines parameters related to trace activation.

9.2.2 E-UTRAN Trace ID IE Semantics: The E-UTRAN Trace ID IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information coded as in 9.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [6] (last 2 octets)

9.2.2 Interfaces To Trace IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a eNB interface: first bit =S1-MME, second bit =X2, third bit =Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1. Other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.
ENUMERATED ( minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, ...)
9.2.2 Trace Depth IE Semantics: Defined in TS 32.421 [7]
9.2.2 Trace Collection Entity IP Address IE Semantics: For details on the Transport Layer Address, see TS 36.424 [8], TS 36.414 [19]
9.2.56 MDT Configuration - Section Description: The IE defines the MDT configuration parameters.
ENUMERATED (Immediate MDT only, Immediate MDT and Trace, …)
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code. The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 Measurements to Activate IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap indicates a MDT measurement, as defined in TS 37.320 [25]. First Bit = M1, Second Bit = M2, Third Bit = M3, Fourth Bit = M4, Fifth Bit = M5, Sixth Bit = logging of M1 from event triggered measurement reports according to existing RRM configuration. Seventh Bit = M6, Eighth Bit = M7. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate".
9.2.56 M1 Reporting Trigger IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "0".

9.2.56 - M1 Threshold Event A2 IE - ifM1A2trigger: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "1" and the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "A2event-triggered" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Threshold Event A2 IE Semantics: Included in case of event-triggered or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
9.2.56 Threshold RSRP IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Threshold RSRQ IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

9.2.56 - M1 Periodic reporting IE - ifperiodicMDT: This IE shall be present if the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "periodic" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Periodic reporting IE Semantics: Included in case of periodic or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
ENUMERATED ( ms120, ms240, ms480, ms640, ms1024, ms2048, ms5120, ms10240, min1, min6, min12, min30, min60)
9.2.56 Report interval IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Report amount IE Semantics: Number of reports

9.2.56 - M3 Configuration IE - ifM3: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the third bit set to "1". 9.2.61 M3 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M4 Configuration IE - ifM4: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fourth bit set to "1". 9.2.62 M4 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M4 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M5 Configuration IE - ifM5: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fifth bit set to "1". 9.2.63 M5 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M5 measurement collection.

9.2.56 MDT Location Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents requested location information as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = GNSS Second Bit = E-CID information. Other bits are reserved for future use and are ignored if received. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate". The eNB shall ignore the first bit unless the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit or the sixth bit set to "1".
9.2.64 MDT PLMN List - Section Description: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 - M6 Configuration IE - ifM6: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the seventh bit set to "1". 9.2.87 M6 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)
9.2.87 - M6 Delay Threshold IE - ifUL: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

9.2.56 - M7 Configuration IE - ifM7: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the eighth bit set to "1". 9.2.88 M7 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
9.2.88 M7 Collection Period IE Semantics: Unit: minutes
9.2.134 Bluetooth Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for Bluetooth measurement collection.
9.2.134 BT RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection.
9.2.135 WLAN RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RTT IE Semantics: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.121 UE Application layer measurement configuration - Section Description: The IE defines configuration information for the QoE Measurement Collection (QMC) function.
9.2.121 Container for application layer measurement configuration IE Semantics: Indicates application layer measurement configuration, see Annex L in [36].
9.2.121 TAC IE Semantics: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
ENUMERATED (QMC for streaming service, QMC for MTSI service, ...)
9.2.121 Service Type IE Semantics: This IE indicates the service type of UE application layer measurements.

section_list.name: DEACTIVATE TRACE
aoa:
This message is sent by the MeNB to deactivate a trace session.
Direction: MeNB ? en-gNB

9.1.4.29 MeNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: Allocated at the MeNB. 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID - Section Description: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

9.1.4.29 E-UTRAN Trace ID IE Semantics: As per E-UTRAN Trace ID in Trace Activation IE 8.7.20 Deactivate Trace 8.7.20.2 Successful Operation The Deactivate Trace procedure is initiated by the MeNB by sending the DEACTIVATE TRACE to the en-gNB for that specific UE. Upon reception of the DEACTIVATE TRACE message, the en-gNB shall stop the trace session for the indicated trace reference in the E-UTRAN Trace ID IE.

section_list.name: GTP Tunnel Endpoint
aoa: The GTP Tunnel Endpoint IE identifies an X2 transport bearer or the S-GW endpoint of the S1 transport bearer associated to an E-RAB. It contains a Transport Layer Address and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier. The Transport Layer Address is an IP address to be used for the X2 user plane transport (see TS 36.424 [8]) or for the S1 user plane transport (see TS 36.414 [19]). The GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier is to be used for the user plane transport.

9.2.56 - M6 Configuration IE - ifM6: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the seventh bit set to "1". 9.2.87 M6 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)
9.2.87 - M6 Delay Threshold IE - ifUL: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

9.2.56 - M7 Configuration IE - ifM7: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the eighth bit set to "1". 9.2.88 M7 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
9.2.88 M7 Collection Period IE Semantics: Unit: minutes
9.2.134 Bluetooth Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for Bluetooth measurement collection.
9.2.134 BT RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection.
9.2.135 WLAN RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RTT IE Semantics: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.121 UE Application layer measurement configuration - Section Description: The IE defines configuration information for the QoE Measurement Collection (QMC) function.
9.2.121 Container for application layer measurement configuration IE Semantics: Indicates application layer measurement configuration, see Annex L in [36].
9.2.121 TAC IE Semantics: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
ENUMERATED (QMC for streaming service, QMC for MTSI service, ...)
9.2.121 Service Type IE Semantics: This IE indicates the service type of UE application layer measurements.

section_list.name: Handover Restriction List
aoa: This IE defines roaming or access restrictions for subsequent mobility action for which the eNB provides information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g., handover and CCO, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.3 Equivalent PLMNs IE Semantics: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of "equivalent PLMNs list" as defined in TS 24.301 [14]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Forbidden TAs IE Semantics: intra E-UTRAN roaming restrictions

9.2.3 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: The PLMN of forbidden TACs 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 TAC IE Semantics: The forbidden TAC
9.2.3 Forbidden LAs IE Semantics: inter-3GPP RAT roaming restrictions

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
ENUMERATED (ALL, GERAN, UTRAN, CDMA2000, …, GERAN and UTRAN, CDMA2000 and UTRAN)
9.2.3 Forbidden inter RATs IE Semantics: inter-3GPP and 3GPP2 RAT access restrictions. "ALL" means that all RATs mentioned in the enumeration of this IE are restricted.
├─NR restriction in EPS as secondary RAT
9.2.3 NR restriction in EPS as secondary RAT IE Semantics: Restriction to use NR when the NR is used as secondary RAT in EN-DC.

9.2.3 Core Network Type Restrictions IE Semantics: Includes any of the Serving PLMN or any PLMN of the Equivalent PLMNs listed in the Mobility Restriction List IE for which core network type restriction applies as specified in TS 23.501 [38].

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Core Network Type IE Semantics: The indication indicates whether the UE is restricted to connect to 5GC or to EPC for this PLMN.
9.2.3 NR Restriction in 5GS IE Semantics: Restriction to use NR when the NR connects to 5GS.

9.2.3 Last NG-RAN PLMN Identity IE Semantics: Indicates the NG-RAN PLMN from where the UE formerly handed over to EPS and which is preferred in case of subsequent mobility to 5GS. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.3 Unlicensed Spectrum Restriction IE Semantics: Restriction to use unlicensed spectrum in the form of LAA or LWA/LWIP or NR-U as described in TS 23.401 [11].

aoa: 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

aoa: 9.2.5 DL Forwarding IE Semantics: This element indicates that the E-RAB is proposed for forwarding of downlink packets.

section_list.name: Criticality Diagnostics
aoa: The Criticality Diagnostics IE is sent by the eNB/en-gNB when parts of a received message have not been comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or were missing.

9.2.7 Procedure Code IE Semantics: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.
ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
9.2.7 Triggering Message IE Semantics: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.
9.2.7 Procedure Criticality IE Semantics: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).
9.2.7 IE Criticality IE Semantics: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore'" shall not be used.
9.2.7 IE ID IE Semantics: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

section_list.name: Served Cell Information
aoa: This IE contains cell configuration information of a cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.8 PCI IE Semantics: Physical Cell ID
9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.8 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code
9.2.8 Broadcast PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.8 UL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NUL in TS 36.104 [16] for E-UTRA operating bands for which it is defined; ignored for E-UTRA operating bands for which NUL is not defined 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

9.2.8 DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.8 UL Transmission Bandwidth IE Semantics: Same as DL Transmission Bandwidth in this release; ignored in case UL EARFCN value is ignored 9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

9.2.8 UL EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: If this IE is present, the value signalled in the UL EARFCN IE is ignored. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

│  │     ├─Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to UL EARFCN

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to UL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MUL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).
9.2.8 NRS-NSSS-PowerOffset IE Semantics: NRS to NSSS power ratio, as defined in TS6.213 [11].
9.2.8 NSSS-NumOccasionDifferentPrecoder IE Semantics: The number of consecutive NSSS occasions that use different precoders for NSSS transmission, as defined in TS6.213 [11].

9.2.8 EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to NDL/NUL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.26 EARFCN - Section Description: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].
ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.
ENUMERATED (sa0, sa1, sa2, sa3, sa4, sa5, sa6, …)
9.2.8 Subframe Assignment IE Semantics: Uplink-downlink subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]. In NB-IOT, sa0 and sa6 are not applicable.
9.2.8 Special Subframe Info IE Semantics: Special subframe configuration information defined in TS 36.211 [10]

9.2.8 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to DL EARFCN IE Semantics: Corresponds to MDL in TS 36.104 [16] 9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).

9.2.8 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Corresponds to the TDD-UL-DL-AlignmentOffset-NB in TS 36.331 [9]. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset - Section Description: This IE is used to indicate the offset between the UL carrier frequency center with respect to DL carrier frequency center. 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: Unit: kHz

9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports - Section Description: The Number of Antenna Ports IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports. 9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports IE Semantics: an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports
9.2.50 PRACH Configuration - Section Description: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.
9.2.50 RootSequenceIndex IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 HighSpeedFlag IE Semantics: TRUE corresponds to Restricted set and FALSE to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-FrequencyOffset IE Semantics: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-ConfigurationIndex IE Semantics: Mandatory for TDD, shall not be present for FDD. See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.8 MBSFN Subframe Info IE Semantics: MBSFN subframe defined in TS 36.331 [9]
ENUMERATED (n1, n2, n4, n8, n16, n32, …)

9.2.51 Subframe Allocation - Section Description: The Subframe Allocation IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.53 CSG ID - Section Description: This element indicates the identifier of the Closed Subscriber Group.
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity List IE Semantics: Supported MBMS Service Area Identities in the cell
9.2.8 MBMS Service Area Identity IE Semantics: MBMS Service Area Identities as defined in TS 23.003 [29]

9.2.60 MultibandInfoList - Section Description: The MultibandInfoList IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.60 FrequencyBandIndicator IE Semantics: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [42, table 5.5-1]
9.2.8 FreqBandIndicatorPriority IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the eNodeB supports FreqBandIndicationPriority, and whether FreqBandIndicatorPriority is broadcasted in SIB 1 (see TS 36.331 [9])
9.2.8 BandwidthReducedSI IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the SystemInformationBlockType1-BR is scheduled in the cell (see TS 36.331 [9])

9.2.8 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates which E-UTRA control/reference signal resources are protected and are not subject to E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.125 Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication - Section Description: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.125 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.125 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.125 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.125 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.125 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.125 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.125 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

9.2.8 Broadcast PLMN Identity Info List E-UTRA IE Semantics: This IE corresponds to the cellAccessRelatedInfo IE in SIB1 as specified in TS 36.331 [9]. The PLMN Identities and associated information contained in this IE shall be provided in the same order as broadcast in SIB1.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: E-RAB Level QoS Parameters
aoa: This IE defines the QoS to be applied to an E-RAB.
9.2.9 QCI IE Semantics: QoS Class Identifier defined in TS 23.401 [12]. Logical range and coding specified in TS 23.203 [13].
9.2.31 Allocation and Retention Priority - Section Description: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.9 GBR QoS Information IE Semantics: This IE applies to GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise. 9.2.10 GBR QoS Information - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink. NOTE: For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. If the Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

If the Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Maximum Bit Rate in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. 9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL (i.e. from EPC to E-UTRAN) for the bearer. 9.2.10 Extended E-RAB Guaranteed Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in UL (i.e. from E-UTRAN to EPC) for the bearer. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.9 Downlink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for downlink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

9.2.9 Uplink Maximum Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE applies only to bearers with specific QCI (see TS 23.401 [12]) and indicates the maximum allowed packet loss rate for uplink as specified in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

section_list.name: GBR QoS Information
aoa:
This IE indicates the maximum and guaranteed bit rates of a GBR E-RAB for downlink and uplink.
NOTE:	For LTE DC, the SeNB regards the GBR QoS Information IE as an E-RAB level parameter also for E-RABs configured with the split bearer option, although for the split bearer option the bitrates signalled by the MeNB are typically not equal to the bitrates signalled by the MME for that E-RAB (see TS 36.300 [15]).

section_list.name: Bit Rate
aoa: 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. The unit is: bit/s

section_list.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
aoa: On Handover Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is transferred to the target eNB. In Dual Connectivity, UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into MeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and SeNB UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by MeNB and SeNB respectively as specified in TS 36.300 [15]. The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is applicable for all Non-GBR bearers per UE which is defined for the Downlink and the Uplink direction and provided by the MME to the eNB.

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

9.2.12 UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: If the Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE is included, the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE shall be ignored. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
├─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s
└─Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink

9.2.12 Extended UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink IE Semantics: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Details in TS 23.401 [12]. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

section_list.name: Message Type
aoa: The Message Type IE uniquely identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.
CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

section_list.name: ECGI
aoa: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

section_list.name: COUNT Value
aoa: This information element indicates the 12 bit PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bit Hyper frame number.

section_list.name: GUMMEI
aoa: This information element indicates the globally unique MME identity.
9.2.20 GU Group Id - Section Description: The GU Group Id IE is the globally unique group id corresponding to a pool area.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: UL Interference Overload Indication
aoa: 9.2.17 UL Interference Overload Indication List IE Semantics: This IE provides, per PRB, a report on interference overload. The interaction between the indication of UL Interference Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.
ENUMERATED (high interference, medium interference, low interference, …)
9.2.17 UL Interference Overload Indication IE Semantics: Each PRB is identified by its position in the list: the first element in the list corresponds to PRB 0, the second to PRB 1, etc.

section_list.name: UL High Interference Indication
aoa: 9.2.18 HII IE Semantics: This IE provides, per PRB, a 2 level report on interference sensitivity. The interaction between the indication of UL Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific. Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB (first bit=PRB 0 and so on), for which value ‘"1" indicates ‘high interference sensitivity’ and value "0" indicates ’low interference sensitivity’. The maximum number of Physical Resource Blocks is 110.

section_list.name: Relative Narrowband Tx Power (RNTP)
aoa: This IE provides an indication on DL power restriction per PRB or per subframe per PRB (Enhanced RNTP) in a cell and other information needed by a neighbour eNB for interference aware scheduling.

9.2.19 RNTP Per PRB IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a nPRB value (i.e. first bit=PRB 0 and so on), for which the bit value represents RNTP (nPRB), defined in TS 36.213 [11]. Value 0 indicates "Tx not exceeding RNTP threshold". Value 1 indicates "no promise on the Tx power is given". The IE is ignored if the Enhanced RNTP IE is included.
9.2.19 RNTP Threshold IE Semantics: RNTPthreshold is defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.19 Number Of Cell-specific Antenna Ports IE Semantics: P (number of antenna ports for cell-specific reference signals) defined in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.19 P_B IE Semantics: PB is defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.19 PDCCH Interference Impact IE Semantics: Measured by Predicted Number Of Occupied PDCCH OFDM Symbols (see TS 36.211 [10]). Value 0 means "no prediction is available".

9.2.19 Enhanced RNTP Bitmap IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB in a subframe; value "00" indicates "Tx not exceeding RNTP Threshold", value "01" indicates "Tx not exceeding RNTP High Power Threshold", value "11" indicates that "no promise on the Tx power is given". Value "10" is ignored by the receiver". Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The first 2 bits correspond to PRB 0 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, the following 2 bits correspond to PRB 1 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, and so on. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The Enhanced RNTP pattern is continuously repeated.
9.2.19 RNTP High Power Threshold IE Semantics: Defined as the RNTPthreshold in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.19 Start SFN IE Semantics: SFN of the radio frame containing the first subframe when the Enhanced RNTP IE is valid.
9.2.19 Start Subframe Number IE Semantics: Subframe number, within the radio frame indicated by the Start SFN IE, of the first subframe when the Enhanced RNTP IE is valid.

section_list.name: GU Group Id
aoa: The GU Group Id IE is the globally unique group id corresponding to a pool area.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: Location Reporting Information
aoa: This information element indicates how the location information should be reported.

section_list.name: Global eNB ID
aoa: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.22 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB
9.2.22 Home eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying the cell controlled by the eNB

9.2.22 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

9.2.22 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

section_list.name: E-RAB ID
aoa: 9.2.23 E-RAB ID IE Semantics: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

section_list.name: eNB UE X2AP ID
aoa: 9.2.24 eNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: This information element, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension when present regardless its value, uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, if applicable, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

section_list.name: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority
aoa: Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency Priority

9.2.25 Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency Priority IE Semantics: The Subscriber Profile ID IE for RAT/Frequency Selection Priority is used to define camp priorities in Idle mode and to control inter-RAT/inter-frequency handover in Active mode (TS 36.300 [15]).

section_list.name: Additional RRM Policy Index
aoa: 9.2.25a Additional RRM Policy Index IE Semantics: The Additional RRM Policy Index IE is used to provide additional information independent from the Subscriber Profile ID for RAT/Frequency priority as specified in TS 36.300 [15].

section_list.name: EARFCN
aoa: 9.2.26 EARFCN IE Semantics: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

section_list.name: Transmission Bandwidth
aoa: ENUMERATED (bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100, ... , bw1)

9.2.27 Transmission Bandwidth IE Semantics: The Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks " NRB " (TS 36.104 [16]). The values bw1, bw6, bw15, bw25, bw50, bw75, bw100 correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 6, 15, 25, 50, 75, 100.

section_list.name: E-RAB List
aoa: 9.2.28 E-RAB List Item IE Semantics: The IE contains a list of E-RAB identities with a cause value. It is used for example to indicate not admitted bearers.
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.
9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.

ENUMERATED (Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Time Critical Handover, Resource Optimisation Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Partial Handover, Unknown New eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Old eNB UE X2AP ID, Unknown Pair of UE X2AP ID, HO Target not Allowed, TX2RELOCoverall Expiry, TRELOCprep Expiry, Cell not Available, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Invalid MME Group ID, Unknown MME Code, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, ReportCharacteristicsEmpty, NoReportPeriodicity, ExistingMeasurementID, Unknown eNB Measurement ID, Measurement Temporarily not Available, Unspecified, ..., Load Balancing, Handover Optimisation, Value out of allowed range, Multiple E-RAB ID instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported QCI value, Measurement not supported for the object, TDCoverall Expiry, TDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve user bit rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, MCG Mobility, SCG Mobility, Count reaches max value, Unknown Old en-gNB UE X2AP ID, PDCP Overload)

ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Unspecified, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), ...)
ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, ...)

section_list.name: UE Security Capabilities
aoa: The UE Security Capabilities IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the UE.

9.2.29 Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0 "first bit" - 128-EEA1, "second bit" - 128-EEA2, "third bit" - 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.29 Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: all bits equal to 0" - UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0 (TS 33.401 [18]) "first bit" - 128-EIA1, "second bit" - 128-EIA2, "third bit" - 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value "0" indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

section_list.name: AS Security Information
aoa: The AS Security Information IE is used to generate the key material to be used for AS security with the UE.

9.2.30 Key eNodeB Star IE Semantics: KeNB* defined in TS 33.401 [18]. If the target cell belongs to multiple frequency bands, the source eNB selects the DL-EARFCN for KeNB* calculation as specified in section 10.3 of TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.30 Next Hop Chaining Count IE Semantics: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.401 [18]

section_list.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
aoa: This IE specifies the relative importance compared to other E-RABs for allocation and retention of the E-UTRAN Radio Access Bearer.

9.2.31 Priority Level IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE should be understood as "priority of allocation and retention" (see TS 23.401 [12]). Usage: Value 15 means "no priority". Values between 1 and 14 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. 1 is the highest and 14 the lowest. Value 0 shall be treated as a logical error if received.
ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption)

9.2.31 Pre-emption Capability IE Semantics: Descr.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other E-RABs Usage: The E-RAB shall not pre-empt other E-RABs or, the E-RAB may pre-empt other E-RABs The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for an E-RAB and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

9.2.31 Pre-emption Vulnerability IE Semantics: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the E-RAB to pre-emption of other E-RABs. Usage: The E-RAB shall not be pre-empted by other E-RABs or the E-RAB may be pre-empted by other RABs. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the E-RAB, unless modified, and as such indicates whether the E-RAB is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the eNB.

section_list.name: Time To Wait

aoa: The Radio Resource Status IE indicates the usage of the PRBs for all traffic in Downlink and Uplink (TS 36.314 [22], TS 23.203 [13]) and the usage of PDCCH CCEs for Downlink and Uplink scheduling.

section_list.name: UE History Information
aoa: 9.2.38 Last Visited Cell List IE Semantics: The UE History Information IE contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 36.300 [15]. NOTE: The definition of this IE is aligned with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 36.413 [4]. Most recent information is added to the top of this list

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.42 Cell Type - Section Description: The cell type provides the cell coverage area.
9.2.40 Time UE stayed in Cell IE Semantics: The duration of the time the UE stayed in the cell in seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095s, this IE is set to 4095.
│     ├─Time UE stayed in Cell Enhanced Granularity

9.2.40 Time UE stayed in Cell Enhanced Granularity IE Semantics: The duration of the time the UE stayed in the cell in 1/10 seconds. If the UE stays in a cell more than 4095s, this IE is set to 40950.

9.2.40 HO Cause Value IE Semantics: The cause for the handover from the E-UTRAN cell. 9.2.6 Cause - Section Description: The purpose of the cause information element is to indicate the reason for a particular event for the whole protocol.
