aoa: 9.2.42 Cell Size IE Semantics: The cell type provides the cell coverage area.

section_list.name: Number of Antenna Ports
aoa: 9.2.43 Number of Antenna Ports IE Semantics: The Number of Antenna Ports IE is used to indicate the number of cell specific antenna ports. an1 = One antenna port an2 = Two antenna ports an4 = Four antenna ports

section_list.name: Composite Available Capacity Group
aoa: The Composite Available Capacity Group IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in Downlink and Uplink.

9.2.44 Composite Available Capacity Downlink IE Semantics: For the Downlink 9.2.45 Composite Available Capacity - Section Description: The Composite Available Capacity IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink or Uplink.

9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value - Section Description: The Cell Capacity Class Value IE indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources that are configured for traffic purposes. 9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value IE Semantics: Value 1 shall indicate the minimum cell capacity, and 100 shall indicate the maximum cell capacity. There should be a linear relation between cell capacity and Cell Capacity Class Value.

9.2.45 Capacity Value IE Semantics: ‘0’ indicates no resource is available, Measured on a linear scale. 9.2.47 Capacity Value - Section Description: The Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources that are available relative to the total E-UTRAN resources. The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum E-UTRAN resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available. 9.2.47 Capacity Value IE Semantics: Value 0 shall indicate no available capacity, and 100 shall indicate maximum available capacity . Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale.

9.2.44 Composite Available Capacity Uplink IE Semantics: For the Uplink 9.2.45 Composite Available Capacity - Section Description: The Composite Available Capacity IE indicates the overall available resource level in the cell in either Downlink or Uplink.

9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value - Section Description: The Cell Capacity Class Value IE indicates the value that classifies the cell capacity with regards to the other cells. The Cell Capacity Class Value IE only indicates resources that are configured for traffic purposes. 9.2.46 Cell Capacity Class Value IE Semantics: Value 1 shall indicate the minimum cell capacity, and 100 shall indicate the maximum cell capacity. There should be a linear relation between cell capacity and Cell Capacity Class Value.

The capacity value should be measured and reported so that the minimum E-UTRAN resource usage of existing services is reserved according to implementation. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available. 9.2.47 Capacity Value IE Semantics: Value 0 shall indicate no available capacity, and 100 shall indicate maximum available capacity . Capacity Value should be measured on a linear scale.

There should be a linear relation between cell capacity and Cell Capacity Class Value.

aoa: 9.2.47 Capacity Value IE Semantics: The Capacity Value IE indicates the amount of resources that are available relative to the total E-UTRAN resources. The Capacity Value IE can be weighted according to the ratio of cell capacity class values, if available. section_list.name: Mobility Parameters Information
aoa: 9.2.48 Handover Trigger Change IE Semantics: The Mobility Parameters Information IE contains the change of the Handover Trigger as compared to its current value. The Handover Trigger corresponds to the threshold at which a cell initialises the handover preparation procedure towards a specific neighbour cell. Positive value of the change means the handover is proposed to take place later. The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

section_list.name: Mobility Parameters Modification Range
aoa: The Mobility Parameters Modification Range IE contains the range of Handover Trigger Change values permitted by the eNB2 at the moment the MOBILITY CHANGE FAILURE message is sent.
9.2.49 Handover Trigger Change Lower Limit IE Semantics: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.
9.2.49 Handover Trigger Change Upper Limit IE Semantics: The actual value is IE value * 0.5 dB.

section_list.name: PRACH Configuration
aoa: This IE indicates the PRACH resources used in neighbor cell.
9.2.50 RootSequenceIndex IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 ZeroCorrelationZoneConfiguration IE Semantics: See section 5.7.2. in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 HighSpeedFlag IE Semantics: TRUE corresponds to Restricted set and FALSE to Unrestricted set. See section 5.7.2 in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-FrequencyOffset IE Semantics: See section 5.7.1 of TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.50 PRACH-ConfigurationIndex IE Semantics: Mandatory for TDD, shall not be present for FDD. See section 5.7.1. in TS 36.211 [10]

section_list.name: Subframe Allocation
aoa: 9.2.51 CHOICE Subframe Allocation IE Semantics: The Subframe Allocation IE is used to indicate the subframes that are allocated for MBSFN within the radio frame allocation period as defined in TS 36.331 [9].

section_list.name: CSG Membership Status
aoa: 9.2.52 CSG Membership Status IE Semantics: This element indicates the membership status of the UE to a particular CSG.

section_list.name: CSG ID
aoa: 9.2.53 CSG ID IE Semantics: This element indicates the identifier of the Closed Subscriber Group.

section_list.name: ABS Information
aoa: 9.2.54 CHOICE ABS Information IE Semantics: This IE provides information about which sub frames the sending eNB is configuring as almost blank subframes and which subset of almost blank subframes are recommended for configuring measurements towards the UE. Almost blank subframes are subframes with reduced power on some physical channels and/or reduced activity.

9.2.54 ABS Pattern Info IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a DL subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS’ and value "0" indicates ’non ABS’. The first position of the ABS pattern corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The ABS pattern is continuously repeated in all radio frames. The maximum number of subframes is 40.
9.2.54 Number Of Cell-specific Antenna Ports IE Semantics: P (number of antenna ports for cell-specific reference signals) defined in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.54 Measurement Subset IE Semantics: Indicates a subset of the ABS Pattern Info above, and is used to configure specific measurements towards the UE.

9.2.54 ABS Pattern Info IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value "1" indicates ‘ABS’ and value "0" indicates ’non ABS’ which is applicable only in positions corresponding to the DL direction. The maximum number of subframes depends on UL/DL subframe configuration. The maximum number of subframes is 20 for UL/DL subframe configuration 1~5; 60 for UL/DL subframe configuration 6; 70 for UL/DL subframe configuration 0. UL/DL subframe configuration defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The first position of the ABS pattern corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The ABS pattern is continuously repeated in all radio frames, and restarted each time SFN = 0.
9.2.54 Number Of Cell-specific Antenna Ports IE Semantics: P (number of antenna ports for cell-specific reference signals) defined in TS 36.211 [10]
9.2.54 Measurement Subset IE Semantics: Indicates a subset of the ABS Pattern Info above, and is used to configure specific measurements towards the UE
9.2.54 ABS Inactive IE Semantics: Indicates that interference coordination by means of almost blank sub frames is not active

aoa: ENUMERATED (ABS Information, …, Start NAICS Information, Stop NAICS Information)

9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code. The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
9.2.56 TAC IE Semantics: Tracking Area Code

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.56 Measurements to Activate IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap indicates a MDT measurement, as defined in TS 37.320 [25]. First Bit = M1, Second Bit = M2, Third Bit = M3, Fourth Bit = M4, Fifth Bit = M5, Sixth Bit = logging of M1 from event triggered measurement reports according to existing RRM configuration. Seventh Bit = M6, Eighth Bit = M7. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate".
9.2.56 M1 Reporting Trigger IE Semantics: This IE shall be ignored if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "0".

9.2.56 - M1 Threshold Event A2 IE - ifM1A2trigger: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit set to "1" and the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "A2event-triggered" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Threshold Event A2 IE Semantics: Included in case of event-triggered or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
9.2.56 Threshold RSRP IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Threshold RSRQ IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

9.2.56 - M1 Periodic reporting IE - ifperiodicMDT: This IE shall be present if the M1 Reporting Trigger IE is set to "periodic" or to "A2event-triggered periodic". 9.2.56 M1 Periodic reporting IE Semantics: Included in case of periodic or event-triggered periodic reporting for measurement M1
ENUMERATED ( ms120, ms240, ms480, ms640, ms1024, ms2048, ms5120, ms10240, min1, min6, min12, min30, min60)
9.2.56 Report interval IE Semantics: This IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.56 Report amount IE Semantics: Number of reports

9.2.56 - M3 Configuration IE - ifM3: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the third bit set to "1". 9.2.61 M3 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M4 Configuration IE - ifM4: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fourth bit set to "1". 9.2.62 M4 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M4 measurement collection.

9.2.56 - M5 Configuration IE - ifM5: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the fifth bit set to "1". 9.2.63 M5 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M5 measurement collection.

9.2.56 MDT Location Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents requested location information as defined in TS 37.320 [31]. First Bit = GNSS Second Bit = E-CID information. Other bits are reserved for future use and are ignored if received. Value "1" indicates "activate" and value "0" indicates "do not activate". The eNB shall ignore the first bit unless the Measurements to Activate IE has the first bit or the sixth bit set to "1".
9.2.64 MDT PLMN List - Section Description: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

9.2.56 - M6 Configuration IE - ifM6: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the seventh bit set to "1". 9.2.87 M6 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)
9.2.87 - M6 Delay Threshold IE - ifUL: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

9.2.56 - M7 Configuration IE - ifM7: This IE shall be present if the Measurements to Activate IE has the eighth bit set to "1". 9.2.88 M7 Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
9.2.88 M7 Collection Period IE Semantics: Unit: minutes
9.2.134 Bluetooth Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for Bluetooth measurement collection.
9.2.134 BT RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN Measurement Configuration - Section Description: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection.
9.2.135 WLAN RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RTT IE Semantics: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].

section_list.name: ABS Status
aoa: The ABS Status IE is used to aid the eNB designating ABS to evaluate the need for modification of the ABS pattern.

9.2.58 DL ABS status IE Semantics: Percentage of used ABS resources. The numerator of the percentage calculation consists of resource blocks within the ABS indicated in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE allocated by the eNB2 for DL traffic needing protection by ABS from inter-cell interference for DL scheduling, or allocated by the eNB2 for other reasons (e.g. some control channels). The denominator of the percentage calculation is the total quantity of resource blocks within the ABS indicated in the Usable ABS Pattern Info IE.
9.2.58 CHOICE Usable ABS Information IE Semantics: –

9.2.58 Usable ABS Pattern Info IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS that has been designated as protected from inter-cell interference by the eNB1, and available to serve this purpose for DL scheduling in the eNB2’ and value "0" is used for all other subframes. The pattern represented by the bitmap is a subset of, or the same as, the corresponding ABS Pattern Info IE conveyed in the LOAD INFORMATION message from the eNB1.

9.2.58 Usable ABS Pattern Info IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘ABS that has been designated as protected from inter-cell interference by the eNB1, and available to serve this purpose for DL scheduling in the eNB2’ and value "0" is used for all other subframes. The pattern represented by the bitmap is a subset of, or the same as, the corresponding ABS Pattern Info IE conveyed in the LOAD INFORMATION message from the eNB1.

section_list.name: Management Based MDT Allowed
aoa: 9.2.59 Management Based MDT Allowed IE Semantics: This information element is used by the eNB to allow selection of the UE for management based MDT as described in TS 32.422 [6].

section_list.name: MultibandInfoList
aoa: 9.2.60 BandInfo IE Semantics: The MultibandInfoList IE contains the additional frequency band indicators that a cell belongs to listed in decreasing order of preference, see TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.60 FrequencyBandIndicator IE Semantics: E-UTRA operating band as defined in TS 36.101 [42, table 5.5-1]

section_list.name: M3 Configuration
aoa: 9.2.61 M3 Collection Period IE Semantics: This IE defines the parameters for M3 measurement collection.

section_list.name: M4 Configuration
aoa: This IE defines the parameters for M4 measurement collection.

section_list.name: M5 Configuration
aoa: This IE defines the parameters for M5 measurement collection.

section_list.name: MDT PLMN List
aoa: 9.2.64 MDT PLMN List IE Semantics: The purpose of the MDT PLMN List IE is to provide the list of PLMNs allowed for MDT.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: EARFCN Extension
aoa: 9.2.65 EARFCN Extension IE Semantics: The E-UTRA Absolute Radio Frequency Channel Number Extension defines the carrier frequency used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD. The relation between EARFCN and carrier frequency (in MHz) are defined in TS 36.104 [16].

section_list.name: COUNT Value Extended
aoa: This information element indicates the 15 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 17 bit long Hyper Frame Number.

section_list.name: Extended UL Interference Overload Info
aoa: This IE provides report on interference overload for the set of subframes that are subject to UL-DL subframe reconfiguration. This IE applies to TDD only.

9.2.67 Associated Subframes IE Semantics: The set of subframe(s) to which the Extended UL interference overload indication is applicable. The bitmap from the least significant bit position to the most significant bit position represents subframes #{3, 4, 7, 8, 9} in a radio frame. Value "1" in a bit position indicates that the Extended UL interference overload indication is applicable to the corresponding subframe; and value "0" indicates otherwise.

9.2.17 UL Interference Overload Indication - Section Description: This IE provides, per PRB, a report on interference overload. The interaction between the indication of UL Interference Overload and UL High Interference is implementation specific.
ENUMERATED (high interference, medium interference, low interference, …)
9.2.17 UL Interference Overload Indication IE Semantics: Each PRB is identified by its position in the list: the first element in the list corresponds to PRB 0, the second to PRB 1, etc.

section_list.name: RNL Header
aoa: The RNL Header IE indicates the target eNB ID and source eNB ID.
9.2.22 Global eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.22 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB
9.2.22 Home eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying the cell controlled by the eNB

9.2.22 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

9.2.22 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.
9.2.22 Global eNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an eNB (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.22 Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB
9.2.22 Home eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying the cell controlled by the eNB

9.2.22 Short Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

9.2.22 Long Macro eNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the value of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE contained in the ECGI IE (see section 9.2.14) identifying each cell controlled by the eNB.

section_list.name: Masked IMEISV
aoa: 9.2.69 Masked IMEISV IE Semantics: This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment. Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [29] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1.

section_list.name: Expected UE Behaviour
aoa: This IE defines the behaviour of a UE with predictable activity and/or mobility behaviour, to assist the eNB/en-gNB in determining the optimum RRC connection time.
9.2.71 Expected UE Activity Behaviour - Section Description: Indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.401 [12].
9.2.71 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.71 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.71 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.
ENUMERATED (sec15, sec30, sec60, sec90, sec120, sec180, long-time, …)

9.2.70 Expected HO Interval IE Semantics: Indicates the expected time interval between inter-eNB handovers. If "long-time" is included, the interval between inter-eNB handovers is expected to be longer than 180 seconds.

section_list.name: Expected UE Activity Behaviour
aoa: Indicates information about the expected "UE activity behaviour" as defined in TS 23.401 [12].
9.2.71 Expected Activity Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected activity time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected activity time in [seconds].
9.2.71 Expected Idle Period IE Semantics: If this IE is set to "181" the expected idle time is longer than 180 seconds. The remaining values indicate the expected idle time in [seconds].

9.2.71 Source of UE Activity Behaviour Information IE Semantics: If "subscription information" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from subscription information. If "statistics" is indicated, the information contained in the Expected Activity Period IE and the Expected Idle Period IE, if present, is derived from statistical information.

section_list.name: SeNB Security Key
aoa: 9.2.72 SeNB Security Key IE Semantics: The SeNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the SeNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18]. The S-KeNB which is provided by the MeNB, see TS 33.401 [18].

section_list.name: SCG Change Indication
aoa: 9.2.73 SCG Change Indication IE Semantics: The SCG Change Indication IE is either used to request the SeNB to prepare the SCG Change in the SeNB or to request the MeNB to initiate the SCG Change towards the UE (see TS 36.300 [15]).

section_list.name: CoMP Information
aoa: This IE provides the list of CoMP hypothesis sets, where each CoMP hypothesis set is the collection of CoMP hypothesis(es) of one or multiple cells and each CoMP hypothesis set is associated with a benefit metric.
9.2.75 CoMP Hypothesis Set - Section Description: This IE provides a set of CoMP hypotheses. A CoMP hypothesis is hypothetical PRB-specific resource allocation information for a cell.

9.2.75 Cell ID IE Semantics: ID of the cell for which the CoMP Hypothesis IE is applied. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.75 CoMP Hypothesis IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB in a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘interference protected resource’ and value "0" indicates ‘resource with no utilization constraints,’ which is applicable only in positions corresponding to the DL direction. The first bit corresponds to PRB 0 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, the second bit corresponds to PRB 1 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, and so on. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The length of the bit string is an integer (maximum 40) multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The CoMP hypothesis pattern is continuously repeated.

9.2.74 Benefit Metric IE Semantics: Value -100 indicates the maximum cost, and 100 indicates the maximum benefit. Value -101 indicates unknown benefit. Values from -100 to 100 should be calculated on a linear scale.
9.2.74 Start SFN IE Semantics: SFN of the radio frame containing the first subframe when the CoMP Information IE is valid.
9.2.74 Start Subframe Number IE Semantics: Subframe number, within the radio frame indicated by the Start SFN IE, of the first subframe when the CoMP Information IE is valid.

section_list.name: CoMP Hypothesis Set
aoa: 9.2.75 CoMP Hypothesis Set Item IE Semantics: This IE provides a set of CoMP hypotheses. A CoMP hypothesis is hypothetical PRB-specific resource allocation information for a cell.

9.2.75 Cell ID IE Semantics: ID of the cell for which the CoMP Hypothesis IE is applied. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.75 CoMP Hypothesis IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB in a subframe, for which value "1" indicates ‘interference protected resource’ and value "0" indicates ‘resource with no utilization constraints,’ which is applicable only in positions corresponding to the DL direction. The first bit corresponds to PRB 0 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, the second bit corresponds to PRB 1 of the first subframe for which the IE is valid, and so on. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The length of the bit string is an integer (maximum 40) multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The CoMP hypothesis pattern is continuously repeated.

section_list.name: RSRP Measurement Report List
aoa: 9.2.76 RSRP Measurement Report Item IE Semantics: This IE provides RSRP measurement reports of UEs served by the sending eNB.

9.2.76 RSRP Cell ID IE Semantics: ID of the cell on which the RSRP is measured. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.
9.2.76 RSRP Measured IE Semantics: Measured RSRP. Defined in TS 36.331 [9].
9.2.76 UE ID IE Semantics: ID assigned by eNB2 for the UE.

section_list.name: Dynamic DL transmission information
aoa: 9.2.77 CHOICE NAICS Information IE Semantics: This IE contains assistance information for DL interference mitigation.

9.2.77 Transmission Modes IE Semantics: The set bits indicate some or all transmission modes: 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 9, 10, as defined in TS 36.213 [23, 7.1]. The first/ leftmost bit is for transmission mode 1, the second bit is for transmission mode 2, and so on.
9.2.77 P_B IE Semantics: See TS 36.213 [23, Table 5.2-1]
ENUMERATED (dB-6, dB-4dot77, dB-3, dB-1dot77, dB0, dB1, dB2, dB3, ...)
9.2.77 P_A IE Semantics: See PA TS 36.213 [23, 5.2]. Value dB-6 corresponds to -6 dB, dB-4dot77 corresponds to -4.77 dB etc.

section_list.name: ProSe Authorized
aoa: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE for ProSe service(s).
9.2.78 ProSe Direct Discovery IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Discovery
9.2.78 ProSe Direct Communication IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized for ProSe Direct Communication
9.2.78 ProSe UE-to-Network Relaying IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized to act as ProSe UE-to-Network Relay

section_list.name: CSI Report
aoa: 9.2.79 CSI Report per Cell IE Semantics: This IE provides CSI reports of UEs served by the cell for which the information is provided.
9.2.79 UE ID IE Semantics: ID assigned by eNB2 for the UE.
9.2.79 CSI Process Configuration Index IE Semantics: Indicates one of the possible CSI Process configurations in the serving cell.
9.2.79 RI IE Semantics: The RI corresponding to the CQI being reported for this CSI process item. Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 Wideband CQI - Section Description: This IE indicates the Wideband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 Wideband CQI Codeword 0 IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 3-bit spatial differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.79 Subband Size IE Semantics: Corresponds to a value of subband size k defined in TS 36.213 [11] for the system bandwidth.
9.2.81 Subband CQI - Section Description: This IE indicates the Subband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit Subband differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 3-bit spatial differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit Subband differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

section_list.name: Wideband CQI
aoa: This IE indicates the Wideband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 Wideband CQI Codeword 0 IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.80 3-bit spatial differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

section_list.name: Subband CQI
aoa: This IE indicates the Subband CQI as defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit Subband differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 4-bit CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 3-bit spatial differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit Subband differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].
9.2.81 2-bit differential CQI IE Semantics: Value defined in TS 36.213 [11].

section_list.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
aoa: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
This information element indicates the 18 bit long PDCP SN and the corresponding 14 bit long Hyper Frame Number.

section_list.name: LHN ID
aoa: 9.2.83 Local Home Network ID IE Semantics: The LHN ID IE is used to indicate the LHN ID of the eNB, as defined in TS 23.003 [21]. Identifies the Local Home Network.

section_list.name: Correlation ID
aoa: 9.2.84 Correlation ID IE Semantics: This information element is the GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier or GRE key to be used for the user plane transport between eNB and the L-GW described in TS 23.401 [12].

section_list.name: UE Context Kept Indicator
aoa: 9.2.85 UE Context Kept Indicator IE Semantics: This IE indicates that the UE Context at the SeNB is kept in case of inter-MeNB handover without SeNB/SgNB Change procedure, as specified in TS 36.300 [15] or TS37.340 [32].

section_list.name: eNB UE X2AP ID Extension
aoa: 9.2.86 eNB UE X2AP ID Extension IE Semantics: This information element combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an eNB. If the setup of an UE associcated signalling connection was initiated including the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension shall be used by both peers for the life-time of the respective UE-associated signalling connection. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the eNB UE X2AP ID, combined with the eNB UE X2AP ID Extension, is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

section_list.name: M6 Configuration
aoa: This IE defines the parameters for M6 measurement collection.
ENUMERATED (ms30, ms40, ms50, ms60, ms70, ms80, ms90, ms100, ms150, ms300, ms500, ms750, …)
9.2.87 - M6 Delay Threshold IE - ifUL: This IE shall be present if the M6 Links to log IE is set to "uplink" or to "both-uplink-and-downlink".

section_list.name: M7 Configuration
aoa: This IE defines the parameters for M7 measurement collection.
9.2.88 M7 Collection Period IE Semantics: Unit: minutes

section_list.name: Tunnel Information
aoa: The Tunnel Information IE indicates the transport layer address and UDP port number.
9.2.89 Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: eNB’s Transport Layer Address.
9.2.89 UDP Port Numbers IE Semantics: UDP Port Numbers if NAT/NAPT is deployed in the BBF access network.

section_list.name: X2 Benefit Value
aoa: 9.2.90 X2 Benefit Value IE Semantics: The X2 Benefit Value IE indicates the quantified benefit of the signalling connection. Value 1 indicates low benefit, and 8 indicates high benefit.

section_list.name: Resume ID
aoa: 9.2.91 CHOICE Resume ID IE Semantics: The Resume ID IE is used to address a suspended UE Context within an eNB.

9.2.91 Resume ID not truncated IE Semantics: 40 bit Resume Resume Identity contained in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message (TS 36.331 [9]). The 20 most significant bits refer to the eNB ID of the eNB that allocated the Resume ID, the 20 least significant bits identify the UE Context stored at the eNB that allocated the Resume ID.

9.2.91 Resume ID truncated IE Semantics: 24 bit Resume Identity contained in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message (TS 36.331 [9]). The 12 most significant bits refer to the 12 least significant bits of the eNB ID of the eNB that allocated the Resume ID. The 12 least significant bits refer to the 12 least significant bits that identify the UE Context stored at the eNB that allocated the Resume ID.

section_list.name: Bearer Type
aoa: 9.2.92 Bearer Type IE Semantics: This IE is used to support Non-IP data as specified in TS 23.401 [11].

section_list.name: V2X Services Authorized
aoa: This IE provides information on the authorization status of the UE to use the sidelink for V2X services.
9.2.93 Vehicle UE IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Vehicle UE
9.2.93 Pedestrian UE IE Semantics: Indicates whether the UE is authorized as Pedestrian UE

section_list.name: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN
aoa: Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN
9.2.94 Offset of NB-IoT Channel Number to EARFCN IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the offset of the NB-IoT Channel Number to the EARFCN (TS 36.104 [16]).

section_list.name: WT ID
aoa: 9.2.95 CHOICE WT ID Type IE Semantics: This IE is used to identify a WT.

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

section_list.name: WT UE XwAP ID
aoa: 9.2.96 WT UE XwAP ID IE Semantics: The WT UE XwAP ID is allocated by the WT and uniquely identifies a UE over the Xw interface.

section_list.name: UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
aoa: UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
This IE indicates the aggregate maximum bit rate for all radio bearers per UE in the sidelink for V2X services.

9.2.97 UE Sidelink Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate IE Semantics: Value 0 shall be considered as a logical error by the receiving eNB. 9.2.11 Bit Rate - Section Description: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL or by UE in sidelink within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR E-RAB, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. 9.2.11 Bit Rate IE Semantics: The unit is: bit/s

section_list.name: NR Neighbour Information
aoa: 9.2.98 NR Neighbour Information IE Semantics: This IE contains cell configuration information of NR cells that a neighbour node may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.98 NRPCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.98 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.98 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.98 Measurement Timing Configuration IE Semantics: Contains the MeasurementTimingConfiguration inter-node message for the neighbour cell, as defined in TS 38.331 [31].

section_list.name: Extended Bit Rate
aoa: 9.2.99 Extended Bit Rate IE Semantics: This IE indicates the number of bits delivered by E-UTRAN in UL or to E-UTRAN in DL within a period of time, divided by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR bearer, or an aggregated maximum bit rate. The unit is: bit/s

section_list.name: en-gNB UE X2AP ID
aoa: 9.2.100 en-gNB UE X2AP ID IE Semantics: This information element uniquely identifies an UE over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.401 [2]. NOTE: If X2-C signalling transport is shared among multiple interface instances, the value of the en-gNB UE X2AP ID is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance.

section_list.name: SgNB Security Key
aoa: 9.2.101 SgNB Security Key IE Semantics: The SgNB Security Key IE is used to apply security in the en-gNB as defined in TS 33.401 [18]. The S-KgNB which is provided by the MeNB, see TS 33.401 [18].

section_list.name: Target SgNB ID Information
aoa: This IE contains the target SgNB ID used by MeNB to find the target en-gNB.
9.2.112 Global en-gNB ID - Section Description: This IE is used to globally identify an en-gNB (see TS 37.340 [32]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).
9.2.112 en-gNB ID IE Semantics: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the en-gNB.

section_list.name: SCG Configuration Query
aoa: 9.2.103 SCG Configuration Query IE Semantics: The SCG Configuration Query IE is used to request the en-gNB to provide current SCG configuration.

section_list.name: Delivery Status
aoa: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP Sequence Number

9.2.104 Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP Sequence Number IE Semantics: This IE defines the Delivery Status IE of RRC Transfer message. Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in 38.323 [33].

section_list.name: NR Frequency Info
aoa: The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier frequency and bands used in a cell for a given direction (UL or DL) in FDD or for both UL and DL directions in TDD.

9.2.106 NRARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.106 NR Frequency Band IE Semantics: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

9.2.106 Supported SUL band Item IE Semantics: Supplementary NR Operating Band as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.3 that can be used for SUL duplex mode as per TS 38.101-1 table 5.2.-1. The value 80 corresponds to NR operating band n80, value 81 corresponds to NR operating band n81, etc.
9.2.123 SUL Information - Section Description: This IE provides information about the SUL carrier.

9.2.123 SUL ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.114 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.114 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [37].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.114 NR NRB IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [37]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 11, 18, etc.

section_list.name: NR UE Security Capabilities
aoa: This IE defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in NR as defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.107 NR Encryption Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, "first bit" – 128-NEA1, "second bit" – 128-NEA2, "third bit" – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

9.2.107 NR Integrity Protection Algorithms IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: "all bits equal to 0" – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, "first bit" – 128-NIA1, "second bit" – 128-NIA2, "third bit" – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value '1' indicates support and value '0' indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [18].

section_list.name: EN-DC Resource Configuration
aoa: This IE contains the EN-DC resource configuration for an E-RAB, indicating the presence of PDCP at the en-gNB and Lower Layers at MCG and SCG.

section_list.name: PDCP Change Indication
aoa: ENUMERATED (S-KgNB update required, PDCP data recovery required, …)

9.2.109 PDCP Change Indication IE Semantics: The PDCP Change Indication IE is used to require the MeNB to either initiate the security key update or to perform PDCP data recovery towards the UE (see TS 37.340 [15]). The value of S-KgNB update required indicates that the security key in en-gNB needs to be updated. The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that MeNB needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

section_list.name: Served NR Cell Information
aoa: This IE contains cell configuration information of an NR cell that a neighbour eNB may need for the X2 AP interface.
9.2.110 NR-PCI IE Semantics: NR Physical Cell ID
9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.110 5GS-TAC IE Semantics: Broadcast 5GS Tracking Area Code

9.2.110 Configured TAC IE Semantics: This is the TAC configured in the en-gNB, different from the 5GS TAC broadcast in the NR cell and enables application of Roaming and Access Restrictions for EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.110 Served PLMNs IE Semantics: Broadcast PLMNs. If more than maxnoofBPLMNs are needed for NR, they are provided by the Additional PLMNs IE.

aoa: 9.2.115 CHOICE Cell Assistance Type IE Semantics: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR cells. This IE may be refined.

9.2.115 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.115 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests the complete list of served NR cells.

section_list.name: MeNB Resource Coordination Information
aoa: The MeNB Resource Coordination Information IE is LTE resource allocation at MeNB and used at the en-gNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the MeNB and the en-gNB.
9.2.116 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PCell. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.116 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to subframe 0 in a radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

9.2.116 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

9.2.116 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the assumed PSCell. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

9.2.139 MeNB Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the MeNB and used by the SgNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. 9.2.139 MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE Semantics: The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required.

section_list.name: SgNB Resource Coordination Information
aoa: The SgNB Resource Coordination Information IE indicates resources within the bandwidth of the PCell which are not available for use by the MeNB and is used at the MeNB to coordinate resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB.
9.2.117 NR CGI IE Semantics: This IE indicates the PSCell. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).
