9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

9.2.117 UL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to UL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the UL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  . is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The UL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

9.2.117 DL Coordination Information IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "PCell resource not intended to be used for transmission by the sending node", value "1" indicates "PCell resource intended to be used for transmission by the sending node". The bit string spans from the first PRB pair of the first represented subframe to the last PRB pair of the same subframe and then moves to the following PRBs in the following subframes in the same order. Each position is applicable only in positions corresponding to DL subframes. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes (maximum 40). The first position of the DL Coordination Information corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = 0. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of .  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The DL Coordination Information is continuously repeated.

9.2.117 EUTRA Cell ID IE Semantics: Reference cell for UL Coordination Information IE and DL Coordination Information IE. 9.2.14 ECGI - Section Description: The E-UTRAN Cell Global Identifier (ECGI) is used to globally identify a cell (see TS 36.401 [2]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.14 E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRAN Cell Identifier IE value correspond to the value of the eNB ID IE contained in the Global eNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.22) identifying the eNB that controls the cell.

9.2.140 SgNB Coordination Assistance Information - Section Description: The SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the SgNB and used by the MeNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. 9.2.140 SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE Semantics: The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required.

section_list.name: UL Configuration
aoa: 9.2.118 UL UE Configuration IE Semantics: This IE indicates how the UL PDCP is configured for the assisting node. Indicates how the UE uses the UL at the assisting node.

section_list.name: RLC Mode
aoa: 9.2.119 RLC Mode IE Semantics: The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC Mode used for an E-RAB.

section_list.name: Secondary RAT Usage Report List
aoa: 9.2.120 Secondary RAT usage report Item IE Semantics: This IE provides information on the NR resources used with EN-DC as specified in TS 37.340 [32].
9.2.23 E-RAB ID - Section Description: This IE uniquely identifies an E-RAB for a UE.

9.2.120 Start timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [35]. It indicates the start time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.

9.2.120 End timestamp IE Semantics: UTC time encoded in the same format as the first four octets of the 64-bit timestamp format as defined in section 6 of IETF RFC 5905 [35]. It indicates the end time of the collecting period of the included Usage Count UL IE and Usage Count DL IE.
9.2.120 Usage count UL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.
9.2.120 Usage count DL IE Semantics: The unit is: octets.

section_list.name: UE Application layer measurement configuration
aoa: The IE defines configuration information for the QoE Measurement Collection (QMC) function.
9.2.121 Container for application layer measurement configuration IE Semantics: Indicates application layer measurement configuration, see Annex L in [36].
9.2.121 TAC IE Semantics: The TAI is derived using the current serving PLMN.
ENUMERATED (QMC for streaming service, QMC for MTSI service, ...)
9.2.121 Service Type IE Semantics: This IE indicates the service type of UE application layer measurements.

section_list.name: DRB ID
aoa: 9.2.122 DRB ID IE Semantics: This information element uniquely identifies a DRB over the X2 interface within an en-gNB. The usage of this IE is defined in TS 36.331 [9].

section_list.name: SUL Information
aoa: This IE provides information about the SUL carrier.

9.2.123 SUL ARFCN IE Semantics: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS 38.104 [37] section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the SUL carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.
9.2.114 NR Transmission Bandwidth - Section Description: The NR Transmission Bandwidth IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth.
9.2.114 NR SCS IE Semantics: The values scs15, scs30, scs60 and scs120 corresponds to the sub carrier spacing in TS 38.104 [37].

ENUMERATED (nrb11, nrb18, nrb24, nrb25, nrb31, nrb32, nrb38, nrb51, nrb52, nrb65, nrb66, nrb78, nrb79, nrb93, nrb106, nrb107, nrb121, nrb132, nrb133, nrb135, nrb160, nrb162, nrb189, nrb216, nrb217, nrb245, nrb264, nrb270, nrb273, ...)

9.2.114 NR NRB IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the UL or DL transmission bandwidth expressed in units of resource blocks "NRB" (TS 38.104 [37]). The values nrb11, nrb18, etc. correspond to the number of resource blocks "NRB" 11, 18, etc.

section_list.name: Packet Loss Rate
aoa: 9.2.124 Packet Loss Rate IE Semantics: This IE indicates the packet loss rate. Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

section_list.name: Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication
aoa: This IE indicates the resources allocated for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.125 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

9.2.125 Protected Resource List IE Semantics: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.
9.2.125 Protected Resource List Item IE Semantics: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.
9.2.125 Resource Type IE Semantics: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

9.2.125 Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint IE Semantics: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of  and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs.  is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all "1"s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern IE Semantics: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value "0" indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value "1" indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.
9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time Pattern IE Semantics: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Time-periodicity IE Semantics: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

9.2.125 Protected Footprint Start Time IE Semantics: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value "1" corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.
9.2.125 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.
9.2.125 PDCCH Region Length IE Semantics: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

section_list.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
aoa: This IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.
9.2.126 Activation SFN IE Semantics: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources - Section Description: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

9.2.126 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold. 9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern - Section Description: The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.
9.2.128 Subframe Type IE Semantics: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates "regular subframe". Value '1' indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node's subframe 0 in a receiving node's radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the eNB.
9.2.128 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

section_list.name: Data Traffic Resources
aoa: 9.2.127 Data Traffic Resources IE Semantics: The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination. The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value "0" indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value "1" indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of  or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

section_list.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
aoa: The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.
9.2.128 Subframe Type IE Semantics: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

9.2.128 Reserved Subframe Pattern IE Semantics: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates "regular subframe". Value '1' indicates "reserved subframe". For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node's subframe 0 in a receiving node's radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the eNB.
9.2.128 MBSFN Control Region Length IE Semantics: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

section_list.name: Aerial UE subscription information
aoa: 9.2.129 Aerial UE subscription information IE Semantics: This information element is used by the eNB to know if the UE is allowed to use aerial UE function, refer to TS 23.401[12].

section_list.name: User plane traffic activity report
aoa: 9.2.130 User plane traffic activity report IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic activity. "re-activated" shall be only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object

section_list.name: RLC Status
aoa: 9.2.131 Reestablishment Indication IE Semantics: This IE indicates about the RLC configuration change included in the container towards the UE. Indicates that following the change of the radio status, the RLC has been re-established.

section_list.name: RRC config indication
aoa: 9.2.132 RRC config indication IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the type of RRC configuration used at the en-gNB.

section_list.name: PDCP SN Length
aoa: 9.2.133 PDCP SN Length IE Semantics: The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer. This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size.

section_list.name: Bluetooth Measurement Configuration
aoa: This IE defines the parameters for Bluetooth measurement collection.
9.2.134 BT RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 measurement as defined in 37.320 [31].

section_list.name: WLAN Measurement Configuration
aoa: This IE defines the parameters for WLAN measurement collection.
9.2.135 WLAN RSSI IE Semantics: In case of Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M8 as defined in 37.320 [31].
9.2.135 WLAN RTT IE Semantics: For Immediate MDT, it corresponds to M9 as defined in 37.320 [31].

section_list.name: Subscription Based UE Differentiation Information
aoa: This IE is generated by the MME based on the UE subscription information, it provides the Subscription Based UE differentiation Information.
9.2.136 Periodic Communication Indicator IE Semantics: This IE indicates whether the UE communicates periodically or not, e.g. only on demand.
9.2.136 Periodic Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the interval time of periodic communication, the unit is: second
9.2.136 Scheduled Communication Time IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time zone and day of the week when the UE is available for communication.

9.2.136 Day of Week IE Semantics: If Day-Of-Week is not provided this shall be interpreted as every day of the week. Each position in the bitmap represents a day of the week: first bit = Mon, second bit =Tue, third bit =Wed, and so on. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘scheduled. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘not scheduled’.

9.2.136 Time of Day Start IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. If Time-Of-Day-Start is not provided, starting time shall be set to start of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.

9.2.136 Time of Day End IE Semantics: This IE indicates the time to start of the day, each value represent the corresponding second since 00:00 of the day. The value of this IE should be bigger than the value of Time of Day Start IE. If Time-Of-Day-End is not provided, ending time is end of the day(s) indicated by Day-Of-Week.
ENUMERATED (single packet, dual packets, multiple packets, …)

9.2.136 Traffic Profile IE Semantics: "single packet" indicates single packet transmission (UL or DL), "dual packets" indicates dual packet transmission (UL with subsequent DL, or DL with subsequent UL), "multiple packets" indicates multiple packets transmission.
ENUMERATED (battery powered, battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable, not battery powered, …)

9.2.136 Battery Indication IE Semantics: "battery powered" indicates that the UE is battery powered and the battery is rechargeable/replaceable, "battery powered not rechargeable or replaceable" indicates that the UE is battery powered but the battery is not rechargeable/replaceable, "not battery powered" indicates that the UE is not battery powered.

section_list.name: Duplication activation
aoa: 9.2.137 Duplication Activation IE Semantics: The Duplication Activation IE indicates whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not.

section_list.name: LCID
aoa: 9.2.138 LCID IE Semantics: This IE uniquely identifies a LCID for the associated DRB. Corresponds to the LogicalChannelIdentity defined in TS 38.331 [8].

section_list.name: MeNB Coordination Assistance Information
aoa: 9.2.139 MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE Semantics: The MeNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the MeNB and used by the SgNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required.

section_list.name: SgNB Coordination Assistance Information
aoa: 9.2.140 SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE Semantics: The SgNB Coordination Assistance Information IE is provided by the SgNB and used by the MeNB to determine further coordination of resource utilisation between the en-gNB and the MeNB. The absence of this IE indicates that the resource coordination is required.

section_list.name: Desired Activity Notification Level
aoa: 9.2.141 Desired Activity Notification Level IE Semantics: This IE contains information on which level activity notification shall be performed.

section_list.name: Location Information at SgNB
aoa: The Location Information at SgNB IE enables the SgNB to provide the MeNB with information that supports localisation of the UE.
9.2.142 PSCell ID IE Semantics: PSCell of the UE 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.

section_list.name: Interface Instance Indication
aoa: 9.2.143 Interface Instance Indication IE Semantics: The Interface Instance Indication identifies the interface instance the X2AP message is destined for. NOTE: The Interface Instance Indication is allocated so that it can be associated with an X2-C interface instance. The Interface Instance Indication may identify more than one interface instance.

section_list.name: NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset
aoa: 9.2.144 NB-IoT UL DL Alignment Offset IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate the offset between the UL carrier frequency center with respect to DL carrier frequency center. Unit: kHz

section_list.name: Lower Layer presence status change
aoa: ENUMERATED (release lower layers, re-establish lower layers, suspend lower layers, resume lower layers ...)

9.2.145 Lower Layer presence status change IE Semantics: This IE is used to indicate that lower layer resources' presence status shall be changed. If the presence status is set to "release lower layers" or "suspend lower layers", PDCP entities, X2-U bearer resources, S1-U bearer resources and UE context information shall be kept. "re-establish lower layers" shall be only set after "release lower layers" has been indicated. “resume lower layers” shall restore SCG. "resume lower layers" shall be only set after "suspend lower layers" has been indicated.

section_list.name: Cell and Capacity Assistance Information
aoa: The Cell and Capacity Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR or E-UTRA cells and it includes information about cell list size capacity.
9.2.147 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given list.

9.2.115 Cell Assistance Information - Section Description: The Cell Assistance Information IE is used by the eNB to request information about NR cells. 9.2.115 CHOICE Cell Assistance Type IE Semantics: This IE may be refined.
9.2.115 List of Requested NR Cells IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests a limited list of served NR cells.

9.2.115 NR CGI IE Semantics: NR cell for which served NR cell information is requested. 9.2.111 NR CGI - Section Description: The NR Cell Global Identifier (NR CGI) is used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.401 [34]).

9.2.4 PLMN Identity - Section Description: This information element indicates the PLMN Identity. 9.2.4 PLMN Identity IE Semantics: - digits 0 to 9, encoded 0000 to 1001, - 1111 used as filler digit, two digits per octet, - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n -The PLMN identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either -a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or -3 digits from MNC (in case of a 3 digit MNC).

9.2.111 NR Cell Identity IE Semantics: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE value correspond to the value of the en-gNB ID IE contained in the Global en-gNB ID IE (defined in section 9.2.112) identifying the en-gNB that controls the cell.
9.2.115 Complete Information Request Indicator IE Semantics: Included when the eNB requests the complete list of served NR cells.

section_list.name: Maximum Cell List Size
aoa: 9.2.147 Maximum Cell List Size IE Semantics: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given list.

section_list.name: Message Oversize Notification
aoa: This IE indicates the maximum number of cells that can be received in the List of Served Cells NR IE.
9.2.147 Maximum Cell List Size - Section Description: This IE indicates the maximum size the sending node can handle for a given list.

section_list.name: TNL Transport Layer Address Info
aoa: This IE is used for signalling IP addresses of IP-Sec endpoints used for establishment of IP-Sec tunnels.
├─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add List
│  └─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Add Item
9.2.149 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint.
│     └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add List
│        └─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Add Item
9.2.149 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.
└─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Remove List
└─Transport UP Layer Addresses Info to Remove Item
9.2.149 IP-Sec Transport Layer Address IE Semantics: Transport Layer Addresses for IP-Sec endpoint.
└─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove List
└─GTP Transport Layer Addresses To Remove Item
9.2.149 GTP Transport Layer Address Info IE Semantics: GTP Transport Layer Addresses for GTP end-points.

section_list.name: CP Transport Layer Information
aoa: 9.2.150 CHOICE CP Transport Layer Information IE Semantics: This element is used to provide the transport layer information associated with EN-DC X2 control plane transport.

section_list.name: TNL Association Usage
aoa: 9.2.151 TNL Association Usage IE Semantics: This IE indicates the usage of the TNL association. Indicates whether the TNL association is only used for UE-associated signalling, or non-UE-associated signalling, or both.

section_list.name: RAN UE NGAP ID
aoa: 9.2.152 RAN UE NGAP ID IE Semantics: This IE uniquely identifies the UE association over the NG interface within the NG-RAN node.

section_list.name: EPC Handover Restriction List Container
aoa: 9.2.153 EPC Handover Restriction List Container IE Semantics: This IE contains the Handover Restriction List IE specified in TS 36.413 [4] as received by the E-UTRAN from the EPC. The octets of the OCTET STRING are encoded according to the specifications of the Handover Restriction List IE specified in TS 36.413 [4].
